It was delicious! The shrimp I got with my steak was also very good. They are big too!  The service has always been great here. Even when you're greeted at the front, they are super attentive. The second time I was there, we were waiting for a minute (no one was at the front) and when the host came back, he apologized and said we should not have been kept waiting. We really didn't mind, it was only a minute. The fact that he apologized was very nice though.

zD0v0eq3WH_oWyWjbtvqRw.text: Staying at the Circus Circus for the first time I had to check out the steakhouse, hearing so much about the food. Ordered the NY Strip. Absolutely fabulous! Can't wait to bring the family back here! Ty guys great job!

QqHQTPY38wwNEhZMOKGlwQ.text: Went here for my birthday last night. I've lived here in Vegas for 18 months, I've eaten all the steakhouses I can find except this one. Now that I have finally gone here I don't know why I waited so long. This is my new go to steak restaurant. The food was amazing. The service was 5 Diamond level. The drinks never skipped a beat. I can not say one bad thing about this restaurant. You have a customer for life.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8jynIGfBJZQG6yknBefcaw.text: Awesome.  Great, old-school ambiance with the superb sound track of classic standards playing in the background.We were going to another steakhouse when the valet's at Aria suggested we try this place.  Didn't regret It one bit.  The aroma of mesquite cooked meat as you walk in is just marvelous.  The steaks are huge and cooked to perfection.  Highly recommended

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lhJRAkz80kGt6iyw8fxAPA.text: While visiting Las Vegas on a work trip we charged a colleague to make reservations at a steak house... Meat was flavorless, sides were a joke.  Avoid this place.... We should have ran when we found out it was in Circus circus.

GjFz_I48r9kk6oVsZ7Ii1g.text: The Steak House was the only glimmer of light at Circus Circus. As a Texan, I've had steak for dinner more times than I have years under my belt and The Steak House was able to make this Texas girl miss home. The service was by far the most exceptional customer service. The restaurant was full and the only place available was the bar. I'm glad I didn't pass up the opportunity to eat there. The pair behind the bar turn my day around and made for the best company. If in Vegas stop by and do yourself a favor; order the ribeye and make a new friend for life.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Steak Ever
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mouthwatering

UEAl2KiyxpPN5xiaqY-e-A.text: Went for our Anniversary, it was amazing. They really took care of us, the food was delicious.... Cooked to perfection. You have to try the bean soup served with sherry was really cool. Lastly Felix was our Server and he was brilliant. Thanks again for a memorable evening

Ar_IyogovDyrPARL2TGNHw.text: Always enjoy the steakhouse at circus circus the bar tending is awesome I always eat at the bar! I love the bar tenders tonight John and Lea do a fantastic job! There the reason I keep coming back. Lea has served me st least 10 times this year very professional and a great person. I will continue to keep coming back.

Qzh4hxQEN5neRC1GHZdUxQ.text: I liked my meal here, I think the ambiance is better than the food. It feels like an old school steakhouse that has been around for forever and I think that's because it has. It feels like a restaurant you would eat at in the Godfather or Goodfellas. The food was good, I had the ribeye with crab legs. Everything was solid, nothing was unbelievably exceptional. The steak was well cooked, the crab legs were split, the potatoes and soup were solid, it was good but I think there are better food options in Vegas. The fact that it is in Circus Circus is a little annoying since I don't really like that casino but they can't help that.

D9HbUaWJXd4xLLXrccUvxg.text: Portion is more than enough for two. The house salad was absolutely what I had expected. The blue cheese, fresh croutons, and crisp lettuce. I had the porterhouse with bone in, a little on the bland side but nothing s little horseradish cannot fix. I wanted to add a crust, but was afraid it might be too over powering. I love the old school ambience, although it's way before my time. I find the whole Sinatra era to be fascinating. This gem is hidden in a not so luxurious casino, next to a souvenir shop.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Porterhouse with baked potato.
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad with dinner

PMGF51G5fpCBcul_0MvlgQ.text: Such a surprise - had no idea you could find a first-rate steakhouse in Circus Circus Hotel, of all places.  We didn't have reservations, but did manage to get our party of 5 in around 7:00 pm on a Sunday. We were worried that we weren't very well dressed, but that didn't seem to be an issue. (Dress in the restaurant was varied, from more dressy to business casual to...uh...less casual, as we were!)  My prime rib was very flavorful. Not the very best I've ever had (House of Prime Rib, San Francisco), but it was pretty close.  My dining companions' entrees were equally good (grilled shrimp, salmon, and rib-eye steak).  Desserts were very good as well - my creme brulee was fantastic. The creme brulee sampler was apparently ok, but the plain vanilla flavored was the best of the 4 samples.  The service was great, CHAE was our server, and he was wonderful - thanks!!  They gave us a big tray of Andes mints with our bill.  Yum!  I would definitely come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smaller prime rib entree

Vu-kTNzO9LdsHc-YrMjAEw.text: Upon several recommendations we tried The Steak House. Great experience from the moment we walked in, seated right away, met Mike our waiter and away we went. Salads were great, meat perfect, cocktails outstanding and desert we really didn't need was great. Great old school flavor.  Next time in Vegas, we will be back.

80s9QwDUgNRiEAq-tsA8Qw.text: Can't leave anything less than 5 stars.  Classic steakhouse with extras.  Just a great place.  Food excellent. Had prime rib. Blue. Got it as ordered.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nW7zPtfeUHfmgNplnsykPQ.text: This place is a diamond in the rough for sure. My parents had fond memories of this place and so when we met up with my parents for my dad's birthday this is where he chose to eat dinner. I was a little skeptical but turned out to be pleasantly surprised. The Steak House is very old school Vegas. The interior is typical, dark steak house but you really do fee like you have been transported back in time. Maybe it was the Sinatra tunes playing. Anyway, the food. The food was amazing. I ordered the New York Strip and boy was is it a strip! I was expecting the size to be about half of what it actually was because I am used to these newer, fancier steak houses getting greedy with portions. Not the case here. I ordered it medium well and it was cooked to perfection. My strip came with garlic mashed potatoes and asparagus. Nice sides but the New York Strip was the star of the show. The place is a little pricey but unlike other steak houses, sides come with the meal and so you don't have to pay a la carte for anything other than your steak. Anyway, I don't think you will be disappointed if you check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Strip with garlic mashed potatoes and asparagus. Excellent.

ihP9GrOdk-XA92QdHV8RUw.text: Top quality steakhouse!!  Ordered the NY Strip med rare!  Outstanding!  Cooked perfectly tasted sooooooo goooooood!   If a steakhouse is great they can deliver a great NY steak and THE Steakhouse does exactly that.  When in Vegas and you want steak, come here.  Great service as well.  Attentive friendly service.  Prices are better than other steakhouses on the strip.  Great value.  Just go!  Oh...... Steaks are charbroiled!!  A RAREity!!  Thanks

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pit!

yb8ZN7IWx2GdQJeSbzdZLQ.text: I was pleasantly surprised how good this restaurant was. After walking through the disgusting run down Circus Circus casino was this amazing diamond in he rough. This is a very high class steak house who knows how to age cook & serve an amazing steak. We also had their shrimp cocktail as an appetizer and these were huge & tasty Shrimp. Service was very good. If you can get past the Circus Circus gross casino this is worth a visit.

uw-AkD_TMRGW4F1547Dqsg.text: Really OLD SCHOOL vegas here in the ever getting worse Circus Circus hotel the Steakhouse brings back that old Vegas feel.  Can't believe this place is in this location as if it was anywhere else forget about it.   It was however packed on this Friday night.   Arrive early to our 8PM reservation and have a drink in the bar where generous pours are offered. A View of the meat locker where they 21 day age their "CHOICE" not Prime steak is interesting as all cuts are done on premise.  The 18 lb Nova Scotia lobster sitting in the window is also a must see.   Finally seated at nice table "CHAE" our waiter who has been there 29 years takes care of us all evening.   Start with 2 Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail each $40.00 for 8 pieces brilliantly displayed with ice, lemon and mayo & cocktail sauce with Atomic pure horse radish on the side.  Delicious shrimp.   All entrees include soup or salad,  choice of Garlic mashed, baked potatoe, or wild rice and vegetables.   Salads were ice cold with crumbled blue cheese dressing.  Very nice presentation with fresh lettuce and vegetables.   Entrees:  Giant Fred Flintstone Bone in Prime Rib that was absolutely mouth watering.   The Giant Filet Mignon & Bone In Rib Eye were  good while  the NY Strip was like the prime rib Standouts.  Garlic mashed were excellent while baked potatoe was average.   Cheesecake and chocolate mousse cake for desert were excellent as well.   Service some of the best I've seen and price points for food consumed incredible.  Manager Ron Randazzo stopped by to say hello and chat with us after our meal.  Certainly on my surprise places in Vegas and a must go for any traveler. really a treat.

zxTK7ufH9Q7SzZvGJxH0wg.text: This place was awesome. We got a recommendation from our cab driver who said it's the best Steak house in Vegas. Boy, he was not lying. We showed up not knowing that we needed a reservation. The hostess tells us we may not be able to be seated. The manager comes around the corner and tells us that he is going to check if he has room. Comes back a min later we got a table. Which was awesome for them to squeeze us in. The food was out of this World. The white pepper corn sauce was amazing on everything. Will definitely have to come back my next Vegas trip.

dmbt-Ik_s6yF8iifQXvm0g.text: Came here tonight for my birthday because it was recommended by some family and it was delicious, even the house salad with blue cheese dressing. I got the rib -eye and it was best I've had. Be aware that this can feed an army. Mashed potatoes were good but not great, in my opinion. Definitely still worth it.

4wx5T1kw77pvAi8WAOBSmQ.text: Looking for a good steak on a one night stay in Las Vegas, thought I'd try the steak house in circus circus. The restaurant is nice and clean, waiters were prompt and courteous as would be expected in a fine dining restaurant. I ordered a bone in ribeye and ordered medium rare, I hesitated a bit because I have had experience with getting a medium steak before, but i thought, no this is a well publicized  steak house, surely they know the difference. To my disappointment the steak was medium the waiter did not come around after the delivery of the food so I was unable to tell him and not wanting to hold up the rest of the group, I finished most of the steak. The meat was just ok, they made up for the lack of flavor with the quantity it was a big piece of meat. If you go there and want medium rare make sure you tell the waiter to ask the chief to make sure its medium rare.You might give advice  for the chief that meat (beef) continues to cook after it's taken off the grill.  I'll keep looking for a good steak when in Vegas again.

qVbxORoylrYZlDwjkWnLVw.text: the steaks were excellent, as the  soup.  I thought prices were high. at one time the Steak house was reasonably priced, but no more.

odsxbvgk4m38fhrZilZuhw.text: The service wa strange for a fine dining establishment. Our server seems overburden but was pleasant. The porterhouse and shrimp cocktail was wonderful, the sides left a little to be desired the potatoes taste like they came out of the box although the  asparagus was excellent. The food came in  large portions.

t6XsDh3h-VAvxNBRPJfZNQ.text: One of the best in the city.  A great and True steak house with everything you'd expect + on the menu.  Top drawer from start to finish.  Food, service and atmosphere are perfect.  Done 'right' $125 per person.

Mr6FotWnQgSh1P0fccJr4Q.text: This is a great restaurant to enjoy a great meal.  It is probably the sixth time we have dined here and have never been disappointed.  We had guests in from out east and decided to have them join us for a special dining experience.  This restaurant is one of my favorite places to have a nice aged filet.  The filet came with fresh asparagus and a baked potato(loaded).  My hat goes off to Richard our server who helped make the experience great.  The Circus Circus may get a bad rap in the past.  However, I noticed  it has invested some $$ in cleaning up the casino as we walked through to the The Steak House. If you haven't tried this place you have to give it a chance.  I'm certain you will be pleased with your experience.

6LB6cMxUGlWs2geG8KnypA.text: My first time here after hearing rave reviews for years but not wanting to go to circus circus. This place totally exceeded my expectations. Wait staff was extremely friendly and knowledgable . Food was amazing . I ordered the bone in rib eye & my man friend ordered the filet. The filet was pretty good, but the rib eye was spectacular! Soooo tender and juicy. And they did med rare just right!  For dessert we had choc cake and coffee. Overall very impressed with the ambiance, staff, and food.

XU43zqyLabC6nWGg-7CBxQ.text: Wait a minute, there's actually a good steakhouse at Circus Circus??  My husband mentioned that he had heard about this place through friends and coworkers. Surprisingly, it was supposed to be pretty good. So we decided to come here on a weekday after work, hoping it would be less crowded. I was able to call 2 hours ahead of time to get a reservation. I haven't been to this hotel since I was a kid, but man this place is run down. Definitely the hang out spot for high school kids.   First of all, it is very easy to miss this place. We came early and walked by without even knowing it. They are located across Market Express, between two gift shops (don't remember the names of them). We were lucky enough to get a booth. An hour later, the restaurant was filling up. I heard a couple asking one of the servers if they could sit at a booth, but were told "no" because they were "booked with reservations."   Service was pretty good throughout the night. Our servers were friendly, attentive and knowledgeable. As for the food, the menu was very simple. I really like how dinner INCLUDED bread, chef's vegetables, soup or salad, and choice of baked potato, garlic mashed potatoes or wild rice. That's right, no extra charges for these sides! I ordered the Petite Filet Mignon. It was good, but unfortunately not the best that I have had. It was cooked well and easy to cut and enjoy. However, it wasn't as flavorful as I wanted it to be. I guess that was the purpose of the Bearnaise Sauce, which was alright. Usually, I don't eat my steaks with sauces. On the other hand, my husband really enjoyed his Porterhouse. We also ordered Fries Our Way, which FYI, is fries cooked in duck fat. It was nice and crunchy on the outside, but tasted like regular fries to me! For dessert, we shared the Tiramisu. Out server said that they had "the best one in town." Not so sure about that, LOL, but I thought it was still good and not too sweet. Although, I feel like they were a bit stingy with the lady fingers.   Overall, it was a good dinner, so I would definitely consider returning again. They also give you a bunch of Andes after you pay your bill!

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite Filet Mignon
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries Our Way
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu

Drnj-n1ko9ErTjtz47hZ8g.text: This possible one of the only places Iv'e seen make huge claims about it's food and or especially steak. My family and I were in vacation from Maui Hawaii. We heard this place was good and all and especially before you enter their is like awards on the wall. But when we walked in it was dark and dead. Their was barley anyone in their. It was five us but when we were sitting down looking at the prices and it was beyond ridiculous. I ordered Salmon and my mother ordered Shrimp both of our plates were over $50 USD. My other family members got steak and when we got our plates we chuckled simply because first of all the amount of food you getting is nothing compared to the price. We live in Hawaii and we know how expensive food is but this was beyond ridiculous. The claims of it being great were seriously just so unTrue. I was like hoping my food taste good but no it was very plain no taste and just no wow factor. Like was a very boring dish of over $60 luckily I didn't end up paying but still it was just terrible. We just never will comeback to a place like this. It's really not worth it and the place is overrated by people who think they are classy because they eat at such restaurant.   FINAL JUDGEMENT   4 STARS---Customer Service 2 STARS---Taste of Food (Iv'e tasted better) 1 STAR-----Pricing (NOT WORTH IT)  3.5 STARS-Cleanse  3.5 STARS-Restaurant Appeal (Old Fashion Classic) 1 STAR-----Claims of Quality (Didn't cut it) 3 STARS---Presentation (It depends on what you order)  RATING AVERAGE:  2.6 STARS (DON'T RECOMMEND TO ANYONE) Go elsewhere for steak. I'm giving it a 1 star based on my overall view. Only go if you really want to try.

819xzuRpLn7gYD82wWf0Rw.text: NAB early dinner reservation. Booth.  Great! Nice. Oysters OK. Filet Not. But suddenly party of 8 seated center of room thought this a Pizza joint. Asked waiter if mgr. could tone it down. Observed others trying to dine, converse quietly Saturday night 6PM . Nothing. got worse.  Been  to restaurant before. Touted rating" best steak house:"  over rated. Have to dodge children and scooters to find the place. walked out $200+ for 2. Go to the Redwood Grill, Californian. Worked in white cloth restaurants in Seattle when young, never would have happened.

9ituQBEtlfFZusj4n5X1jg.text: AAU tournament forced me to stay at Circus Circus. I enjoy a good steak and decided to give this place a shot.  I ordered a New York. I lucked out and it was seasoned well, grilled perfectly (medium well).  Pricey compared to other steakhouses but if they are consistent, well worth it.

aBcnHgZtzOtpnNjDZDs--w.text: I was surprisingly pleased with the dinner we had at The Steakhouse a month ago since I arrived with low expectations.  We had originally wanted to try out Gordon Ramsey's steak house when we were in town, but when our friend inquired about reservations for a Saturday night, they were (not surprisingly) fully booked.  When our friend Chris told us he made reservations at this place, I was taken aback since it's been at least twenty years since I stepped foot on the Circus Circus property nor had much of a desire to on this trip.  Oh well, we decided to leave our hesitation behind and try this place out with an open mind.  This restaurant has been around for ages and when we told our taxi hailing guy at Vdara to hail a cab for us to go to Circus Circus, he said it was an excellent choice for a steak dinner and supposedly all the big wig Vegas honchos still dine there.  When we arrived, our friends were at the bar enjoying a few cocktails.  It felt a little dated in there, but more classic than old trendy if that makes any sense.  There was lots of emerald green walls, burgundy booth seats and lots of hunted animal heads decorating the walls nearby.  Our server was attentive and kept our water goblets consistently filled with bottled Arrowhead water at no extra charge.  I liked how the meals were accompanied with soup or salad, baked potatoes or garlic mashed potatoes and a side of veggies. Since the veggies served that night was asparagus, it was accompanied by some yummy Hollandaise sauce on the side.  I opted for the eight ounce filet since that was more than enough for my appetite.  All their steaks are aged for 21 days and when I took my first bite into my steak, I was a very happy girl.  It was seasoned nice and cooked to medium perfection.  I enjoyed my steak so much that it made me glad that reservations at Gordon Ramsey's uber expensive restaurant didn't work out for us.  I also enjoyed the garlic mashed potatoes and the asparagus, but the garden salad I had before all of this was just okay.  Overall we had a great meal and I liked how I was able to charge our part of our meal to our room back at Vdara since it was all part of the same corporate umbrella.  My room reservation included a $50 dining credit thanks to making my reservation through AmEx's travel site, so I'm glad it went toward a meal I actually enjoyed.  Would I go back here to enjoy a nice dinner?  I actually would.  For it to be around for as long as it has, it speaks volumes that it can weather the storm in it's not so fancy hotel despite all the other competing, pricier steak restaurants opening up on the ever changing Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petit filet, this was good!
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Starter salad

G58Jsm64ZmlyaoPSxLnN2A.text: Yes, it's True but so weird. A nice upscale steakhouse in Circus Circus... I came here with my friends for a bachelor party dinner without the actual bachelor (don't ask). So if you saw a bunch of awesome guys in suits walking by your kids holding their carnival prize stuffed animals, that would have been us.  This place had everything I would expect from a great steak house. The decor is dimly lit very upscale. The staff is very formal and polite. What's also interesting is that the kitchen is actually in the middle of the seating area so you can see the chefs preparing all the food.  The rib-eye I ordered was huge and perfectly cooked medium rare. It had been aged and the taste was amazing. And unlike some other steak houses, the entrees come with salad and your choice of sides. The garlic mash potatoes were delicious.

lfT3akXD5uFIZiwHmLmaww.text: Went here for our anniversary dinner. I ordered the rib eye and my wife ordered the dry rub small fillet. Steaks were cooked like we ordered. Great flavor.  Our waiter Chae was great.  For some reason I expected more for the price we paid. At the end of the meal my wife saw them putting strake in the cooler that were in vacuum bags. This was disappointing.  Still, the food was very good and they brought us out a piece of cake for free because it was our anniversary.  We probably won't go back, but we had to go because it has been there for so many years.  Restrooms were clean and the restaurant too.  Thanks again to Chea for his great service!!

_dumGg8dMmRhxvaEMTZOhg.text: So first I have to say that I work for MGM Resorts, the company that owns Circus Circus.   However, like most people who live in a tourist destination, we eat close to home.  Tonight was my Dad's 77th birthday.  He's a meat and potatoes guy, so we made a reservation at The Steakhouse at Circus Circus.    Even though it is voted best Steakhouse in Vegas for many years, we haven't eaten here   I have to say...incredible.   My 13 yr old son, had the rib eye, and asked if we could come here more often.    I had the New York Strip was incredible.   My husband had the Chili Glazed Salmon was awesome.   The staff is incredible.  Our Server, Relu, has worked here 26 years and was incredible!    There is a private room that seats a small party that was perfect ambience.  My Dad couldn't have had a better birthday!   FYI.  Crab cakes are to die for!!!!

AiyMGDPwFsVDub0lrxcH1A.text: Classic, proper, old school steakhouse. As so many people mention in reviews, the only real drawback is that it's located inside Circus Circus. Though it seems that detail has not slowed down this staple beef slingin' joint.  Beautiful aged steaks and a very simple basic menu. No frills but everything is elegant and delicious. The staff too is pragmatic in their service approach but absolutely dedicated and hospitable. There's really very little to go on about. This is a classy but not stuffy restaurant. Their approach rests upon the theory that if you serve good food in a traditionally attractive setting by a professional food service team... people will come and they will return. Their approach has proven True.  I will return and return again. Good form!

bCOVKBPJ7vQvWDyZV8jxuA.text: This review is long overdue. It was our 8th year Anniversary yesterday, and we decided to go to one of our favorite steak houses. The steak house is located in Circus circus, not hard to find.As you enter the steakhouse, you could smell the delicious beef grilling, and you can even see the beef hanging in the glass freezer. We were graciously greeted by the GM Ron. I have to say we've have had dinner at many steakhouses, and I have never seen a GM work the room along with his wait staff like Ron. He is an example of True team player and a great manager. We've been coming here for years,because of the hospitality and the fine food.  Chae was our server and he was excellent. He kept our drinks filled and was at our service. Our dinner started off with two cocktails, a lemon drop and a cosmopolitan, which we cutting edge..We had a prawns cocktail, the prawns were fresh and huge. Bread basket came out hot, and what a nice variety of breads. Our bone in ribeye was cooked to perfection, tender, and juicy. Mash potatoes were creamy, and asparagus grilled just right. They even brought out a complimentary dessert with a candle which was very nice. Thank you to Ron and staff for a memorable evening, we will definitely be back.

r82RXHCKkK1rukZJUI4N6g.text: This place used to be good years ago but now it's fallen off.  The rib eye tasted turrible *Charles Barkley voice*.  For the price I rather go to Ruth Chris or Capitol Grille.

g9Ab71GImVB-y3lHceodTQ.text: This was the first time I had stepped foot in Circus Circus since The Adventure Dome opened when I was 15 years old.  I didn't have a reason to come back, except to try The Steakhouse, which had been bookmarked for awhile, but since I'm not a steak aficionado, it had been put on the back burner.   We were seated at the bar for a glass of wine before dinner, our bartender was as old as the building, and I loved it. The decor was straight out of the 80's complete with floral walls, silk flowers and old wood paneling. We were seated in a corner booth, and to continue with the 80's theme, the booth was a lovely maroon color, contrast with the bookshelves above us. This is old school Vegas....not too cheesy.   Bread basket was amazing, full of pretzel rolls (my favorite) and several different types of crackers and dinner rolls. I ordered the Petit Filet medium well, it was delicious. Perfect cut and temperature. What was amazing about this is, your dinner comes with vegetables AND choice of soup or salad, garlic mashed potatoes, rice or baked potato. All of this for $47. This isn't your typical a la carte steak house where your sides will run $10 each.   Our server was great, what I noticed was, they leave you alone! Thank you! I don't need you to ask me every 2 minutes when I have a mouthful of food, if I'm ok. They deliver your food, and let you be.   For the price, you seriously can't go wrong. Good quality food, great service without a celebrity chef name attached or any pretentious people.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The steak is a big as my friends husbands head
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing bread basket. Look at all those pretzel rolls!
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our bartender

XRdb9pd4qEZxAM53BDclCQ.text: Talk about a *Diamond in the Rough*  The Diamond being The Steakhouse of course & the Rough? Well that's obviously Circus Circus (sorry CC fans).   A diamond in every way... As soon as you walk in, you're transported to a different land than the circus circus Resort. Been going here since I was a little girl & it's never anything short of spectacular. I've always said that it has to be the most underrated & unknown spot in Vegas. Most people do not believe me when I say that this is the must-go-to dinner in Vegas, but they're never sorry and always grateful for the suggestion.   My go to'a are a delicious New York steak & their fat open face crab legs. Yum yum and more yum. But believe me when I say, you cannot go wrong here.

UIsQ5pE4Z_ofhJM8ZlAstA.text: The best steakhouse in Las Vegas! Unfortunately, it's in Circus Circus. There is no other reason to come to the Double C, except for this award winning steak house. Steaks run around $50 per steak, but they are the best! The place is lovely with dark woods and low light, very old school classy. Plus, the service is impeccable! Make sure and tip well, the food and the service are worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of the awards they have won.
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite filet.
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The picture is dark, but this is the New York Strip.

dDH0t936SWbn20HW6_9hEw.text: I really wanted to like this place.  The old school Las Vegas decor was awesome!  The service not so much.  We had a reservation and were seated without a problem.  The waiter came by with menus and took our drink orders.  He came back 10-15 min. later and asked what we would like to drink.  Wait...what?  I reiterated what we would like to drink without actually calling him on his mistake.  He took our orders and retreated.  No apologies or anything.  We received our salads and were half way through eating them when the drinks finally showed up.  Ugh!  For the price of our meals I expected much more.  Completely disinterested service.

2yurD9HN7VFtRCs4mvg2lA.text: FANTASTIC! Just got back from Vegas and my 4th visit to this fabulous establishment. Worth the trip up the strip.   Best if you make reservations.   The Sirloin is my favorite with the Porterhouse a close second.   Ask for Mitch!!

G0dTUiCp4LanRt7yQYlySg.text: The steak was dry and not flavorful. I'm only giving two stars because I guess pricing is good relative to other steakhouses. The service was terrible, except for the runner who overheard me say it was the worst service ( he was so nice and apologized and now I feel so guilty). I also had a special request for a birthday dessert for my mom since it was her Birthday which never came. EPIC FAIL OF LIFE!! Do not be cheap, go to a more expensive steakhouse on the strip  This is an update! I took it from two to one star. I wrote the review while sitting at the dinner table. My mom has been throwing up for hours now. Could this experience have gotten any worse?!?!

0-w3NvbSYK-KWez7vuR_Zw.text: THE only reason to step inside Circus Circus is this place.  Straight up old school feel.  I like the windowless, dark wood trim, cigar lounge atmosphere.  You feel like it's a place where a mob hit get confirmed by one of the bosses.  Straight up gangster.    The menu is simple - filet, porterhouse, rib eye, new york strip, lamb and seafood,  Really, going to a place called THE Steakhouse, how could one not get some beef?  No lamb or seafood for me.  The filet was not as tender as a filet should be.  Even though it was overcooked, the cut was still decent.  The ribeye cut however, was prepared much better.  The cut was cooked just as requested and the juicy fatty flavors really shined through.  For a high end steakhouse, the prices are just a hair under the average.  In short, great eats for the coin and a definite recommend vs. the other steakhouse chains that dot the strip.

IRoTXnkWZV_o4dN2eSdyLA.text: As a regular to the glitzy shimmering lights of the Las Vegas bling, this place is a hidden gem. It is tucked away from the usual ritzy celebrity chef named restaurants. It is not on any billboards or phony paid advertisements, instead it is located in a dilapidated legacy era 90s casino-Circus-Circus. The steaks here are aged to perfection, and they are proud of it since it is confidently displayed in the middle of the restaurant for everyone to see. The ambience is nice but not so uptight where you need to have formal attires. Expect to make a reservations a few days before your visit, especially if you plan on attending during the busy holiday season. The servers are friendly, relax and attentive without laying on the thick sales pitch. I love this place and would definitely recommend this steak house to a friend.

Q9tObAkLsN_A0fSaA_g5PA.text: My husband and I have been coming here for 9 years to celebrate our anniversary. The food is still very good, but the last 2 years our waiter has hardly stoken 2 words to us. Thank goodness for the busers having a personality and checking in with us. They used to be so friendly. Plus, you have to pay $10 to valet on top of a tip, and it 10 minutes to get our car. This will probably be our last year coming here. Time to start a new tradition.

8k890UxNsw146SrxozKlqg.text: My boyfriend and I visited The Steakhouse on 2/18/17 at 8 pm. I was already thrilled that they were able to take us at this time, when initially they did not have anything available until 10 pm! This was our very first time here, but we had heard great things about this place. The old school decor is great, I loved the dark room, the burgundy booths and the green walls.  Our waiter took quite a while to take our order, but we weren't too upset since they did us a favor by taking us at 8 pm anyway. My boyfriend and I ordered the same thing, rib eye steak cooked medium rare, baked potato & salad, plus a bottle of wine. We received our salads promptly and they were great! We received our steaks about 30 minutes later and we were in awe at how beautiful the steak looked on the outside, but we were so disappointed on what it looked like on the inside. My steak was served to me well done. It was tough, hard to cut with a knife, and simply too over done. My boyfriend received a better cooked steak, but even his was more on the medium side than medium rare. Our waiter came back to check on us and asked about our steaks and at that time we let him know they were overcooked. He did ask if we wanted to send it back (which I don't know why you would ask that really. I ordered something I technically didn't receive, most places would just take it, apologize and get you a new one).  We let him know that the wait time was just too much at that point to get another one anyway, we didn't want to wait another half hour or so. Honestly at this point I was so sad and disappointed. I wanted a romantic date night with my boyfriend, you know, steak dinner, wine, candlelight, but when you don't get it all, and it comes at a price, it really sucks. $66 dollar steak and I could have gotten a better one elsewhere for less. I really had high hopes! The place is so cool looking, it's surprising it's in such a lackluster casino.  Once we gave up on our meals, our waiter offered a dessert on the house, but unfortunately at that point, no $10-$15 dessert is going to make up for our $132 we spent on 2 overcooked steaks. We just wanted to leave. Our tab for 2 rib eyes, a bottle of wine was $182.00! We would hope we would have at least received a discount, but no dice. It was unfortunate, and I would think this is just a fluke, but I doubt I will return to this restaurant.

oAfsDcetqLVj5KLtf2VaaQ.text: David is our waiter and his service is Amazing. Very attentive, knows the menu, gave excellent recommendations, and just a pleasure! The manager is also great. We were late due to traffic, and he held our reservation, and quickly accommodated us. The chef is a tall gentlemen they call shorty, let me tell you..:Amazing as well! So happy our hotel recommended this place. At first we were like..:Circus Circus???  You must come here! The rib eye bone in is tender and melts in your mouth. The black bean soup is heavenly, comes with Sherry and onions, would like to give 10+ here.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in rib-eye

AeInYAl6KfN5eoZOnyL3RQ.text: Great old time ambiance... Classy and nostalgic.  The steak?? Give it a try, you won't be disappointed and you'll walk out full, happy, and feeling like you got your money's worth, and then some!

DPE8VWM1GaXmB7L6donrXg.text: A great steakhouse inside Circus Circus? You must be joking. Oh, how jaded we were.  Came here after hearing about this place from several locals... Made a reservation and our group came in after a round of golf.   Liked the old school ambiance, I almost expected to see a large wise guy chowing down in the corner booth with an arm candy in tow. Perhaps I've just watch too many gangster movies.  Got the rib eye, cooked to mid-rare. It was excellent. Portion size was large, and yes I ate the whole thing. Loved the charr on the outside, it really brings out that smokey taste with the steak.   Great service to boot.  Will definitely be back again.

XYHs0G-5t71kgiUmIgSl1w.text: This is by far one of the BEST steakhouses I have ever been to. The portions were well worth the amount paid and the service was outstanding. Ray and Fernando were extremely friendly and attentive the entire night. I ordered the salmon fillet while my SO ordered the New York strip and it was amazing. Both meals had us satisfied, we will definitely be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UtkqD8O69UJuydc8JOO8sA.text: Little gem in Vegas! Best steak I have had, aged in a drying room which you can see. Great service. Prices not to bad. Go!

m6dgK0EKzQyOCqX87uhJ2A.text: Great service. Steak was NO BUENO-   My wife and I were celebrating our 26th wedding anniversary we have reservations for 5 o'clock on a Thursday night there was only two other couples there when we arrived nice and quiet just like we like it. Our waiter was very friendly very courteous and very knowledgeable very attentive. My wife and I ordered a bone in ribeye steak and a baked potato. She and I share the steak and a potato all the time. We basically starve ourselves all day so we can enjoy the meal. But when our steak came, it had absolutely no flavor to it I don't know if they didn't add any salt but it had no flavor at all but again we were so hungry we ate it. We were very disappointed because every time we go to Las Vegas this is the only steakhouse that we like to go to and we've never ever had any issues with our meals.  It lacked the WOW FACTOR!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9k57rPdUwOtuYb5wGTxTkg.text: I almost feel bad writing this review because I've seen so many reviews of people having an amazing experience. Yet my husband and I did not whatsoever.   Growing up in Las Vegas, with most of my family working in the restaurant industry, I do have a high standard especially for steakhouses.  On a positive note, my steak filet was delicious and the atmosphere was incredible!!  Ok now the reality of the situation, our server was the worst I've ever had. We would have preferred our busser to be our actual server because he was very attentive.  Our server came over to us after 40 minutes of being seated. We noticed he did not have more than 3 other tables. He was very attentive to all the other tables like a real server would be in a fine dining steakhouse.   We didn't know whether to leave or not. After the 40 minutes of being greeted we had to wait even longer to have our order be taken because he rushed to say he was our server and took off before we could say we were ready to order. Although we were more than ready because it took so long!  Overall he did not seem eager to please or show us any attention. Our food came in 10 minutes which was shocking. I don't know whether that was good or not. Because usually in fine dining it takes time to prepare the food as well as enjoy each course and beverage.  After finishing our main course we were eager to order dessert. Taking another 20 minutes for our server to appear, we had enough. He finally seemed to realize how upset we were and offered to give us free dessert, but we did not accept it. We were not willing to wait.  Unfortunately we were not only disappointed by the service, but also the majority of the food.  My husband ordered the twin lobster tail entree. He said it was chewy and overcooked. The side of baked potato and asparagus were not seasoned. His black bean soup was fine, but nothing special.  I almost hope what happened to us was an off night of the restaurant and server because clearly there are great reviews on Yelp.  However we will never go back to try it again. And told friends, family, and tourists this is the last restaurant we would ever recommend.

nal1R-R9FBSQiqh5QkExaw.text: Not my favorite. I had high hopes and the food was just meh. Too much dressing on their wedge and the ribeye was very very tough.  Potato was just a potato so it was good? Just wish they had more vegetable selection other than asparagus.  I think I had high hopes because I've heard raving reviews of this gem inside The Circus! Maybe I missed the boat, but I wish they would really make this place stand with excellent food.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Added all the fixings to the potatoes

3Ij_o9YjIcdiBtdKVQggHA.text: This is the Steak House inside Circus Circus. Not bad but not great. If Las Vegas was a one-horse town and this was the steak house, of course I'd go. But, this is Vegas where some of the best steak is prepared in America.  My steak was grilled medium-rare just like I like it. No complaints.  Seafood appetizers were tasty but not special. In the age of celebrity chefs and gourmet everything, The Steak House has stayed in the 80s.  Let me say it one more time. Every part of the meal was prepared well and table service was good.  Vegas has more to offer steak diners.  Vive Las Vegas! And Bon Appetit.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large elegant tables
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Open food prep kitchens

ymvg2EN8um2t0WvX-2B9Yw.text: Overrated!  This place is overrated. The waiter we had seemed irritated that we were there. My friend had a 1/2 order of shrimp cocktail and got 2 shrimp for $14 and I had a petite prime rib which cost $57. (Which, by the way, is one of the cheapest things on the menu...) The prime rib was just OK but had way too much fat on it - I've had better prime rib in several other steak places and at a cheaper price too. I'm not sure why this place gets such high ratings... the black bean soup was very good but my friend said her French onion soup was way too salty. The pretzel rolls were one of the best things we got. Also, we were not asked if we wanted anything else- just given the bill. Overall way too expensive for what you get - go to fremont street and go to the chart house in the golden nugget - a little cheaper and the food is much better...

dpz1XJ3Gn1f2SSjT75pepA.text: The dark, jewel-tone architecture of this old-school steakhouse is fantastic and the main reason I visited, however I was disappointed by the service and the food. When you order a steak, you also get a salad and side, which is cool, however the salad is clearly pre-made and stored in a very cold fridge. This meant that they served the salad to me at ice-cold temperatures, nearly frozen, which made eating the cucumbers and beets impossible. For the $70 price of the steak, I would expect a non-frozen salad.  Secondly, they have only one bartender to make drinks for the table patrons and the bar patrons, and there is a steady stream of table waiters barking orders at the bartender to get drinks for their tables, making for poor atmosphere and distracted service at the bar.

nKdFdenAE5-TdrxVADoJnw.text: The Steak House was a great experience. It is off the main casino but sits tucked down a hallway as opposed to being right off the main way like all of the other restaurants. Once at the front desk, it is clear this place is a literal time capsule from over 20 years ago. From the red colored booths to the aged lighting fixtures and carpeting, the feel and ambiance was nothing short of old school. I felt like I was going to look over and at some point see Al Pacino. Ok, ok, on to the food...We started with a half dozen oysters in the half shell. Delicious and fresh! Their flavor popped with a little horse radish and cocktail sauce. I had the NY strip with mashed potatoes and asparagus. The steak was cooked to perfection and the mashed and asparagus tied the meal together beautifully. Our server was great and had a sense of humor while still being very professional. If you want a unique dining experience with guaranteed fantastic food, this is the place. Also, they were more than willing to accommodate gluten free which is always appreciated :)

V_B2bf70iYw2_IZ9DE8uHQ.text: Service was excellent. There were 4 of us, we shared a Rib eye and a New York strip and glad we did it was more than enough for us ladies. The steaks we're perfectly cooked, tender, and the sides were fresh and delicious. They cook over open fire, so meat gets seared in all the right places. The mushrooms were also good. This was my second time with a different group of people and both tims it has been Out of this world good!

kI-rYmzpChtSx-oqQ0BIDw.text: This is by far the best steak I've ever had. Hands down, no BS... the meat is as satisfying as the strip club me and my girlfriend went to the night before... and the strip club was f#%~ing amazing. The ambiance is fit for a mob boss or a king like my myself, with a chef that looks like he could kill the cow with his bear hands and simple menu. I recommend you try this place before you die!   Oh yea and I went on my birthday and they gave me a kick ass Slice of chocolate cake on the house.

2yCkhJhPb_4bX2cZiuoxsg.text: I absolutely fell in love with this place... took my two little dates. We had a great time.. the service , the food was absolutely impeccable... must go!!!

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ISNwhEjyk0-xDhgFvhL8xQ.text: So, the atmosphere is good. Service was great. It's nice that sides are included (starch, veg, soup or salad) - it's always annoyed me to pay $75 for a steak and be asked to kick in another $10 for a potato. This place doesn't do that, which is great.   There's also something to be said for the surreal feeling of being in such a low end casino and turning the corner into a really classy place (old school, but classy).   The reason I'm only giving it two stars is that the steak was really pretty bad. It was just flavorless. And it was a bone in ribeye, so it should have had a ton of flavor.   I could have had a better steak buying one at Costco and throwing it on my Weber grill, and that's not what I expected based on reviews here and elsewhere. There are probably 10 restaurants on the strip that will give you a better value on a good steak than this place. Wish I could give it a better review, but I was genuinely disappointed.

B1gJL00xjBMVN-ng16FmvQ.text: Restaurant was nice. Service was great. Cool atmosphere. Gives off the old Vegas vibe. Loved that the kitchen is open right in the middle of the restaurant. My only complaint was the prime rib we received was almost all fat. Very little meat. So not very appetizing. But everyone else said their meals were amazing. Recommend the petite filet mignon Oscar style. Absolutely delicious.

PjUH6L9A5aUrgbcSmBY9fQ.text: Great steakhouse. We were seated promptly, the food came out hot and fresh and our server was amazing!

De4yU8SXAdd3LlqS2_KV9w.text: Great service and the ambiance. Everything was delicious. The steaks were seasoned just right and was cooked to each of our preferences. Our waiter even remembered our birthday surprise notes on our reservations, and served our birthday girl a chocolate cake at the end of our dinner. No reminders needed.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye (24 oz) with baked potatoes.
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday cake - Very scrumptious!
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petit Petit Filet Mignon (8oz) with garlic mashed potatoes and asparagus. It was delicious.

dTZQ8d380Iq5gv8TGmsLXg.text: I'm a local and have been to many great restaurants in our amazing city.  I especially like trying steakhouses.  I'll admit I was very skeptical about a steakhouse in Circus Circus.   After wading through the kids and families, we found it!  Tucked away, almost hidden among the CC chaos.  Once we stepped in, it was like we were transported to another place and time.   The service was exceptional.  The food was amazing.  The atmosphere made us stay for a great dessert which we normally don't do.    Create a reason to go here...not an excuse to stay away.  I guarantee you'll be pleased.  We now take all our visitors from out of town here.

zZ8lIq46obc9c4zHx83qhg.text: A classic streakhouse where you feel the history of Vegas. It may not be the best steakhouse in Vegas, but it's the best steak for value. Always have a good meal here.

yhbW6Vqol0RwgujBDKNRJQ.text: This steakhouse came super reccomended and unfortunately it is not up to the spreading word. Service was poor. Pne person had to wait for the soup they forgot to serve... but worse is what happened woth our meat. Quality was good but terms of cooking were way off till a point we asked to change one of the steaks and have it done again.  One steak asked rose came well done; Two steaks asked medium row came overcooked One steak was ok. For the price you are asked to pay the cook should be taking care of cooking correctly.

K8bztrpM2jNIFqeGTQ4UuA.text: WTF!!! this is in Circus Circus? Looks like Frank and the rat pack left something behind.. This place is simply amazing. The best steaks, the best atmosphere, and the greatest service. Try it, you will fall in love.  Just be sure to step over the little peple when going!

bZ3KXtyVZmdAEOevD9B0Nw.text: This place has won best steakhouse for 20 years? Wow, overrated. I had an okay ribeye and a bite of a so-so fillet from friend. I've had better at so many places at home in Chicago that I won't even bother to list them. I don't know where to get a better steak in Vegas, but I'm sure it's out there. Service and ambiance were very good, but this is not the best steak I've had, not by a long shot.

A38GDv35qwCg9C1eSI2o6g.text: Excellent.  Great atmosphere.  Great food.  Great service.  I had the bone-in ribeye, which was excellent.  It came with 2 sides, unlike almost every other high end steakhouse.  Price was definitely less than the high end strip steakhouses, but the quality was not compromised.  I would definitely eat here again , although the location is not as convenient as other steakhouses at the nicer casinos.  You really need to cab it to Circus Circus; it is too far of a walk from Venetian/TI.  Maybe if you are at Encore the walk is not too far.

LQuqPdodCXwtuiaenrGt7w.text: charred medium rare steak with no added seasoning or flavor. thanks!  if that's what you want, then i highly recomment the steakhouse. i ordered the porterhouse and got the above. 4 of us, and only one had her meat cooked as ordered. points for a decent price for the steak, salad, and sides, but the steak needs so much more work. service was good, inside was clean. that's about all i can say for them.

pFZ85uGEdFHfuRtXWCvJ-A.text: By far the best steakhouse in Las Vegas.  Yeah, you have to trudge through the child-puke grossness of the Circus Circus, but then you come to a diamond in the rough.  Great service consistently.  Perfect Steak always.  Can't go wrong.  It's our "go-to" nice dinner in town.

PvdTn4B5_-nETW9gFQp1_g.text: I meant to write this review but keep on forgetting it, so I'll do this now. We spent last new years eve at Las Vegas and for our new years eve dinner, we decided to try The Steak House in Circus Circus Hotel.   I have to say, the place is decent and food is great, totally the opposite of what Circus Circus, which is run down and filled with kids running around. It was busy that night and we're lucky to get last minute reservation especially during new years eve.  The person making reservation was friendly, courteous and accomodating.   Food portion is good. Me and my wife ordered Rib Eye and Porterhouse steak, and it was enough for us and our 2 kids.  The warm bread and butter they serve was good, even the water they served tasted really good, its funny cause both kids commented how good the water was :)   It cost about 40-45 bucks per entree and includes salad and a side order, which I think is reasonable for the size and quality of their steak.  The steak is good and the side order is so-so. Ruth-Chris is better, but of course it cost more and you would have to pony up 10-15 bucks more per side order.

Ck8xtsSvEUTJSckDNrJw5g.text: I just don't understand why this place is like a landmark in LV. The location is not the issue although it is kind of strange being in the Circus Circus. It kind of makes it an adventure getting there. The service was very good and they sat us without a reservation on a Saturday night. I am not sure if that was a sign of what was to come though. The interior decor was like a hunting club with stuffed Pheasants and Dear heads mounted on the wall. I tried ordering the Rib eye and they were out. Seriously?? A steak house out of rib eye.. OK.. So then I ordered the Porterhouse, Medium. Got it close to well. My Friend ordered the same, Medium rare. Got it more like ALIVE. The steak itself was nothing I would brag about. Tasted like cooked meat. I don't think I would recommend this place to anyone who wants good steak and/or atmosphere in LV. Try somewhere else. There are many other places in town with better food.

pf029srp-l2zs28ZqgqA3Q.text: The value for the food is amazing. If you come hungry, you probably won't be able to finish your meal. I had the appetizer grilled shrimp.....goodness, this could have been my meal. Then the stark came. I got the small filet and it looked every bit of a 16oz filet. It was HUGE & good.   Service was great, a little tip for you, if you get there before 6pm it's half price drinks.

Q1gBDuFgXIrPsWA3Q6TGXQ.text: We had heard so many good things about this Steak House, that we made a reservation for 915 after seeing a show on the strip.   We had high expectations... The staff was  friendly.   Maybe we hit this on a bad night, or maybe we were too late for dinner but this had to be one of the worst meals I, ever had.  Let's start with the fact that it's in Circus Circus.   I was waiting for Clark Griswold and cousin Eddie to show up.  What a seedy, dark, dirty and creepy looking casino this is.  Our dinner started with a salad that was soggy and rotting. I ordered a prime rib only to be told by our waiter that there was only one piece left and he wouldn't recommend it.    I ordered a filet, which was very tender but lacking any flavor and was served room temperature and dry.   The asparagus was over cooked and a couple of the spears we missing the tips.    My husbands meal was just as bad, if not worse.    We should have listened to our cabbie who just shook his head, when we told him where we were headed.   This review will probably  get the same canned response the other reviews got.    Goes to show you how much effort they put into this place.    Not worth the trip.    Skip this place and stay on the strip.

UuzPMdjIyaplAx2yisyn2A.text: Chae our waiter gave excellent service, very knowledgeable on dry aging processes.  I will definitely recommend it to my hotel guests!  Very reasonably price. Each entree has inclusive sides with price.  Must check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious food. Great service.

U2lS1xMHbpxKBzToE2uP5Q.text: This place is one of the best steakhouses in Vegas!  Service is always amazing and the food is fantastic. It may be located in an older hotel but it's always a treat to eat at this classic restaurant. Looking forward to the next time I can get back.

e0UZRcrExVnWss5xsZ24Dw.text: The service was just mediocre.. I ordered the ribeye it was just ok, nothing special.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I2JJfM5LA0Hintro5JC_6Q.text: My husband and I came to Vegas for the weekend and decided to come here for our romantic and quiet dinner. I ordered the New York, and he ordered the porter house. The New York was perfect! Thick and tender, cooked to perfection. The porter house was good, but my husband liked my steak better. Service was great, as usual. Another good dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The New York, cooked medium
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad

_68s0oKd47YRbQaCZmzHDw.text: Don't let the fact that it's in Circus Circus fool you.  This place is the best steakhouse I've been to in Vegas.  Came here on a first date (he was cool).  It has that old school steakhouse feel to it.  You can see the meat aging in the locker when you wall through the restaurant.  The servers are excellent, very helpful and attentive but not overbearing.  They make an excellent gin martini. I chose the lamb chops for dinner and they were probably the thickest ones I've ever had. They were cooked to perfection, medium for me.  My date had the bone in cowboy rib eye and he was impressed.  He said it was one of the best steaks he ever had.  The dinner salads were even awesome.  This place is not to be missed. I liked it so much I went back for lunch a few days later.

7xAug-LqaGGhs5bEkw3GFQ.text: Top notch on every level. Have been dining here for more than 20 years., always a must stop on every Vegas trip.   Prime steaks, great old school feel with out the cheese factor.or  dust on the appointments,  From appetizers steak or prime rib and dessert a never fail combination.  Solid and consistent, many try but never reach that zenith.

wdEv2TGAUgeL6O11CunwDQ.text: As someone who works at a Five Star Resort on The strip, I have to say the service I received here was nothing but 5 star. After describing how I like my steak cooked and my marbling to the waiter, I ordered the New York Strip Medium rare. Your steak comes with a side and a salad, which you will find nowhere on the strip. My steak was cooked perfectly. I have absolutely no complaints about this steakhouse. I tried the peppercorn sauce, but found the steak tasted better without it. There is a reason why it was voted best so many years in a row. I will defiantly be back and recommended to friends and family.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t-70BRB3wC8wYRgFQioYYw.text: One of the better steakhouses on the Strip. Good wine selection, excellent service and food every time I've eaten there. Tip...it is important to have a reservation, the place is fairly small.

u8o_Gsh1EuasLrGGemdzZw.text: Their filet mignon tasted like liver.  It was horrible.  This is an outdated steakhouse.  It is one of the worst filets I have ever had at a restaurant.

6ZjdD0lCxV1Sh8BqArLYjg.text: I have been hearing about award winning steakhouse 4 years. I made reservations 2 months in advance for a special occasion. I clearly told them I want a corner both.  that I notice online that are more private. They assured me that will not be a problem. So we had problems since we first got there. they did the opposite and gave me a crowded table right in the middle. And I notice the table that we wanted  was empty for the entire night.. So all things aside let's get to the food. We ordered the salad .famous bean soup ribeye dinner and  filet mignon dinner. Salad hardly had lettuce but the  blue cheese and vinaigrette dressing was good. Your famous bean soup just tasted like ordinary black beans in a can... The steaks were nothing special I don't see how it so post to be award winning the steaks were very bland  steaks were not season what so ever before cooking on the grill no salt no black pepper no garlic etc. As soon as I took a bite out of the stake I knew something was wrong to my amusement it was not season so I grabbed a salt shaker on the table and they filled it so it not want to come out .so I did not want to go to the hassle of opening it and all that stuff when the stake should of been season from the beginning. Steaks were a decent size but they were tasteless. On to the service our waiter was not professional at all seemed like he kept rushing us . He did not refill our drinks we had to ask for a refill at the very end of our dinner. I don't think that's right that we have to ask for a refill  at a fancy steak restaurant. Are cup was empty pretty much all the way throught.On to desert they told me over the phone they will give me a compliment cheesecake which they did not give to me  !!!!!  so I warn everybody there is nothing special about this steakhouse waste of the money stake is not flavored whatsoever got o ellis island steak dinner much better 8 dollars at least they season ...

_tZO0EAVamHwGb_PkHgkjA.text: Best in town and very reasonable.Chae is a great server and is nice and helpful.had the ribeye steak and it was wonderful and salad was great and dessert was magnificent

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K6wedP2N8yS6I_mTVSeWLw.text: Excellent service! Food was delicious! I was very surprised at how amazing the food is. It's a hidden gem in a ghetto hotel.  Hubby got the porterhouse, I got the petit filet. Oysters for Appetizer and sauteed mushrooms. For dessert we got chocolate covered strawberries.  Will for sure come back.

pKK6rXJTaQEGIY6--mjh7Q.text: have eaten here several times with good results - ate last night and ordered the $65 ribeye - was horrible.  Poor cut of meat - tough and no flavor. We were very disappointed and will not return

3wH_TCGmnTmAPcmkPl7OdQ.text: A True hidden gem in Las Vegas.  Given the fact that Circus Circus is past its heyday as a premiere resort, many people write their steakhouse off as such. However, they serve the best steak in Las Vegas.  The staff have been fantastic every time I've eaten there and the food is always delicious. Lots of care is taken to make sure that everything is just the way you want it. For example, they were able to pull off a filet mingon cooked "well done" (normally considered heresy in a steakhouse). It arrived at the table just as tender as a filet mingon that was cooked medium rare. Thats a testament to the quality of their meats and the skill of their kitchen staff.  Check this place out the next time you are in Las Vegas.

d_iKp3KVYVM1RcVYPWtW6Q.text: How I wanted this to work out.  Last night in town with my wife and 5 year old.  Off to ride the High Roller.  Dinner at 6:30.  Everyone happy, everyone excited.  Guess I don't really need to get into the details.  Things didn't go as planned.  They didn't make it right.  What else does anyone really need to say?  Avoid.

yjv57SZm1J5zuAsKlCiRmg.text: Second time visiting and everyone was disappointed. The majority got the rib eye and complained it was too dry and too bloody. I got the filet and it was not cooked right and undercooked. The green beans tasted undercooked too. The mashed potatoes were the only good part to the meal. Very disappointing, especially for the prices.

bsioyi5sKEhAlfzDcqkaPQ.text: Old school Vegas with top quality aged beef.  We've had so far 3 bachelor parties here, and countless casual and business dinners, and it never disappoints.  Make a reservation, get there early, or maybe wait a few minutes for your tablet.  Head to the bar and get a nice classic cocktail, manhattan being my favorite, and take in the atmosphere with old school red bar seats.    The meat here is 21 day aged beef on site, and you can see your meat when you walk in.  You'll then notice the grill, which is in the center of the restaurant, making your mouth ready to water.  Sit down and order a dozen or half dozen oysters, not always the best but always good enough.  Their servers are all mostly old schoolers too as well, and they know what they're doing.  Get a bone in ribeye or filet mignon, rare to medium rare, and sit back and wait for your salad.  The salads are good, as is the black bean soup, which comes with a shot of sherry.  French onion is usually too salty so not one of my favorites.  The main event is the meat, and it has yet to disappoint.  The flavor of the char and soft warm center melds together like a well rehearsed tango in your mouth.  You will be stuffed, yet you will savor every bite.  Top 3 authentic old school steakhouse in Vegas, with the lowest prices ($50-75 per person).

5T3Th0FnHOhwV0oom6xTYA.text: My husband and I went to this steak house after getting tons of rave reviews from people we  know. We love going to steak houses but this was a miserable experience and that's putting it nicely! The service was awful, especially for an expensive steak house. We each had 1 cocktail only because our server never came back to see if we wanted another. We each ordered steaks, a ribeye and a porterhouse. They tasted like NOTHING. A plain, very dry steak!!! Not worth the money at all! The entire time we were eating the server did not check in us even one time. We were done eating for 20 min, at least, before he came and gave us the check. No offer of dessert either. We were clearly irritated and never saw a manger. I have worked I. The service area a long time and this is not the type of service you receive from a very expensive establishment. $200 we will never get back. Do not go here!!!

ESBS-_0myJQjp4vcPq1Plw.text: My husband and I have been going to the steakhouse for years. The ambiance is from a long forgotten time. The steaks and food are fantastic. The service is impeccable. Ron and his crew bend over backwards to satisfy our wants. Highly recommend this restaurant.

EOfxXGX30FmOeFCP10J9kQ.text: Vastly overrated.  I was very disappointed last night when I ate at the Circus Circus Steak House. I have heard from many people how good the food was and so went there hoping that the  Circus Circus restaurant would be a hidden gem.  Instead what I found was a beautiful old time steak house with red booths and gleaming brass. The steaks are cooked right in middle of dining room.  My crab cake was very good and so I expected that the steak would be great.   Instead of a great steak (I ordered porterhouse) I got something that was more like the meat I would expect to buy at a grocery store.  Last week at Baltaire in LA , I had perhaps the best steak I have ever eaten. Then I realized that all  the newer steak houses have upped the game on prime steaks. Unfortunately this restaurant continues to order old time and not so good meat   Back in the day Las Vegas restaurants were very beautiful but they did not serve great food. Nothing has changed here.  The service was good, the decor perfect but I gave it 2 stars because the meat is not as good as most other steak houses.

pxTsBmjqBgl09ahpcm98Iw.text: Went in for my birthday and Felix was our service. He provided us with great service. I will summarize my experience.  Old school 70's style very classy steakhouse (yes inside circus circus) this restaurant beats any major steakhouses in major city, while others are trying to pretend to be classy , this is the original and it has everything you can imagine.  Service is impeccable , most of the staff here has never left and has been there for 30 plus years  Ambiance is like 70's and that's how long this place has been there.  Give it a try and walk through circus circus and you will find a gem

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My birthday meal! Cooked to perfection

b3ZWa6RH2zEY0vBe_AoxtQ.text: I went here back in June for restaurant week. This place is excellent to visit during restaurant week because of the great deal they offer.  You may think that Circus Circus doesn't have anything to offer but you are wrong. The steakhouse has an old time Vegas feel and is probably the best thing that the casino has to offer and the reason it stays open.  Our service was great! And she was from Buffalo as well which is always cool to talk to people from the same hometown.   For $50 you were able to get French Onion soup or salad, Filet Oscar and your choice of dessert. Considering the filet is normally over $50 this is an amazing price.  I decided to go for the french onion soup over the salad. Even though it was summer and very hot out I can never refuse french onion soup. It was very tasty and filling.  The filet oscar was awesome. For those who don't know oscar style is filet with crab meat on the top along with a sauce. This came with mashed potatoes and asparagus. The mashed potatoes were so good. I had leftovers that I made sure to eat the next day! I didn't finish my meal mainly because I had to leave room for dessert  For dessert I went with the chocolate cake. It was a big toss up between that and the chocolate covered strawberries but the cake won. It was so good! It was a large piece so I was able to take some of that home too.  The only downfall was that everything was served too close together. I like when things are brought out with a bit of a wait in between so you are able to digest before your next course comes around. The soup and main course came so close together that by the end I felt so full I almost opted for dessert to go.   I was so glad I was able to enjoy this during restaurant week. Great food for a great deal. For those who go at anyother time of the month it's a great steakhouse but with being a great steakhouse comes cost. It's probably average price for a steakhouse but more than I normally spend on a meal.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant week 2015

IQDdJSbyzPUox-qTNsSyQw.text: We had a Great New Year's Eve dinner at this Steakhouse. I ordered the lobster tail and it was delicious! I highly recommend this place.

Wb4xlenHDnRrP0odqPJF8w.text: Somewhat a hidden gem. Never too crowded but reservation certainly recommended. Probably the best king crab I've ever had. Homemade black bean soup was outstanding and sweetened to your specific flavor preference. Steak (ribeye) was above average but not as good as my prior experiences at this restaurant. THE steakhouse remains on my list of top steakhouses and a must-have when you're in town.

3wMi8B-0pVQQOzz5FmUCwg.text: This review is for THE Steak House's 2015 Las Vegas Restaurant Week menu.  No clownin' around here (ha ha). Circus Circus'  THE Steak House has won me over.  First Course - Appetizer - House Salad: I don't even know why I'm writing about the salad because you don't make friends with salad, as Homer J. Simpson once said. Let me be real: the salad was basic. Red onion slices, carrots, mushrooms, and greens. I ordered a vinaigrette dressing on the side, which had the perfect tanginess.  Second Course - Entree - Filet Oscar: If you're expecting several carnivorous offerings, sorry, but the Filet Oscar is the only slab of meat that they're offering for Restaurant Week, which to me is fine. The thick 8oz filet was topped with chunks of king crab with a generous serving of creamy hollandaise poured all over. For my side, I selected wild rice over the mashed potatoes; asparagus was the Chef's Choice veggie of the evening.   Third Course - Dessert - Chocolate Covered Strawberries and Creme Brulee: "These strawberries are wearing Armani tuxedos, not tuxes from JC Penny," my server said to me - gotta love the humor. The chocolate covered strawberries were created to look as though they're "wearing" tuxedos. Cute and sweet. My mom and I shared creme brulee, which was fantastic.  Service: Excellent.   Overall: THE Steak House is so good that I would make the drive to Circus Circus -- that's saying a lot. Whether it's during Restaurant Week or any other week of the year, I still recommend that tourists and locals give this steakhouse a shot.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Oscar
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme Brûlée
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Covered Strawberries

pPB6RgWklNPhRsZOxFl86A.text: I love steak and I'm very picky when it comes to how it's made. Not even I can perfect a well cooked steak but this blew my expectations. It was so delicious. A must try

V0hLhuqaLCQ_pkYhDTyZlQ.text: Nice wine selection.  Large portions.  Good value. Perfectly cooked steak.  Service on point.  No complaints.  Highly recommend.

-jBAJIIYfjaBViTkB12qFQ.text: Best steak house in Vegas hands down. I've been coming here for years. Inside the cheapest hotel in Vegas lies the best steak house. A mans steak house. It's won so many awards. You have to try it. Great service great food and a great atmosphere.

4awJvgSEn6XCoFZVKYyzYQ.text: I've lost count of how many times I've eaten at The Steak House as CC, but this past weekend was exceptional. Chae our server was spot on and did an outstanding job. We never felt rushed and never had to ask for anything, the service was that good. Everyone's meal was just what they ordered. You cannot beat the atmosphere and experience. Will be back next time I'm in town.

pel9a6HdYQqfCssRzhleWQ.text: First time at THE Steakhouse with my wife celebrating an anniversary.  We really enjoyed the overall experience.  Here is the breakdown:  Black bean soup is first rate and as everyone says it's the best.  Steak was a strip cooked perfectly. It was not overly seasoned or salty and I think a good steak stands on its own. This one was great. Mashed potatoes were first rate.  Baked potato was not great. Very average. I ordered it and wish I got something else Asparagus was good, average except my wife's portion was small. Should have complained but didn't.  We had great martinis - standard for a steakhouse.  We had a wonderful slice of chocolate mousse cake. It was excellent.  Best of all service was A+ as Roberto and his helper were prompt and helpful throughout the meal.   Lots of steakhouse competition in Vegas and they are all expensive. This one was excellent and for the money a real value for what you get.

GbeGZxJ2UjBUpZXox4nVIA.text: I see The famous Steakhouse every year because I usually stay at Circus Circus...it's on the way to the main casino and has been there since I was a kid. I made a promise to my daughter that I would take her for dinner.  We just left The Steakhouse and I would like to say that it far exceeded my expectations. It is dimly lit but very elegant. From the moment you walk in, you can tell you will be in for a treat. First we were served a basket filled with different types of bread and butter. My favorite were the raisin bread but they were all delicious.  The first course was black bean soup however, you can choose a salad if you don't want the soup. It was absolutely delicious. I ordered the chicken breast..it comes perfectly grilled, well seasoned and very tender. It came with grilled asparagus and a baked potato. You can get mashed potatoes too. I read a review below stating the meat was under seasoned, I disagree with that review. Why would the chef ruin a fine cut of meat by over salting it and ruining the natural flavor? I think the meat tasted delicious and had the perfect amount of salt and pepper.  My daughter got the rib eye steak..I wish I had taken a photo of it, it was spectacular.  The server was very polite and and took care of us good. Service is exceptional. A tray of delicious deserts were offered to us after our meal however, we were stuffed. The options were chocolate covered strawberries, cheesecake and a whole tray full of delicious options.  There is a great variety of wine and appetizers too.  You will be very pleased if you come here. It is worth every penny. Food is well seasoned and service is excellent, I highly recommend it here.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Winner winner chicken dinner!

NiNCvnqeSsMdaE7671NWjQ.text: I first learned about this place in this old "Little Black Book" by David de Montmollin.  Basically an amusing read on a Vegas insider's recommendation for the ultimate Vegas weekend.  Circus Circus is not a casino one would think of going to these days, given the rise of the upscale Wynn, City Center, and Bellagio.  However, it has two nice features - a half-price ticket booth that's not super busy and a phenomenal steakhouse.  The steakhouse has an aging room where you see various cuts of meat and a central kitchen open area where they cook meats on a charcoal grill.  The inside is dark, intimate and classy - but you can wear business casual.  Waiters were super friendly.  The red leather booths we had were really comfortable as well.  Our dinner was excellent - everything cooked well and full of flavor.  Portions were truly massive so I would recommend sharing an entree. The wife and I both got bone-in ribeyes which had a nice smoky crust followed by a tender interior.  Their peppercorn sauce is like a spicy gravy that made the dish even better.  We also got black bean soup which had sides of diced red onions and sherry - very unique flavor but I really liked it.  For dessert, we shared the banana foster which came in a nice martini glass - not a whole lot of alcohol, but real fresh bananas and the ice cream had good layering of caramel.  I do recommend this restaurant - pretty good value.  Even though its $59 for a huge bone-in ribeye, it comes with your choice of starch (rice pilaf, garlic mash, baked potato), asparagus, and choice of salad or black bean soup.  Be sure to ask for peppercorn sauce on the aide and save room for dessert!
