photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Foster
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truly massive bone-in ribeye with garlic mash and asparagus
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Open kitchen with charcoal grill.  They have good ventilation so you get a good aroma but no smoke

kY9Ym74dc_kWXhWunCyxSQ.text: Update:  I was being generous at giving 3 stars because of the service. But clearly my photos taken establishes my "rare" steak to be over cooked in comparison to my wife's "rare" steak. However, the ineptitude of the MGM marketing person is either blind to social sarcasm or is immune to my generosity in spite of their inferior cooked meat. I, normally, do not downgrade any restaurant because of one small thing or another to be fair.  However, this is your speciality. Your reason for being. Ironically our company booked over 1200 rooms and all the ballrooms for our meetings last month at the Bellagio. While I may not particularly like aged meat, my wife does. I know what good aged meat is supposed to taste like as much as I know what good Mexican food tastes like. I don't care for either one as a personal choice but I do eat them. Instead of apologizing they spin it into a taste not to my liking when the underlying cause was their overlooked meat. Anything over cooked is not going to taste good. I am just glad I used Restaurant Week to try them out versus going during regular time periods or else I would be furious. Mistakes I can fathom but inept ignorance is unforgivable. By the way, MGM Marketing, we had a catered lunch for our employees today.  At times I could go ballistic if my meat comes out crappy. However since this was also my anniversary I kept my cool. There are plenty of steak houses in Vegas. I never had any complaints at McCormicks down the street on Paradise/Flamingo.  Since the marketing persons response seems condescending I decided to give them a 1 star even though the restaurant itself deserved more. Service is always a important factor as much as the food.  --------  I finally went to this steak house after hearing about it through the years and reading my Yelp friends reviews. It is an old fashioned steak house as is its reputation. The place is decorated with old charm, red stuffed leather seating, bankers green and gold lamps. You are greeted at the entrance by the glass enclosed aging room next to the hostess station. Petra greeted me and was the same one who took my reservation at 2pm. We went at 7:30 and she was already turning people without reservations away or letting them know the slots open were after 9pm.  We ordered the Restaurant Week menu. I had house salad, petite filet, and chocolate mousse cake. Water is served via bottle. Bread rolls were brought out very quickly. They were a varied lot consisting of cheese sticks and different rolls. The salad was very good. I cannot recall what was in it though. The filet came out medium rare and not rare that I wanted. They got the better half's meat right. Some pieces of crab meat in sauce laid on top of the meat. Baby asparagus on the side. I chose wild rice as the other accoutrement. It was wild and al dente. I am not Italian so I usually eat my rice cooked, al fully cooked. But I don't mind. It gave a nice texture. It had small chopped mushrooms, along with the wild seed looking things that a whole foods eater would be accustomed to. I am not in the fancy wild rice crowd.  The meat was good. The rare was cooked buttery, from my better half's plate. Not a fan of aged meat to be honest. A nicely cooked ribeye would have been better.  The chocolate mousse cake was one of the best I've eaten. Very velvety and just the right amount of sweet. It was more than I could handle so we shared one and took one slice to go. We didn't even finish the one we started on.  The service was too notch. They were very attentive and quick. I felt bad seeing how they had to walk up and down the stair as well as seeing the busboy lift a whole tables worth of dirty dishes and glasses in one sling.  What can I say? It was good but I don't think I will go back again.  I don't see a hankering to go back to this or another aged steak house. Kind of like Ruth's Chris. This is better than them but I tried it and that was pretty it. I rather go back to a sushi restaurant or have a $20 prime rib. McCormick and Schmicks does better steaks IMO. Aged meats only taste good if cooked correctly. Everyone was working hard including the poor guy who had to fire up all the steaks. He seemed like a pro, feeling the meats temperature as they cooked and adjusting. He seemed way too tall for the cooking station tho.  The clientele were mostly silver foxes...my parents and grandparent types. The hostess said we were very young and we pretty much were the youngest people there. So all in all, a classy quaint place. Now I can tell my dad that I've eaten at his favorite steak house and I am not that impressed to be honest.

Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

6pjFaoEwsqLhcfh-qEKFlA.text: I loved this place. The food was huge! I shared a plate with my girlfriend. it was plenty for the both of us. The staff was great and very friendly. I would definitely go back.

PfRLslY5h3--Ioteu-tV1Q.text: I have to admit, I was really unsure about this place since it is inside Circus Circus. However, after letting the kids play I wanted them to eat something other than fast food. I decided to eat there since the attire is casual. No entree is less than $40. The fish entrees are less expensive. I decided on the Filet Mignon since it's my usual pick. It was superb! I added the mushrooms and they are to die for. My husband ordered the New York Strip which was full of flavor. Asparagus was made to perfection! Baked Potatoes were made to perfection! Hats off to the chef! Excellent dining in the Circus Circus. I really am impressed.   Truly, everything was made exceptionally well!

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another Filet!
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon with baked potato.... Not such a great pic. Picture does this no justice.
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Strip.

ZEyigKy_Ogz88v2qM-e_1w.text: Such a surprise in Circus Circus!  Amazing prices for huge cuts of meat...unheard of, all included sides and salad...delicious!  A charming atmosphere that takes you out of the  hustle of Circus Circus.

OTL6OjQQaWTdGRXeZRviow.text: Man this is a gem. Never knew it was there. With that said the prime rib was cooked to perfection and the serving size was HUGE. The service was also great, the newest server they have working there, has been there 27 years. Will return for sure next time in Vegas..

3LsbfFv3mLUvxf1M_sIyAA.text: This is probably one of my favorite streak houses in Vegas haven't been here in a long time great to be back

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster tail
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite fillet and baked potato with broccoli knee and béarnaise sauce
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Porterhouse an  baked potato an broccoli

PXVE3Exo5RJ0mPy9NSKEhw.text: On a visit to Vegas, my boyfriend and I really wanted a great dinner at a steak house.  Picking one was hard because of so many great options. We tried The Steak House based on yelp reviews and we had one of the best meals ever.  Yeah, its in Circus Circus which not the best casino on the strip, but tucked away among the kiosk shops is this wonderful restaurant.  If we had the same amazing prime rib meal at one of the fancier casinos, we would have paid a considerable amount more.  The service here was great, the food, outstanding. I would highly recommend checking this out before paying for the hype of some of the other more trendy steak houses.

qe16A3JCH9hTk-QcNW_hQw.text: Old time steakhouse, split a steak and the 2nd plate is only $16. Service was great, steak was as good as I've had. It's worth the walk through Circus Circus.

-oRO6FVYfOwplSntxpYZwQ.text: It took a while for people to convince me that this place was actually worth a try. I thought they were all joking... I couldn't believe that Circus Circus could have a great steakhouse so near to the petri dish that is their buffet.  This place would get 5 stars but I ordered the Porterhouse rare (blue rare) and received a medium to medium/well steak. When I told the waiter that it was overcooked he argued with me and pulled out a flashlight. I understand that it was dark.. but I know the difference between rare and medium.  Anyways the second steak they brought was cooked perfect.

mV_93H7KsuGMeEB8DeakQA.text: This is my husbands and I favorite place! This is the place we go to for every birthday and anniversary! My husband even proposed to me here! The maitre d Ron always is very nice and always remembers us and take great care of us! The steaks are unbelievable awesome! I always have the petite filet mignon and my husband has the porterhouse! Both are always perfectly cooked! For apps we get oysters on a half shelf ! We both get casears salads. I can't say enough good stuff about the this place the only thing I wish is that it was not in Circus Circus its a very long walk from valet or parking garage in heels!

sx0MiHCkHEih2RiqQcDlaw.text: I hit this spot the other night after saying I would check it out last summer. I finally hit it. It was good. I mean.. better than good but it didn't change my life or anything like that. I ordered the filet and a Cesar with a side of rice and shrooms. All very good. I would go again but I still prefer the Golden Steer. The staff was great and that was a surprise. Often places like this you get marginal service because inside the Casino they figure you are from ??? and won't be back. The bartender was cool as it gets and the servers were very much on their game! I will repeat.

YjPoIKp4n_SPu2lzEcieAA.text: Everything was great except the steak.  Excellent atmosphere, very good salad and side dishes.  But the bone in ribeye was poor.  First flavor that hits you is the charcoal grill - especially if the steak has some charring.  Second a quality cut of ribeye should not have as much unmelted grizzle as this one did.  Third I requested medium to medium rare temp and it  was closer to rare but it was too busy to send back.  I didn't complain - just knew it was my last trip here.  My advice would be to spend a couple bucks on cabfare and go to Golden Steer.  Their ribeye is the best I've had in Vegas.

yVcCkoidvPgehqG4TpzHRw.text: Finding The Steakhouse is the epitome of finding a pearl in an oyster.  Excellent service, good steaks, and the ambiance is similar to what I imagine a Vegas restaurant to be 40 years ago.

gCT-swrdK_QRZRn1lLFVPw.text: When my friend suggested dining here I thought she was crazy.  My memories of the only time I had been in Circus Circus involves sticky floors and screaming children.  I was very pleasantly surprised by the restaurant, however.  Not only was the service excellent, but my feet didn't stick to the floor and there was not screaming involved.  The food was exceptional.  The steak was melt-in-your-mouth good and I highly recommend the chocolate dipped strawberries for dessert.  They were huge!

3FwSy8tCtF_IgsIz7ET9bg.text: I've been here a couple times, never had a bad experience.  This place is always packed.  Even my 1 year old daughter was welcome, and enjoyed their mashed potatoes thoroughly.  I always get the new york strip and my husband gets the t-bone.  They are both delicious.  Good salads, and soup as well.  A fine steakhouse.

fcDc6cOPl9-3h1keGwjeOA.text: We had our anniversary dinner at The Steakhouse and it was DELICIOUS! The service was impeccable, the food was expertly prepared and the ambiance was relaxing and soothing. Our dining experience was the best we have ever experienced.  We were served a complimentary dessert for our anniversary which was amazing. Lots of chocolate and fresh cream. Yummy!

daCVeiWd5Lu6S1Q-iELDKA.text: Dear The Steakhouse,  Stepping foot into The Steakhouse is like taking a step back into time. The stark contrast between the casino and the restaurant is as night and day.  The restaurant is like its steak, aged and vintage. You are greeted by a display case of their aged cuts of meat, that will either A) Make carnivorous folk drool in anticipation or B) Make you wonder why are you staring at old aged raw meat and totally turns you off... I am the former so I was already ready to dig into a nice porterhouse.  I got a nice juicy, flavorful cut, and the service was great. Price is a bit steep, but you pay that much for a decent cut. My only complaint is it's location... This steak place is the only reason I'd want to go to the Circus Circus, and that more often then not is not enough reason for me to go there compared to all these other great casinos and restaurants.  -Ed

AAQ2fd61tAy5oMecCte05A.text: The Filet mignon was SOOO tender. The Veggies were hard and not cooked correctly but they had it fixed right away. They brought me the best Mash potatoes.. They were delish...!~ You would never think that inside Circus Circus they would have such a fabulous place for steak.. but it came recommended by a good source and I got to say.. They were completely right.. I can't wait to go back.!~

_fqN7GlmyaCizBiNZ4RSXg.text: This place needs to be put at a higher end casino! The food here is amazing and tastes fresh in every bite. My boyfriend and I went for our Valentines dinner here and our server and busser were both funny and friendly. The dessert with the bananas in a martini was full of flavor and gave our meal the final touch. This place was not busy when we went but it should've been. I would like to take my father here next. The prime rib was enormous and my NY Strip was full of flavor. I will recommend to everyone that asks for a good steakhouse for sure.

lwkdFN5DTGf6PM5hAUYZug.text: Expensive, I know this going in as I am a repeat  customer. Goes for the old school Vegas feel, probably pulls it off. My daughter goes into the Frightdome, my wife and I go to the Steakhouse, everyone's happy.

jRDlnkU3ENXnGq9xzlwgeg.text: Steakhouse in Circus Circus is a hidden gem. We were told how good it was by locals who are friends of friends. We had the Shrimp for starters and they were so fresh and big. My lamb chops were so tasty and the mesquite taste of my fiance's ribeye was to die for. Old style steakhouse surroundings with the grill in the middle plus amazing service.

j0Dfs1fiZ9e-PKcJi12Tjw.text: Great service. Great food. Great drinks. Great atmosphere. Went her for our 2year wedding anniversary. The ribeye was huge my husband has a whole steak for left overs. Filet melted in my mouth. Drinks were great and they didn't skimp on alcohol like other places.

sCae0mNExgzSY_NBXEHhnQ.text: So sad and disappointing...this steak house was our favorite for years (and we are locals), but the big top has dropped the ball. From missing music, poor service and disgusting dress code...literally shorts and baseball caps next to us, this restaurant royalty has become a joke and waste of money.  We still paid a hundred dollars for salad and tip, but were not even walked out or realized by the management. Restaurants like these are the True definition of why the world doesn't go out anymore, poor and beneath us all. Mediocrity is the way lately and I for one refuse to stand for it.    This trapeze act has removed its net for good, so swing at your own risk....the fall can hurt.

4v4kNPXJaTMcV_8HX_ZrfQ.text: Come one, even kroq said it was the best steakhouse in vegas.  Ok get the Prime Rib. It is amazing and delicious AND BIG (that's what she said). ANYWAYS *chuckles* it is very good prime rib. You should always order prime rib when they have it because prime rib is one of the parts from the moo moo that has tons of flavor!  The waiters are very nice to you and the water you get is from a fancy bottle!  give it a try when you are around. Don't be afraid on blowing money on meat, you are in Vegas anyways.

xBW_dtTeNxsykGAa4kBCBQ.text: Amazing! The food and the service were out of this world excellent.   Michael and Javier were servers for our table and both did a terrific job. Michael was very friendly, entertaining, professional, and enthusiastic.   The French Onion soup is very good and the steak I had was terrific. The tiramisu was fabulous! One person in my group had the Bananas Foster custard and he raved over that as well.  Consider making reservations if you have a large party or going to dinner during peak hours. Did I mention the tiramisu?  Expect a large bill. There were four of us dining each had a glass of wine or cocktail, split an appetizer, and all had steak dinners. The final tally was over $400 plus gratuity.   I would DEFINITELY go here again..!

RQEbrEgVa9Rqja1-hsOQSQ.text: If they had actually seasoned my New York, I would have given this place 4 stars.   But they didn't, so they only get 2 stars.   My steak was cooked to a perfect medium rare.  The only problem was that there was not a pinch of salt or pepper whatsoever. It was terrible.

JTUXaLkzpXjywx7mVjFN5A.text: I can't believe this place is actually in Circus Circus.  Circus Circus is a low-rent joint catering to parents who bring their tykes to Las Vegas.  The place is crawling with kids.  But The Steakhouse is a respite from all of that.  First, it's old school elegance.  You walk in past the display cases where all the meats are hanging.  It all looked so good.  And the menu was excellent.  The bread basket had a nice variety of breads.  I had king crab legs on ice for an appetizer.  They were by far the best crab legs that I've ever had.  For entree, it was the filet mignon.  One of the best steaks that I've ever eaten.  My father had lobster tail.  Again very good.  Now because it is Circus Circus, you might think this place is cheap.  It is not.  But it is worth every penny.

TuL3Fhci4jvKu4VGkH3P-A.text: Great steakhouse. Awesome service. The only reason I'm not giving this restaurant 5 stars is because the dessert wasn't five star quality and I'm very frugal about handing out fivers.   I came here with my roommate and a couple of our friends from Michigan. We got a ridiculous deal because my roommate is buddies with one of the managers, Felix. Definitely say hi to him if you visit because he will make you feel right at home. We started off with red wine and the seafood sensation appetizer. Both were fantastic. Nothing too complicated--just top notch seafood.   I got the petite filet which was amazing. Great flavor, perfectly done, crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. The sides matched the quality of the steak which I can't say about the sides at Binion's Steakhouse.   Desserts were OK. We ordered tiramisu, chocolate cake, and cheesecake between the four of us. We were pretty full at that point so we didn't finish everything. Best out of those three was probably the cheesecake because that's the one I remember the most. I've had better tiramisu and chocolate cake elsewhere.   Overall we had a great experience and I definitely recommend it. Ambiance is old-school classy and very welcoming. Our waiter was warm, helpful, and friendly but professional at the same time.   I still have so many restaurants to try in the city but I definitely want to come back here!!!

52dsg8p_Ig0TTlH4qY3atw.text: I have heard so many great things about this place and I finally got to try it for myself! My fiance, his friends and I went here for dinner together. I ordered the Filet with Bearnaise sauce. It was so tender and flavorful. I had asparagus and garlic mashed potatoes as my sides. I love that the steak comes with two sides. It's rare to find a nice steak house that doesn't sell the sides separately. The asparagus was just okay, but the mashed potatoes were delicious!   My fiance ordered the black bean soup to start and it was pretty good. For his entree he had the Bone in Rib Eye. It was very tender, but too fatty for my taste. That's why I always stick to the Filet.   We shared Tiramisu and chocolate covered strawberries for dessert. The Tiramisu was good but the strawberries were amazing. I could have eaten a dozen of them.    The service here was great. We loved the bread basket and complimentary bottled water as well. It's the little things that make or break a dining experience.

rKLXc1OCdwZm4OQxG_RMRw.text: This is a hidden gem in Las Vagas.  The steaks are aged and prepared to perfection.  The bean soup was incredible,  served with onions that were nicely diced and a side of sherry.  The nice touch was a complimentary bottle of wine because we were a guest staying at the hotel.  One final note, the wait staff works well together with a great balance of personal service without being intrusive.

3kplYKsG-Cl0Mx2_i77xaw.text: Where to start....I have eaten at many steakhouses in Vegas....a friend of mine took me here with a group and I WILL be back!! The service, ambiance, STEAK and pretty much everything was perfect. They grill on an open real fire....have waiters who aren't high school kids....the meat cuts are ALL ages and cut very thick...cooked to perfection....it is very odd when you think about it in the Circus Circus...but make the drive, eat here & you'll ruin eating anywhere else in one meal......#steak

tXnA47whiG4IajtkpBl1aQ.text: What can I say. Best best best!! Superb steaks. Great sides and price was perfect. Sucks walking through Circus Circus though. Well worth it!

T5WdvcY4piQ4V1aum7ktTw.text: Wow, who would suspect a gem like this in circus circus. Food was delicious, price was reasonable and service was great. Only complaint was both my husband and I requested medium rare steaks (myself the petit fillet and him the bone-in ribeye) and they were done medium. They were so delicious we didn't feel the need to mention it to the server. Really, the cut of meat was amazing, each bite was perfection.  That steak will forever me etched in my memory. I'd give 4.5 stars because the steaks weren't cooked to our request, but we loved every bite anyways!

n8JF86FTRbpGi-rhbtMqxA.text: This place has gone down hill massively. The overpriced mixed fish starter of oysters, crab and ship tasted like it has all been frozen and the meat was terrible. Shame as it used to be vega's best kept secret

ri_hsKHxizIXSZnjdlKbig.text: After hearing about The Steak House at Circus Circus for more than 20 years, Restaurant Week gave me the excuse I needed to finally visit the place and appraise it. And, after doing so, while I do not consider it to currently be the best steakhouse in Las Vegas, I was impressed. Rather than being the cowboy steak joint I sort of expected, this was a classy dining establishment with serious steaks, professional service, and an upscale enclosed dining room. Not everything was executed perfectly but everything I witnessed was executed well.   The large dining room that featured fancy multi-hued fabric chairs and comfortable, red leather booths was filled to capacity early on a Thursday night. I was very glad that my party of four had a reservation. The room contained several lit lamps but it was still very dark inside.   Buttered raisin bread was a tasty start to a fine meal overall. A white crock of French Onion Soup was hot and had nicely melted cheese on top as well as well-caramelized onions inside, but the dark broth was very salty and a bit harsh tasting at first. Yet, as I dug in deeper with my soup spoon, and got near the bottom of the vessel, the broth tasted much sweeter, and I liked it.  While the onions were numerous, I found no melted croutons in the midst of the broth, and missed them. But, now I realize that this was my own fault. For, a photo of my soup reveals that several hard croutons rested right next to my crock. All I had to do was dump them in. Pity that I overlooked that when it mattered!   The large Steak House Salad consisted of just a few types of mixed greens, plus grape tomatoes, and slices of mushrooms, carrots, and cucumbers. An excellent thick and creamy Blue Cheese Dressing made the taste buds come alive.   Then came the piece de resistance that I was waiting for the most: a 12-oz. Filet Mignon prepared Oscar style with King Crab, asparagus spears, and a generous amount of Bearnaise Sauce ladled over the top. The steak wasn't the best I ever tasted but it was probably in the top ten.  It was cooked medium rare as ordered; it did melt in the mouth once I reached its middle; and I found it to be well seasoned and tender throughout with no noticeable char. It had been beautifully prepared on the grill above white-hot burning mesquite wood by a chef who clearly knows how to cook premium beef to order, as other steaks at my table were cooked medium and medium well as ordered, with everyone pleased with their entree. The crab and Bearnaise Sauce were also of high quality. Only the spears of asparagus were lacking in appearance and flavor; they were undistinguished thin, green--or in some cases yellow-tinged--reeds. My Baked Potato was good but not soft all the way through on the inside.  It could have benefited from a few more minutes in the oven.   The large array of included desserts from the Chef's Pastry Cart were first rate. Chocolate Mousse Cake with chocolate shavings was dense and luscious. And a novel Bananas Foster that was self-contained in a martini glass was very fine, replicating all of the elements of the more common flambeed variety. Cut pieces of banana, melting vanilla ice cream, and the requisite liqueur all mixed together very well to create a tasty sauce and a memorable dessert.  The only untoward moment was when my wife, Diane, mistook for a Pirouette Cookie an inedible cinnamon stick that was lodged in the Bananas Foster, and almost broke a tooth!   The meal as a whole was a solid 4-1/2-star experience. An oasis of fine dining does indeed reside inside Circus Circus Las Vegas Hotel & Casino.

Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Mousse Cake

V4UOJlbrsAEnpNWH2pq4kA.text: I wanted to love THE Steak House. Supposedly great steaks in an almost historic setting, at a somewhat reasonable price level, since you get decent sides with any order. I thought we would give them a try, instead of going to Prime as usual.  We had a filet mignon and two porterhouse steaks.  The filet was serviceable but nothing special.  The porterhouse steaks looked impressive, but also had an odd butterfly look, and were quite thin on the strip side. We had ordered medium rare for both, but the filet side showed up as medium or more, and the strip side was medium/well-done.  Both steaks had a lot of hard internal fat, and seemed entirely without flavor. Overall they seemed like the kind of random steaks you might pick up at a supermarket you haven't been to before. Not even close to Prime quality. This was Select at best.  Service was slow, disinterested, but polite. We asked for some sauces, thinking they must have some nice sauces to help the steaks. The waiter said sure and returned with steak sauce and hot sauce bottles. I see now after the visit that they have pepper corn and cheddar cheese (?) sauces "available upon request". Well, we did in fact request sauces for the steaks. Had I known this at the time, I would have called the manager for an explanation. I mean, why are we paying north of $200 for bad steaks and industrial steak sauce, like we were in some dingy dinner?  I have only once in my life returned a food order. I prefer to just not come back, and avoid making a fuss. However, this time, literally feeling unwell after ingesting overdone subpar meat mixed with hard gelatinous fatty stuff, I did severely regret not sending it all back to the kitchen.  Not sure what happened here. Perhaps our waiter took an immediate dislike to our small party, which included a young child, and sent us the worst steaks he could find in inventory.  However, other reviews mention flavorless steaks.  In short, the Steak House needs to seriously rethink their approach to being a steak house. In the meantime, I would avoid at all cost.

BAe-gyfbRRV7wohH_9yL8w.text: One of the best steakhouses i've ever been too.  The food was phenomenal!!  I came in for Restaurant Week but I dont see this being  my last encounter with the CC. My steak was cooked perfectly and they had sweet crab meat on top just to tease my tastebud..They even  cure some of their meat on site... can you say noms?!?!?!  The only issue I have is they don't have a drink or cocktail  menu which I thought was kinda odd and you have to go through gaggles of annoying tourists to get to the steakhouse but all in all that doesnt take away from the tastiness of the meal...

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant Week !

befYVtu7VBr2IOgD8pwmEQ.text: Hit this restaurant every year on the annual trip to Vegas.  One thing is for certain... you will not leave this place hungry.  A bread basket is delivered to your table upon seating and all dinners come with a salad and potato...very good portions.  Ordered the prime rib on the last visit - perfectly seasoned and they understand what "medium" means.  Service is consistently solid - very attentive without being obtrusive.    This restaurant is "tucked away" off the beaten path but the word is out...would definitely recommend making reservations ahead of time.

-S-io6pBCkR1CsdAbeyUkQ.text: I was hoping The Steakhouse fulfilled my expectations.  Ordered filet mignon- steak was very flavorless. .. needed some seasoning.  Husband ordered ribeye; it needed some trimming - it had way too much side fat.  Sides were average.  Wouldn't return.

D1cYiW8Q_rIqN3KzBUV1SA.text: The steaks where perfect!!! The Chef who must have been 6'2 tall he was a one man show!!! He had everything under control it was delicious. It's the best kept secret in Vegas. Our server Mike was on it!!! Everyone did a great job!!

Ys8ouAOj_DEq8MOlvR-QdQ.text: The Steakhouse located inside Circus Circus is a hidden gem and a culinary delight. Being on the north end of the Las Vegas Strip and in a family friendly casino will keep some people from finding out about this eatery. The restaurant has old school decor with dark woo and red leather booths. The prime rib I had with salad was excellent and the service was fantastic.

if-wiBl6jX_WgXx6hVyJbg.text: I think my steak knife was dull because I had a bit of a hard time cutting through my porterhouse, but when I put the medium rare to medium hunk of meat in my mouth, I was thrilled and rewarded bite after bite.  Both sides of the steak were full of smokey taste and super tender.  Undoubtedly one of the top 3 best steak experiences I've ever had.  Peter Luger being one and SW being the other...  Everything else about the dinner was wonderful.  Waiter was knowledgeable, decor was "old school", sides were plentiful, nice wine selection, cost was very reasonable.  Overall a GREAT value.    Will be back and will definitely recommend!!!

aE9PNZAdhI-Rc4WCAu61mQ.text: I have to think the Steak House reviews benefit from a lot of people that don't have the opportunity to get a good steak that often.  I found myself disappointed, especially given the number of options for steak in Las Vegas.  A friend and I dined here; I had the porterhouse, he the main filet, both medium rare.  The ingredient quality was good and the temperature was right, but generally the steaks were not flavorful and had no crust.  Clearly there are many styles of preparation and not all will be seasoned or have a crust, but that is my expectation for an American-style steakhouse, which the Steak House is clearly trying to achieve.  Ambiance was good, classic decor, red leather booths.  Service was excellent, I think the waiter's name was Mitch.

rj25VBAmowb4TmaM-CdG6w.text: Don't be fooled by it being in Circus Circus.  It is great steak, great old school vibe, and you don't have to pay for all the frills you get elsewhere, that you don't even want.  I would repeat!!

FtoZ4J51ylhxDI0_dOom5g.text: Still, one of the best. Choice cuts, not prime if you care. Prices have risen recently. Now, one of the more pricey steakhouses, even though salad and potato are included. Cozy bar. Lots of dark wood and banker green light shades on the sconces add to the warm atmosphere of the place.  Not meant for small children (like 3 & 6 years old), although who doesn't take small children to Vegas casinos for a getaway...? It's not chucky cheese.  A good place to take out-of-town visitors.

J4kgNe3f5bb325xxHHLv7g.text: Old school Vegas steakhouse.  The waiter, can't remember his name but I think it was Rick, was fantastic.  Knowledgeable and good servicing.  Came with 2 friends on Tuesday night at 5:30.  Drinks specials before 6pm!    First course was house salad with honey mustard.  The dressing was a little heavily poured but good nonetheless.  For dinner, I ordered the petite filet (medium) with garlic mashed potatoes and chef's choice of vegetable (carrots)....paired with house Cab.  Meat was cooked perfectly along with the carrots.  The garlic potatoes were excellent.    Dessert was sampler of creme brulee, basically 4 small squares:  plain, strawberry, raspberry and chocolate.    If you are into steak, this place is worth a stop.  Would go again.

cyIJ2EvopwSA5HG9mpo3FA.text: This is a very different restaurant from the type we normally select in Las Vegas. Everything screams out "old school," from the waiters to the red vinyl booths. You are not going to find any molecular gastronomy on the menu, nor can you expect to pay those types of prices. But if you are looking for a great value for a simple steak cooked to your liking, it is hard to beat what The Steak House has to offer.  For starters, both my wife and I chose the house salad with an Italian vinegar etre. The salad was quite large, and full of fresh, crispy vegetables. The dressing was tangy but not overly sweet. For the main course, my wife chose the lobster tail, while I opted for the "petite" cut of prime rib. This was my first mistake of the evening. Actually, two mistakes: one was that I ordered the prime rib cooked medium well, which as everyone knows is just a rookie move. The second was that I assumed "petite" meant...well, small. The huge slab of beef that was set on my plate threatened to topple over the table. Since I'm not someone who can eat a huge amount of cow at one sitting, I barely made a dent in my plate. This leads me to suggest that sharing a meal at The Steak House might be a viable option, assuming you can agree on what to order and how you like it cooked.  We finished up our meal with quite possibly the best coffee I've had at a restaurant. A perfect ending to what was a good (not great) meal. I can definitely see the appeal of The Steak House, but I think the Zagat score of 28 is awfully high.

yEkw8TkmiLfSVC7LCL3sxQ.text: WOW ! Good steaks here people. Too bad one has to walk through Circus Circus to get to it. Make sure you call for reservations as we saw the hostess turn quite a few groups away. If you like your meat rare but not "purple" , ask for "rare plus". It was perfect for my taste.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye bone in...rare plus

ADYUJhuV0N14qA3-HrGZwg.text: I was so pleasantly surprised by this restaurant. The decor and atmosphere were great and the food was too. Service was amazing and the steak was fantastic. It was surprisingly affordable for the quality and service that we got.

X9IK5kTt3BO4TQzHVMhw_Q.text: We went with a large group of people about 24 of us. At first it was pretty overwhelming with the smoke in the restaurant because they grill out in the open. I ordered a fillet mignon medium rare and it came probably medium to medium well and had no flavor. I was very very disappointed, it was tough to eat as well. I will not be back!

DoqdPDmJJlZ5d52ayePjNg.text: Food was good, but service was not great. Need to stay competitive especially with service for the locals.

2X5xwyFUmaLZDz8QnWPmpA.text: Best steakhouse in Vegas. Hands down. When I was first recommended I was pretty skeptical. I mean who goes to Circus Circus? Nobody. Exactly. Oh boy was it a big surprise!!! One of the best restaurants in Vegas.

uFJoU3O-l81WP48Hz9kbnw.text: Seen the tips and kinda drove out of the way to find. Such a great place, kinda of pricey. But food and service is worth it. Walking in seeing pictures of cows,kinda seems cheesy.Until to you see the glass age room, where all the meat is kept. Then you smell they cook over a live wood burning grill. They went out of their way to squeeze us in,and from then on. Service was great. Like the fact that its pricey without being snobby.Real layed back and comfortable vibe.We'll be back there everytime we make to Vegas now.

S76axX6YtD7XXZbWK5HWAw.text: My goodness the people everything was just amazing the service was just incredible let alone the food wow!! If I can give more stars I would

lP5101-X9IO_wakJ34LPuQ.text: Loved it. Steaks were delicious and perfectly cooked, in a little oasis in the craziness that is Circus Circus. Had the petit filet with mashed potatoes and veg; this is old school food. No fusion anything here, and it's done beautifully.  Wouldn't have been the least bit surprised if the Godfather himself were seated in one of the booths; the decor is for reals authentic steak house.

w67vnejzAkTx_aECMf-Lmw.text: Third review ......same as the last few. Still the best. The quality is still top notch. Service and atmosphere A+. You really can't do any better than this place. Would love to add a extra star !

UiFwJzjWyDPsogk_gsUkjA.text: I still laugh and snicker at the idea that a 5 star steak house can be located in a Wal Mart Casino, but its True, it does exist... I can prove it twice!  We decided to be "big Vegas spenders" for one night and hit The Steak House.  There really was nothing done wrong from the time we entered until the time we left.  Very relaxing and comfortable environment.  The food... fresh and generous with the steak being phenominal!  Sure, its pricier than say the Sizzler, but then there really is very little comparison between the two establishments.  Two people can top $100 without any problem, and as much as it is, I can say its worth it.

WeqepkkkXmHFZWx2PpE_2Q.text: This is the most amazing steakhouse I have ever been to. The original cigar. The best. The rest, while good, will never, ever match it.   The interior. The layout. The staff. The service. The steak. Everything was 5 star. Amazing. Quiet, Classic. Total high class upper 1% of steakhouses in the world. It's authentic, classic, and everything is original. I felt like I was taken back to a different era.   It's dark. Dim. Perfect lighting. Exactly how a classic steakhouse should be. The steaks are cooked over two huge charcoal grills in the middle of the steakhouse. You can see your steak being cooked. They have a suction vent sucking all the smoke from the middle but the coals crackle and pop and the air is permeated with the amazing smell of large salt and pepper seasoning on grilled steak.   The steaks are also dry aged in the steakhouse for days or months under perfect climate controlled conditions. You can see the steaks behind the glass. Their wine list, while not extensive, is almost perfectly selected. I would only ask they add Shiraz or some more expensive wines by the glass to the menu.   I have been to many steakhouses in Vegas and this is the #1 Steakhouse in my opinion. They are probably refusing to pay publicists or journalists in the media which is why you rarely see media raving about them expect in Zagat magazine which they have been ranked #1 for 30 years and I can see why.   They could easily double or triple their prices would it not be they were located in the Circus Circus Casino.

TwR2ABjj9g39mgInbJ-cpg.text: Love it love it.  When you walk in the wonderful aroma of grill fills the air. The service is great and you get a full meal at a great price.  They never disappoint always a perfectly cook steak.

7RjOvHecbSbUIl6DTEiHhQ.text: This has always been our go-to for steaks when we are in Vegas.  Anyone who vacays in Vegas knows this place has the best steaks on the strip.  I agree with other posters that the parking is horrid and this casino is not the safest place to be on the strip.  We had a long, scary walk from the parking garage to the restaurant.  Once we arrived, the staff was so nice and immediately acknowledged our 25th wedding anniversary.  We have eaten here many times and have always had stellar service.  Not this time....not horrible service but certainly not what we have experienced in the past.  Hubby and I both ordered filets and I ordered a lobster tail (I always get the same thing when I eat here).  Our salads were good but the dressing on mine was so heavily laden with vinegar that I could not eat it.  I even asked for blue cheese dressing to add to my salad in the hopes I could salvage it but that was also a fail.  My husband was fine with his salad and he enjoyed his steak which was prepared correctly.  Mine was not prepared as I requested but I did not send it back (I should have).  The lobster tail was the real problem.  I noticed when the waiter pulled it from the shell to serve it to me that it looked very tough and charred (the restaurant is very dark so it was hard to see).  I took a bite and could barely chew it.  Bottomline, it should not have left the kitchen and should have never been served.  I sent it back and they brought another.  It was prepared correctly but lacked flavor.  I don't think it was fresh at all.  For the price of this meal, I should have sent my entire meal back but I didn't because I did not want my husband to have to wait on me.  Kudos to the front of the house host for coming to the table and apologizing and they did end up removing the lobster tail from our bill.  The restaurant did insist that we take a dessert with us (chocolate mousse torte which was delicious) on the house BUT as a result of this experience, we will probably try other steakhouses the next time we visit Vegas.  This was a huge disappointment for us because we always eat here and look forward to it.  This was suppose to be our dinner to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary.  Our visit this time was memorable for all the wrong reasons.

R9xDQrpvgCEPJYCgJ8TqTw.text: We went to The Steak House to celebrate my father's birthday on a Friday night.  Granted the smoke from the grill was out of control when we walked in there, we had a great experience.   The ambience is that of a traditional old school steakhouse. I fondly remember going to these types of places with my grandfather.  Even the service was awesome, people were constantly refilling our water glasses and checking in on us.   I had a petite filet and everything that came with it.  It was tasty and delightful to eat. I don't get steak very often so this was a treat to have.  The dessert cart was great too but on second thought if you're a chocoaholic you should try the chocolate mousse cake for sure.  It's a must and thanks to my father I had a bite of it.  The chocolate dessert I had wasn't as good.   As people have said, walking into Circus Circus you wouldn't expect a great restaurant like this.  If you're at this end of the strip, this steakhouse is a MUST.

foQmEWtmSVemT3KOtZzaHA.text: Yes... go here!!!  The ambiance, the food, the service.... top notch!  I love steakhouses and have been to many all over the country.... This is one of my favorite ones.... Don't let the fact that it is inside an older casino fool you.... you will love it.

z23lh4ENsZO58eAt6neqFQ.text: By far one of the best steak houses in town. You also got to love that old school las vegas feel. Ive been enjoying the steaks here since i was a kid. I start off with their shrimp cocktail and finish with their bone in rib eye. I feel like a caveman when they bring out that massive steak for me.

9fd5pbN3uS_kT-57sg_YSQ.text: An amazing experience from start to finish. The wait staff are "lifers" - a rare breed in America today. The filet? As good as it gets. Asparagus was overcooked but rice was fluffy and delicious and the tiramisu and chocolate covered strawberries gave our meal a perfect finish.  The exhibition kitchen is one-of-a-kind.This historic steakhouse is an absolute must for anyone visiting Las Vegas. Forget STK and all that pseudo-Miami Beach crap. Dine here

JW0QOTBkHJVS-wCGm_-upw.text: I have been here several times and the food as always, phenomenal. Service always spoils a good dining experience especially at the prices charged which I absolutely don't mind. Initial service awesome but once it got busy, the staff could not keep up. Manager is under-staffing and at this price range it makes no sense.

MPmUcbMK4I7qNY4qoIhj7g.text: Circus Circus is a little run-down and the complete opposite of hip and happening, but, when you walk down that dimly lit 20 ft entryway to The Steakhouse, you get transported to a new world.  The Steakhouse is legit, fully equipped with white tablecloths, dark wood, dim but sufficient lighting, without the pretense of the typical Las Vegas big boobed hostess with cleavage hanging out of her LBD.  The rib eye was succulent and seasoned just right to complement and let you taste the meat.  They offered a spiced sauce, but it's a crime to use it.  The steak with plain asparagus and wild rice is simple but very well executed.

6p50X8V_bVC48el2p5nPsg.text: Old School on the Strip  One of the oldest survivors of Vegas' old days, THE Steak House is a local's favorite for good reason. Good steaks and all the sides and apps you are looking for. And unlike most steakhouses today, your entree includes a starch and veg.

DTOfV9rP-9gjzZ_sdUERGw.text: After countless trips to Las Vegas over the years and always hearing great things about the Steakhouse at Circus Circus, we just never went. There was always a new steakhouse to try or it was just the fact that we didn't want to venture in to "Clown Town" unless we had to. This last boys trip we decided to go retro and give the old girl a try. She did not disappoint. The place was packed with diners and it had the cool old Vegas feel to at as soon as you walked in. Most of the wait staff has been there since the day they opened including the bartenders. The decor, vintage 80's brass, green marble and cherry. The unique mesquite wood broiler smoke wafts through the air wetting your appetite for a great steak. The shrimp cocktail was the best I've ever had in Las Vegas with lighter horseradish sauce that delights. I didn't get a pic because we ate is so fast we forgot. Every dish was a winner and the prices are fantastic. Half of what you might spend at Prime in Bellagio and others. Great food, fun, and service in the most Vegas of ways.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0uH1_6BjzvCHrvTyYhOb7A.text: Seems like every time I do a search for great steakhouses in Vegas, this one pops up so I decided to give it a shot. Bottom line it was good, not great. I had the larger filet and my wife had the chicken. The nice thing is the entree's come with choice of potato and a vegetable (asperagas) . I should have asked beforehand and asked for another choice!  Like I said, the steak was good and cooked right. It came with a side of bernaise sauce, which is not my thing. The steak was like $67 and my wife's chicken was $40. My wife is a very picky eater, but loved the chicken. We both ordered the onion soup which was like $12 each... it was good and I polished it off, my wife said it tasted funny and did not finish it. One thing that I thought was odd was that the entrees come with either a house salad or bean soup...we did not receive a discount for the onion soup and were not offered the salad (or bean soup). The bill with tip came to $150. One thing to note... this is inside Circus Circus, so there were many kids inside and it was a bit noisy. The best steak I have ever had was at Prime inside Bellagio... but that was a $400 tab!!

-yTETR6jmvRJFUzvtIajZg.text: Being a 32 year old millennial, I always wished I grew up in old Vegas to see what it was like and this place was definitely it!  Being seated by a Matre' D who's been there for decades was pretty cool.  The atmosphere was great and exactly what I expected for THE Steak House!  Our waiter was great! My steak come out a little over done, but they made up for it 10 fold and bent over backwards trying to make it right.   The food was delicous and the wine list was great!  Def Recommend THE Steak House!

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite filet Mignon is 8oz
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the old style steakhouse look!

8SJPmgHNlDW4x9o7LlqmAA.text: The best steak in town. We had bone in rib eye & filet mignon. Very juicy & they grilled just right. The waiters were very professional. A hidden gem in circus circus. The restaurant is nothing fancy. If you are serious in steaks, this is a right choice

UJtE8NcUCm5FbqU_E6_-Mg.text: Robert is the best server;) and food is delicious. Thank you so much Robert we going come back

Uixk81kFXVguLMsSJSKYqg.text: Don't judge a book by its cover. As in don't judge the steakhouse for being in circus circus. If you want an exceptional steak, this is a great place to go. The open grill and smell of wood burning in a dimly lit New York style steakhouse makes for a great experience. You'll spend some coin here, but it's a neat place located in a Fremont street style casino at the end of the strip. Been here more than once, and I would come back when visiting Vegas again.

ValgoqwKOSqx5aArff3ffg.text: Absolutely, hands down BEST steak house in Vegas. Been going there for 25 years.   Tonight, my wife.left her cell phone and other items. I called and manager, RON said i will bring it to you. He drove all the way to Summerlin to where we were staying at the Red Rock Casino which is a good 30 minute drive. I offer RON some gas money which he refused to take.  This place rocks and Ron is the ultimate dude. Thanks Ron!!!!

IYfGIU-N1VOMLRmsspXz7g.text: The husband and I rarely ever indulge in a "high end" meal. We figured Vegas would be the time to treat ourselves.   This place is your old school steakhouse vibe and I dig it. From the pictures of the cows leading to the restaurant, the dry aging room and the dim lighting, the ambiance is on point.   Service, Top notch. Everyone that is working here has been here forever and takes pride in their work. Our waiter was great, friendly, attentive and speedy.  Husband had the prime rib and said it was delicious. I had a steak and it was cooked to perfection. My only wish was that it had a little more seasoning on it. The sides were nothing to write home about to be honest.  All in all, it was a very good experience and I would go again.

R4nrXd5I1BimBUnvZQQhTQ.text: I so bad wanted to give 5 stars...our waiter was awesome, the ambience was truly amazing and reminiscent of a very expensive 5 Star French restaurant. The waiter suggested we just split because my wife was ordering the French onion soup and we ordered king crab legs for appetizer. They charge a $20 upgrade if you want to split an entree and get an extra salad and potato but we didn't need that he said. Also said if we did want it later he could add it. The king crab legs where awesome and fresh. The cocktail sauce was amazing. We ordered the 16 oz NY strip and we where looking for the flavor we find back home at Jeff Ruby's or Tony's....it just wasn't there. We ordered Medium and it was cooked to perfection. The meat had some gristle in it and the flavor was from the grill and not the meat. Overall we enjoyed and would recommend...just can't give it 5 stars because of the steak flavor (meat itself....not seasoning).

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PUUi6SfmCLHrV_fQlwyXOg.text: Came Here Only Because of the High Ratings and Stellar Reviews. The Food Quality For the Most Part Just Wasn't There, But the Real Short Fall Was the Terribly Slow Service.       AMBIANCE: is Charming! Love the Dark Woods, Classic Fixtures and Decor. The entry way With View to Meat Aging is Unique as well! The Circus Circus seemed well kept on its Interior, not smoky or dingy, We were Well Surprised!        SERVICE: Maybe the Slowest We Have Ever Had, It took 30 Minutes (literally) To Be Greeted, During Which We Were Able To Order Only Drinks, 10 Minutes Later (Total 40mins) We Were Finally Able to Order Our Food! That Should Not Occur At Any Establishment, Especially Not A Steakhouse! Never Even Had a Chance to Order More Drinks From Our Server (which we really wanted!) The Service Assistant Was Constantly at Our Table (wish we brought cash to hand him, he deserved it) Which We Appreciated!         FOOD:  The Sides Tasted Like That of a Chain Restaurant that Microwaves Everything, & Its Appearance was to Match Unfortunately. After Waiting 40mins to Order Our Food Came Out in 10mins Or Less(Not Sure How I Feel About That, Both A Good & Bad Thing?!?) We Ordered The Twin Lobster Tails and They Were Both Very Tough and Leathery. We have To Give Credit To The Petite Filet Which Was Wonderfully Textured and Flavored! The Bread Brought To The Table Was Also Very Good!          Never Made It To Dessert Unfortunately We Wanted To But After Sitting For 20 Minutes After Finishing Our Main Course and No Waiter At Our Table Still, We Figured We Better Take Our Chances Elsewhere! I Really Wanted To Like This Place!

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black Bean Soup Was Tastey
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. WINE list
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. WINE list

MrB0zVbMhsrBIxmvp69Uug.text: Here is another past favorite of mine and 25 years since last in for dinner. Have asked for white Moscato drink, bananas Foster dessert as my app, a large filet rare, baked potato with butter and bacon. Moscato is really good. Have to sit at bar stool area since no other choice is available. I am determined to refresh my great food memories of this beautiful spot in a most unsuspecting environment of lots kids circus, carnival entertainment. Always a big surprise for new diners!! So...dinner was excellent. Filet about inch and three quarter thick. Good enough there. Tender was excellent. The shrimp were overlooked and missed my table. Oh well. Nothing missed likely. Overall still a favorite here and I'll be back, with friends next visit. Gtyup Brian attended all requests very well.

ZZU97ovx15Nst6IHNqsmOQ.text: Great food, solid service, with True steakhouse ambiance. I've been there a few times and it always fits the bill. The smell from the grill did well to whet my appetite as I enjoyed the seafood sensation in anticipation of a perfectly cooked ribeye. Cheesecake and espresso for dessert topped off a great Las Vegas meal.

0GEzxyyERCFtSOSsdhWqlg.text: So I was turned on to this by a friend. He knew my preference to aged steaks. This was a great find. I cannot say enough! Let me keep it simple. This is the Bern's steakhouse of the West! NUFF SAID!

rRmPtCnUimXu5p7Iv60MfA.text: My husband and I went to celebrate our first wedding anniversary here. The service was amazing and the food was incredibly delicious. Chea was our waiter and he was so kind, even brought a piece of chocolate cake for our celebration. We will definitely be returning and recommending to our friends and family.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in rib-eye
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f4TpqJfQtBCruoUsFHresA.text: Blast from the past! Very nostalgic look at the old days of Vegas. Very expensive museum or great steakhouse? Very expensive museum. Lots of awards on the wall for best steakhouse.  Congratulations!  Year 2000 was the last time though. Steaks are around $65. Caesar salad instead of Classic salad? $6 extra. $18 martinis. 2 in our party ordered well done. Received medium well. Not even close! My bone in rib eye was incredibly fatty. Really nothing special here unless you have a penchant for nostalgia and have lots of money to waste.

74Hr8gmLkHnAIwKsA-wwLQ.text: We had a 9:15 reservation for 4, as soon as we were seated, we were told to hurry and order as the kitchen closes soon. A bug ran across the table and when pointed out to the busboy, he "scuffed" it with his breadcrumb scrapping tool, scooting it onto the floor removing the creatures legs in the process.  Those stayed on our table for the meal. He walked off and spoke to our waiter, who spoke to who I assumed was the manager, but this event never was acknowledged.  We ordered 3 steaks one well done, two medium rare, and lamb chops well done, the lamb came out 15 mins after our steaks. I ordered the big cut prime rib, of which maybe 20% was great meat, the rest was either fat, or gristle, unfortunately my wife's undercooked ribeye was on par with the amount of digestible content as my prime rib. The waiter dropped off the check thanking us for dining with them, and kept moving. We paid our bill, with the tip reflecting the level of service.  Take your money to a real steakhouse, not this circus act.

8Y2UnsiQ8Woeh6nX__J2hw.text: Once you walk in this fabulous steakhouse you'll forget that you're at the Circus Circus   The meat is all cooked perfectly over wood. You get that amazing mix of charr and smoke.   The sides like most other steak houses in town are average. The focus is on the meat. That's why you're going right?   The Caesar salad is well made and the sauce had a nice tang to it.   They bring you a wonderful assortment of breads and the pretzel bread is heavenly.   Service is excellent

-ljDyFHj7bvpjAVyAG1VnQ.text: Just got back from eating at the Steak house. The service was very attentive and we had birds eye view to the cooks who grill all the steaks. The good: extensive wine and drink menu, bread, salad and chocolate mouse.  Average: dessert - Tiramisu (too sweet). Disappointing: prime rib and ribeye - not enough seasoning! For the price you pay, you can get far better steaks.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Kbyp6iWg_1oD1cOx5tNBlw.text: WOW. Thank you for a WONDERFUL last meal before we left Vegas. It's expensive, but that is expected when it comes to a steak house in any casino. The service was fantastic. Each person that served us was nice and polite and assisted in any questions that we had. The Steak menu has a choice of 8 or 9 cuts. Everything was cooked to perfection and was exquisite. You will not be disappointed eating here if you are wanting a delicious plate of aged beef.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Strip cooked Medium rare. What a way to leave Vegas.

x34Xgx6J9MAX4ltSVGHjeA.text: So, my dad wanted to go here for Father's day and what kind of son would I be to tell him that he was picking an obviously inferior Vegas strip steakhouse? I will say that this place is better than I was expecting and while it's still nowhere close from the top strip steakhouses (which is hard to visualize when this is 4 stars and they are 5), there just isn't a lot to knock about this place.  It's certainly of a particular style of steakhouse let's get that straight. It has NOT changed with the times at all. It's decor is atrocious but hey it's part of the theme of the restaurant and it works, old fashioned all the way.  My dad claims we used to go there when I was an infant and so when he says it hasn't changed one bit, from the way it looks I believe him.  Ultimately though the food is pretty good. Nothing will blow your mind and nothing will make you say I wanna come back for that specific thing. The menu is uninspiring and you could probably guess off the top of your head 80% of the menu items because they are classic steakhouse staples and nothing more. All of this sounds fairly negative but really since the entire theme of the restaurant is to take you to a different time for steakhouse dining, surprisingly it works.  -Caesar salad. Run of the mill typical caesar salad which isn't a horrible thing. Won't blow you away but should meet your expectations for what a caesar is.  -Filet and Rib eyes. Honestly both are very good. Dry aged and seasoned well they are good pieces of meat. Again you won't be going nuts over them and there are no absurd toppings to put on them (this is one of the only times when my dad asks for A1 to go along with a 60 dollar steak I haven't cringed), but they are very good.  -Cheesecake. I mean the cheesecake was really good. Tasted great. Again it's no fancy cheesecake. There's no liquid nitrogen frozen mint on it, no fruity reductions. It's a slab of cheesecake. A good slab but a standard one.  I don't know how this place is even still open. It doesn't seem like it's ever busy and since there are now 15 reviews for it on yelp I feel like nobody goes here.  But it's still trucking away and at the end of the day if I happen to be in the Circus Circus (and Idk why I would ever do that to myself) and I'm hungry, there are worse places to stop by for a meal.

JV7Xr6CaG-WKiU_qbDJ6nA.text: Great tasting food & excellent service.  The only bad thing about this place is the location.  Circus Circus...ugh!

ZOrxLUGg_DhyiPHgEcJgvQ.text: Please... I am not nit-picking but, this is a step above the outback at best. Yes it is a grungy old school place, it is way dirty and full of grill smoke. Perhaps this is what gives it its 1980 character?  The food- steak is not dry aged for long. It is not terrible, but since I am from NY I am use to real steak from Peter Lugers. Perhaps if I did not compare this place to Lugers, I would think it was ok at best. The crembrule was not freshly made, no attention to detail.  Wedge salad was best part of dinner.   I am not saying don't go here I am saying if you like the outback, you will love this place. If you are a steak person and know what a real dry aged steak is- you will be dissatisfied.

Rp4sofNrg0vvJWLPT5mcVw.text: The marvelous Steak House of Circus Circus, has been voted best restaurant of Vegas for 7 years straight and won numerous other awards throughout the years, made it to my list of MUST TRY in Vegas.   Therefore, we made reservations. When we arrived, we were seated promptly. An elderly gentleman, Mike, was our waiter and he was superb. The staff were all very attentive, asking how our food was and refilling our waters, without continuously interrupting our conversations. (The water that they serve is purified bottle water, not tab, by default. FREE! It's a plus in my book.)  Splitting the caesar salad and filet mignon, with a glass of Merlot, was about $100 (excluding tips). The caesar salad was good (with anchovies, the traditional way). The filet was asked to be grilled to medium-rare, it perfectly cooked, juicy, and lightly seasoned with salt and pepper. The mash was good, but the asparagus was a tab bit overcooked.   THE Steak House keeps it simple, with no more than 15 items to choose from. However, the food is made right and the service is impeccable.

_FZUdNqg3ScradqhG7EtIg.text: Very good, especially for the price.  Bone-in ribeye was great, wife had filet that was also good.  Could use an upgrade or three, kind of dated, wine list was meh, but the steaks were worth it.

1H4Ge2y91lfuar67t4WFbQ.text: Steak done right. Amidst the old rundown nature of Circus Circus, this restaurant is a nice gem hidden at the end of the strip that I never go to. I was told that this was one of the better steakhouses on the strip, and I think I could agree with that.  Porterhouse steak ($48) was a nice, big cut that would most definitely satisfy any man's craving for meat. I think the prime rib was another popular choice that many diners opted for.   The Steakhouse is worth a try in my opinion.

kGutliUcZGIsxeySIpxfiQ.text: Perfect meal with perfect service. The salad was fresh and delicious. The crab legs were sliced open and were served with butter over a flame. Server was as good as they come! I hope to go back soon.

sV0zhLlhUq4vgVsn3wi7qA.text: I'm not sure if I just came on an off night or what, but we came to celebrate my birthday after reading all the great Yelp reviews. Maybe it just wasn't what I expected after reading all the Yelpers raving about this place. Had reservations for 7 and was seated immediately on arrival.   The place is dark and the decor is oldish looking. Maybe they were going for the antique look? it just looked old to me. Upon walking in past the reception desk we were taken past a raised cooking area where the chefs cooked the steaks. We were seated in a booth at the back of the restaurant. Seat in the booth was comfy.   The service was good. Wait staff kept our waters filled with bottle water and checked on us often. Bread basket was good. The butter was cold and hard as rock when it first got to the table. :/ As for the salad well. It was a salad. That was fine. From my meal, the things I liked most was the French onion soup and garlic mashed potatoes. Those were very yummy. The steak fell very short of what I expect from a great steak. I hold Ruth Chris as my absolute favorite place for steak. I have also been to Morton's (in Hawaii) and Gallager's (in the NYNY hotel). I would rank Gallager's as my close second. But all of these are a better choice than The Steak House at Circus Circus. And to be honest I find even Stuart Anderson's/The Cattle Company to have better steak than this place. When presented with my entree it looked good. But after my first bite of my steak I was greatly disappointed. It lack any seasoning. No salt, pepper. Nothin'. It also had charred grill marks that made the steak taste burnt. Even after attempting to make the steak more palatable by cutting off the char and adding some salt and pepper I still couldn't get myself to eat more than half of it. And I'm a girl that LOVES meat. I can eat a whole cowboy ribeye at Ruth Chris myself.  I will stab your hand with my fork if you try to take it from me when I didn't offer you any. And I will eat all of my yummy ribeye like the merry piggy I am when I am eating steak. But with this steak, I couldn't. The more I tried to make myself eat it because it was quite a costly ribeye ($54), the more I didn't want it. The char flavor had permeated the meat and cutting off the top and bottom didn't take away that burnt taste. It was sad that I had to waste it because I absolutely could not get myself to eat it.   I highly doubt I will try this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye steak entree with garlic mash and asparagus. The charred flavor killed it. One of the worst steaks I have ever had.

kMd8hN-nO9RSUcWrDtlAYg.text: I love this restaurant. I took my kids to vegas (age 6 and 3yrs) and i just had to get my steak fix so i took them. I was apprehensive because its a fancy steak house but i couldn't be in vegas and not come here. My waiter was great and didn't make me feel uncomfortable in the slightest. As always my food was great and my kids loved it too.  2 very enthusiastic thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half dozen oysters. The bread for the tablewas amazing
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye on the bone for me. Kids got petite filets
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black bean soup and salad for the kids. This soup is so yummy

y8atAeDpXUXHcjhbwiqhvA.text: This was our signature meal of our trip. They do Steak, Seafood and Lamb Chops. The portions are generous and the salad and bread with the meal is Fantastic. The restaurant is Located inside Circus Circus which is slightly off the main strip but it is soooo worth the walk. Filet Mignon, Porterhouse, Strip - they have it. It has the feel of a 40's steak house and the smell is phenominal. Our steaks were Perfection and the Lamb Chops were HUGE - so were the Shrimp. If you have one "expensive" meal eat here. about 60/meal [not including appetizer or alcohol] but the steak comes with sides and a large salad. There is plently of Mood lighting and it does seem a little dark but everything is fantastic once your eyes adjust! Fine dining without a fine dinning dress code. Awesome!  Visited June 2016

X9Dolq-y_LvXd3KUt5gFOA.text: Amazing Steak house for Circus Circus. Old school, old look, old flavor. Highly recommended.

WrIENg6dSeoqFezq5ttO7Q.text: We met an awesome bartender Jorge at the west bar and we told him we were looking for a good steakhouse to eat that night  to celebrate our 12th wedding anniversary. He suggested the steak house and said it was the best one in Vegas, and he was so right and I'm glad we took his advice. This was the best steak house yet! We had a very awesome waiter named Felix. He was super friendly, very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. We started with seafood platter which was delicious. Followed by our porter house steak with a baked potato with all the fixings and followed by a giant piece of delicious cheesecake! Felix made our first experience here a very memorable one! Him and Jorge were the best hosts and servers to us last night and made our anniversary a very special and memorable night by simply being kind, friendly and taking care of us! I recommend this steak house for anybody looking to have a great steak dinner with great people. I also recommend seeing the awesome, fun and friendly bartenders at the west bar!

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious seafood platter at The SteakHouse
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our anniversary shots of patron at the West Bar

phNrR228fNf7uV__sZ-gFg.text: Super cool atmosphere.  You get the feeling that Frank and the Rat Pack are going to come waltzing in.  Great decor.  Very Old School Vegas. Waiters are True professionals and run the business efficiently. Now the bad part.  The food.  The bread basket was inedible except for the bread sticks. Ceaser Salad came out of the fridge cold and pre-made.  The parmesan seemed like it came from Costco, and there were no anchovies on the salad.  It really shouldn't be that difficult for a great steak house to make a decent Caesar. Next the New York Strip came out.  It was literally shoe leather.  It was also not only under seasoned, it was unseasoned. The waiter like at any great steak house took it back and replaced it with an extra petit filet.  The cut was great, but again unseasoned.  Finally, the side of mushrooms had a canned quality too them. The waiter did not charge me for my steak, but I didn't want a free steak, I wanted a great steak. I really wanted to like this place and return to Old Vegas.  Too bad!

sibM-gdhT0CJoOWuBlWEsA.text: The Steak House is not what it used to be. Arrived on time and it took over 20 minutes for them to sit us. Asked the waitress for a Sierra Nevada when she's asked what we would like to drink never received my drink. The steak was one of the worst I have experienced especially with a $66 price tag. The asparagus was boiled and had no taste.  We asked to take our leftovers which was almost the entire steak and did not get a paper bad like they used to provide. Instead we got plastic bags like you would get at a fast food store. Overall worst experience at a Steak House.

ZLiAb65GlKFYEoF9aRM1OQ.text: This steakhouse is a lovely gem hidden inside of Circus Circus.   Atmosphere: Dark and elegant. Felt like I time warped back to the Mad Men era. Sat in a nice big booth with a friend. Atmosphere was perfect for having a nice dinner and conversation.   Food/Drinks: I started with a Bloody Mary. It was my least favorite part. It just didn't taste any different than someone pouring tomato juice and a splash of vodka in a glass. I was expecting something a little more. I ordered the filet mignon for dinner. It was absolutely delicious.   Staff: Our waiter was very charming and professional.   I'm giving this place only 4 stars because of the location. It was difficult to find inside of Circus Circus and my Bloody Mary was less than stellar. Aside from that, I'd go here again.

1vN6VnHuFZYKlok3qf5moQ.text: Old school steakhouse, I have eaten here fifteen times or so for twenty years.  The food is very traditional east coast style steakhouse.  The service is exactly what you want from a knowledgeable waiter.

0nkdpdQs1bvc4CcVS8utmQ.text: We were told of this place back in 2009 and went there with a group. All of us were pleased so my husband made reservations for us when we returned. We went early and were greeted by Ron, the manager of 31 years! He sat us in a semi private area and we got our same waiter David who was still there! David took excellent care of us. We got the food festival special which was an 8 oz filet topped with crab meat and a Bearnaise sauce, a salad, choice of potato, asparagus, and a dessert. The meal was exceptional as always and we were so pleased. We told several Uber drivers about The Steak House and one of them took his family Saturday night. He sent us a text that he loved it and would recommend it to others! We already planned another visit this year and will return again to this wonderful restaurant.

fTQ3jVKosCuFTP8EJKgzqw.text: When you walk in to circus circus you don't expect to find such a great restaurant. We were sent here by my husband's boss. Hands down the BEST steak we've ever had.  And our server Richard,  he deserves a raise. Best service we've had. Thank you!

C4yAxjQWC-kppzIVwl00tA.text: The steak is great, very juicy. 5 stars Very best service. Waiter are very attentive.. 5 stars  I got a lot of refills and attention. I definitely will come back.

GQr5FSsDmSeOePNVg86LRg.text: Always my first stop when visiting Vegas.  My first visit was in November 1988 and I go back almost every year.  Great everything.  No words to describe this classic steakhouse.  You just have to go and be transported back to a greater time in dining.  Not sure what will happen if they ever implode the Circus Circus like they have all the other classic hotels on the strip.  I don't want to even think about that but it will happen someday.

RV0mZmLV8zJznIJxSdJlNw.text: I was in town this past weekend with my son and four of his groomsman for his bachelor party.  We needed a steak and found this place here on Yelp.  After the mostly very positive reviews, we decided to go.    Circus Circus.  What can I say.  Wayyyy past its prime.  But nicely hidden, so much so that if you're not really looking you will miss it, is The Steakhouse.  What a nice surprise.    This is a throwback to the old school style steakhouse which my son and I totally love.  Dark wood, cozy surroundings etc.  I was looking for the Rat Pack. (Frank, Dino, Sammy)  You walk right past the grill area when you are seated and we had a table where we could watch the guys cooking the steaks.  Kind of neat.   Just a great atmosphere for eating a steak dinner with friends.  We were greeted by our waiter, Ray, promptly.  I mentioned the bachelor party thing and he immediately lit up and was engaged in making our time a good one.  He is a veteran of the game and knew just how to take care of us.  Drinks and food were ordered and away we went.  Where they stumbled was with the food.  Drinks were great, salads were very good.  But 3 of us had ordered steak medium rare and received medium well.  Also, I ordered a lobster tail with my ribeye and the tail was raw on the inside.  BUT our man Ray handled the situation professionally which is to say with no comment other than a sincere apology and the offer to redo the meals which we accepted.  Unfortunately, a few minute later, a runner came out with my lobster tail which had clearly been nuked in the microwave.  All shriveled up and steaming.  Ray was nearby and I flagged him down and he was aghast.  The ruined tail was taken away no questions asked.  We a were offered a round of free cocktails while we waited and it was a bachelor party so....Way to go Ray.  Unfortunately our 3 friends were done with their meals when our redone meals arrived.  But they arrived completely fresh and perfectly done.   No recycled veggies etc.  In the end we all had terrific meals and were completely satisfied.  But again, the fantastic Ray then offers unsolicited our choice of free dessert or an after dinner drink of our choice.  Again, being it was a bachelor party....We all had generous shots of a nice high end bourbon for "dessert."  So even though there were a few hiccups, the staff handled them very well and we were completely satisfied.  And at a price that was about half of what we would have paid at one of the more notable places like Gordon Ramsey's at the Paris. A great time was had by all.  Thanks Ray.

_7ZjF1h7yCVTp8KXPco0Sg.text: Don't be fooled by the Circus Circus Hotel. This restaurant is delicious and has a cool vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan King Crab legs and Garlic mash potatoes.

1T_OuIbqzsMVFvnJN9XIng.text: On top of my list of great Old School steakhouses in the country. Has that Ratpack/Sinatra feel. The offered an excellent wine selection. We went there as a group of 10 and the meal came out in excellent fashion. We started with cocktails in the bar. At first I felt the bartender was an old curmudgeon but after a half hour or so I realized he probably has seen it all in the last 40 years and nothing phased him. Plenty of hugged booze to choose from. You have to go by the locker where the beef is aged. You will see the process as well as an 18lb lobster they keep around just for conversation starters. I had the petite filet, cooked majestically. The bone in ribeye was their signature steak and offered in large quantities. Btw, the 'petite' filet was 8 ozs while their standard filet is 12 ozs!! They finish your meal with a variety of dessert choices, my favorite is their cheesecake which is flown in from Juniors in NYC. It's at Circus Circus and so worth your trip.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Where the steaks are aged. That&#39;s an 18lb lobster in the window.
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the best steaks I have ever had.

5HtzAyYEanH2KrsAqa1mrw.text: Please!  I have to assume that those who say this is a great steak restaurant haven't eaten anywhere better than the Sizzler, because compared to that, it IS a great steak restaurant.  But if you've ever eaten at any of the great steak restaurants around the country like Peter Lugar's or Mastro's or Joe's or Cut or Prime, then The Steakhouse at Circus Circus is barely okay, and perfectly situated for what it is: an ordinary, verging-on-gaudy place to eat beef.
