But you know what? There's some perverse continuity here....because the rave reviews will continue...and it'll continue to remain a mystery as to why.  In the end, I guess what you know today, is based on what you knew yesterday.

XDawDCD97IxSCqrP_CSWbA.text: My wife and I are both born and raised here in Las Vegas and finally, 36 years later, she brought me here for my birthday. We started with the oysters and each had a steak, but make sure you opt for the black bean soup, it was phenomenal. In fact, everything we had was exceptional, especially the service, Richard, who has been here for 32 years. This place is an absolute gem. Enjoy!!!

X1PFxzTTu3HSNUVUC_NWnQ.text: Really nice! you would have never thought this place was here. Service was off the hook. Steaks were great!

8tSDtwETd-55iouv6ZmslA.text: My husband and I went to the Steakhouse last night.  We ordered the blue cheese wedge, house salad, filet, grilled shrimp and had the key lime pie for dessert (take home).  Everything was exceptionally great.  Our waiter, Felix, was attentive and we never felt rushed at all.  I love the way they bring the bread basket out to munch on before the first course.  The steak was very tender and prepared wonderfully and I think this was the best jumbo grilled shrimp that I have had.  We have been coming here for over 17 years and they never disappoint.  Highly recommend.

EcUJwklPpgsRRzaR6Xz8mg.text: The SteakHouse at Circus Circus is an oasis of old time decadence amongst the Midway stuffed toy frenzy and cheap knock off sales outside.  We celebrated Father's Day there and everybody thought it was a great choice.  The restaurant was celebrating their 30th anniversary so we each had a petitie filet mignon dinner for 30 bucks.  What a deal!  The french onion soup was the best I have ever had and I have sampled many a french onion soup from around the world.  The black bean soup was delicious and they give you a shot of sherry to go with it.  The salad was a throw away and I think they knew it.  So, they didn't charge us for it.  Yay.  The filet was predictably out of this world, perfectly cooked and aged.  The asparagus was okay but not excellent because it was not crisp enough.  The service was superb.  It is what you'd expect from a 5 star steak house.  We had a rambunctious 2 year old with us and they didn't bat an eye.  It was Circus Circus so there were many kids there.  Parents, think. you can bring your crazy little kid to a proper formal restaurant!  We had chocolate covered strawberries and they didn't charge us for that either.  Yum.

AgQo2F-g-5C6mWAU1kYkvQ.text: Great food!!!! Just a little pricey but you do get a good amount of food for the money.

1C_PLBP__31-YMnzFWf9zg.text: Dinner here after my sisters wedding. The old fashioned cocktails are generous. The salad with blue cheese is a must. Steak was absolutely perfect - portions are large! Excellent steak dinner - I had the filet medium rare.

z5BJH0lgGfbSqi2jGKyqFQ.text: We came back for a second time this time Shay was our server. He did an excellent job! The experience was just as wonderful as the first time. This time I ordered the ribeye and it was just as good as I remember it. It had such a good flavor. Again the timing of the meal was perfect. You know it's a good restaurant when the servers have been there for 30 plus years. We will be back on our next trip.

8OWxcj88iqWNrWzj2iMTNQ.text: This was by far the worst service and food I've had. I ordered the lobster tail. It was severely over cooked it was crunchy and though to eat. The server was very sweet her manager Michael on the other hand never once apologized for the overcooked meal. It took over 15 mins for my replacement meal. I cancelled the meal as I lost my appetite from waiting. A few servers were appalled at the lack of concern from there manager. The fact that their own staff cares more than the managers is just baffling  I will never go here again. If I'm going to pay 60 dollars for a lobster I'd rather go somewhere that cares about their customers. My boyfriends steak was also over cooked. I've honestly this was chain restaurant quality.

3lZtog5ddFhIRH85iwvC0w.text: Don't waste your money or time! As a Vegas local we have many options. I have heard great things about this place. Service was bad it started with the old man bartender I am sure he's worked there since day one he was so rude! Service was really slow at the table.   When we finally got our food both my husbands and my steak were over cooked. So we sent them back. Then mine came out raw! I was not going to send it back again so my husband shared his with me. They were nice enough to remove it from the bill (gee thanks considering I didn't eat it) The wine list looked like it belonged at Outback not good quality wines. They cook the steaks where you can see pretty cool, but the ventilation is old and you smell each steak being cooked so we were basically smoked out! I am giving it 1 star because the French onion soup was very good.

umvaTHAZMXeHXe-0HuymXA.text: Excellent. From the super attentive bartender to the incredibly efficient wait staff to the hostess, we enjoyed a unique Vegas experience. If you are pretentious, stay away.  This place is for real people.

bvuvTv60JfQmM-7EmORF6A.text: WONDERFUL STEAK HOUSE! The concierge recommended this steak house for outstanding steaks in a romantic, classy atmosphere. I was wanting to pay for a great steak - and not the name on the door. They were soooo right. The were very accommodating to get us a reservation last minute and we were seated immediately. The wait staff was attentive and the service was excellent. We both chose the recommended bone-in rib eyes ($55) and were delighted with the perfect results. The large dinner salad, delicious side of garlic potatoes and asparagus tips (all included - not a-la-carte) made for a huge meal. Even the desert and french onion soup were memorable. We will DEFINITELY return the next time we travel to Las Vegas!

lfr3TtbFpqSj4Mm78wijBw.text: Came for my sister's birthday.  The staff was super friendly and attentive.  She has a shell fish allergy and they were understanding about cross contamination.  She received a free dessert as well!  It reminds you of old Vegas and you can almost imagine you are sitting in a booth that mobsters sat.  The steaks are of the highest quality and prepared to showcase the flavor of the meat (not highly seasoned like some steak places although sauces are available if you prefer that).  Only complaint is that there were no appetizers that didn't include shellfish so we couldn't order but I'm not taking away from the restaurant for her allergy as they had some wonderful salads and soup.  I can see why it got voted best of Vegas to many times.  A great secret and casual attire is fine.

-jjTwypGq0VQahkofx5FAA.text: Hard to get 5 stars from me but overall it was a great experience.  Fantastic food and a good wine menu.  Like everything on the strip, it was over priced but that is expected in Vegas.  Only issue was the table.  For a party of two, the tables are just not big enough to hold all the fixings.  As for a 4 top table even if there are just two of you.

XgBEeXfZ-xVWyKlRSJI-pQ.text: Can't understand the high priced steaks in Vegas but this steakhouse in CircusCircus is by far worth the money, most tender and flavorfull steak i ever had.

q67fk9XFdeaLY22tTHi8fw.text: Got the filet.  I asked for it medium rare plus.  It was cooked perfectly.  One of the best steaks I've had in Vegas.  Service was 9/10.  Don't let the smoky grungy atmosphere of circus circus deter you from a top ten Vegas steakhouse.  I would definitely go back.

96AlSncLZp1T65Ew_khlzA.text: Loved every bit of this experience.  Of all places, this place is in Circus Circus.  It's a totally different world as soon as you step foot into the restaurant.    The atmosphere is truly a old school steak house.  Loved it!  The salad was soooo fresh!  The steak was amazing - best that I've ever had.  Already made reservations to go back again in November...

xP29TUgER9DPEcTVqisqbA.text: I vistied The Steak House on a recent trip to vegas and i must say YUMMY!! When u first walk in u can see all the meat hangin out in the meat locker. Very nice!!! The service is excellent. My friend put his cig out and the waiter took the ashtray away and replaced it before the smoke disapered!!! The food was OFF THE HOOK!!! Steaks cut with a fork... I would recommend this place to everyone...

bf6NrnQNX0KntbxE4PxoBA.text: Nice steakhouse. The steak is cooked to perfection and delicious. The waiters are very friendly and helpful. Everything I've tried here is delicious. Bill can get high, but the food is high quality and worth it.

clJ4uVrfvriLzPwKUPGLtQ.text: I went here with a group including my colleagues, and was skeptical walking in the door - as everyone says, yes, it's at Circus Circus, and yes, it's good.  Or, at least, it's supposed to be good.  The menu is short, the ambiance reminds me of The Golden Steer on Sahara and the Strip:  old-school, dimly lit, very retro and stodgy/classy.  The food is really very average, but with well above-average prices.  The biggest issues I had with my food were, A) dry steak with little flavor, and B) the sides and appetizers were incredibly average.  Normal salad, normal baked potato, normal to below-average seafood.  It's decidely average, or 3 stars, but with the prices the way they are, it becomes a 2.  It's just fiercely skippable.  Lastly, the wine selection is truly poor.  1 of 5 stars.

4av686N2wDVqZRT1z5t3MA.text: This was our first time in this steak house and we were not disappointed.  Everything was good- from the bread basket to the salad and the main course.  We ordered the bone in rib eye steak, medium and it was cooked perfectly.  Service was also good and best of all, the dress code was casual.  I will definitely go back to this place the next time I am in Las Vegas.

QzSrpyLa-ez5G2JvEdQDxg.text: This steakhouse is no longer what it used to be.  It is still a good steakhouse, but no longer in the upper echelon of Las Vegas steakhouses.  My ribeye was average for the price, and my baked potato was overcooked.  For long time patrons of this restaurant.  Save your trip to Circus Circus and eat elsewhere.

-yhPruNqINCB1KBjF_B93g.text: No one ever believes me when I tell them that Circus Circus has the best steak house and is decently priced... until I take them of course =)  I think they are decently priced for the quality of their food.   I've brought many friends there and all agreed that the place is good.   My last visit was with my boy friend who is a very picky steak eater.  He didnt believe me either but I was taking him on a date so he had no say in what we were going to eat.  Needless to say, he was impressed and stuffed =)  our date was a success!

wqQ50liY6glHd9Ht8rMvTQ.text: I ate here twice in the week I was in Las Vegas.  I was shocked to learn that this was located inside circus circus, once I got over that and walked in the restaurant you forgot that you were even in that casino, the restaurant is really beautiful, a step back in time when service was top to the customer.  I thought it was such a value the second time I brought my older kids back to have a taste of what True service is.  I had the best waitress both times her name is Nancy, I will request her the next time I go back to Las Vegas

e4Jr4fCdNDR5N87nx1ITWw.text: You would never imagine that this excellent steakhouse exists within the most chaotic casino environment that I've ever experienced. But once you cross the threshold you're transported to a totally different place to have a very enjoyable meal.  First off, I don't think the meat is "US Prime", so I took off a star. But it was awesome anyway. I'll credit their aging and cooking process. My meat was cooked precisely to my specification. I ate the whole rib eye and forgot to leave room for dessert.  The prices were very reasonable, considering that they included a salad or soup. I paid a little extra for the Caesar and wasn't disappointed. We never wanted for anything at our table at any time.   Finally, I must credit the fantastic bartender. Our cocktails were all strong and tasty.

ZdnENgLcQRS1CiFmEa878A.text: Great experience.  I took 14 people there without a reservation.  They setup a room for us, served us in an expeditious manner and the food was excellent.  I had the Ribeye with bone-in.  It was cooked perfectly, the mashed potatoes were very good and the salad was very nice.  We had a great time and with a few beers it was still only $77 per person.

E6jOO-8Eik0WxTRRQc5vEg.text: Very good.  Salads, steaks, garlic mash all great. The crap legs yummy too will go back

m-6ho1UZ5RJdsWnYOgMFHw.text: I was a bit disappointed by my experience at the Steakhouse. The cuts of meat were excellent but not well seasoned. I wasn't floored by any dish. It wasn't worth trudging through Circus Circus to dine there. Del Frisco's is MUCH better.

CaAR0Q1zaOfWyMJgL5-ASg.text: The steakhouse at Circus Circus was the best steak my family has ever eaten and we can never eat another steak again as it will be disappointing by comparison. The service was impeccable and I miss it already. We plan to return on our next visit back to Las Vegas.

y4a9BMztYnSvFnRwmtdmaQ.text: Fantastic steak house, what it's doing in Circus Circus beats the crap out of me. My only complaint about this place is the more than creepy photos of cows that surround you as you eat their children... their delicious, perfectly prepared, juicy children.   Bring your evil, this steakhouse is old school carnivore heaven.

JAKiMIM2rEeDpDAsGd4stA.text: We were so sketched by the fact that this highly regarded restaurant was in Circus Circus (!) of all places, that we actually did a drive by a few hours before our dinner reservation to make sure it would be OK to eat here.     Wow, this place was more than OK, it turned out to be fantastic!   This is definitely your traditional old school steak house, warmly decorated in dark greens and mahogany.   We were seated right above where the chef cooks the meet over a mesquite charcoal grill, it's nice because you can watch them prepare your meal.   Dinner starts out with an assortment of breads, followed by a mixed house salad.    I had the "Petite Prime Rib" which actually should be called the HUGE Prime Rib.  It was perfectly medium rare, juicy and delicious and came with a side of mashed potatoes that I practically licked off of the plate.   My husband's Filet Mignon was melt in your mouth good.   Dinner for two was $115 before tip.which is affordable when compared to the other upscale steakhouses on the strip (especially considering that you don't have to order your salad and potatoes a la carte).  The service was great, definitely not pretentious at all.   The servers look like they have been at this for a long time, and were genuinely very nice to us.

6gxdiFRP2CyMYjkgVMOV1g.text: OMG steaks. took my honey there for her birthday and had the best filet I have ever. the prime meat and dry aging produced a killer result. I have eaten here before but do not remember it being quite that good.  super service all the way. has to be the best deal in high end steak houses in las vegas.  dont change a thing.

yKRC4fa783MiUwJknSF1mA.text: The only reason this isn't 5-stars is because the steaks are good but not great. This is a classic Vegas steakhouse so the ambiance is great and so are the staff and service. Best french onion soup ever and sides plus salad are included so great deal. Steaks prepared over wood fire and that's a nice flavor. Great place to eat.

xQ4-RYh4TswLKBT9TSZ1wQ.text: Shockingly good considering it's in one of the lamest venues on the strip.  It's also completely empty since everyone at Circus Circus can't do math, likely can't order off of a menu in English, and can't win at the games.  The idea of a serious streakhouse doesn't really fit with the ghetto vibe.  So if you drop in here for some ghetto assed craps or something and find yourself up some change, check out this rarely used venue.  They're desperate to please you.

ON5zPZpfWB0RLdJqzN80gA.text: Fuck this place.  How's that for the start of a review?  I'm not sure that I've ever had worse food at a restaurant, let alone one with such grand acclaims and high prices.  Some reviewers say the decor is elegant, but it looks like the inside of an Irish bar to me.  I believe that because of its location in Circus Circus there is an illusion of classiness created by juxtaposition.  On the night that a friend and I went almost every item we ordered was awful.  They were out of sauteed mushrooms, so we opted for crab legs and grilled shrimp.  The shrimp were ok, but the crab legs were horrible.  Too briny and salty, we couldn't even finish them, and the friend I was with is a fat bastard.  The waiter ended up not charging us for those because he could tell our meal wasn't starting out well.  Next we got our side salads, which were fine, but they weren't anything special.  Besides, we were there for steak.  My friend got the porterhouse and I got a ribeye.  Mine was edible, whereas I had one bite of my friend's and could not have imagined eating much more than the single bite.  Having learned our lesson, we didn't opt for dessert.  I do recall getting decent service, but it doesn't matter when the meal is utterly unenjoyable.  The bottom line: this is probably a great steakhouse much of the time, but when we were there it sucked ass big-time, and you shouldn't risk that, let alone have to pay for it.

TCUVQGnaVsYulpkLThG9BQ.text: It's become tradition for me to take my assistant out to dinner on the last day of the POOL tradeshow in Las Vegas. Well, I feed and house him the entire time, but dammit, the last day is the day for a GOOD STEAK DINNER. In February we had gone to Morton's, and while it was good, the service and martini were better than the steak.   He had mentioned in February that Circus Circus is alleged to have the best steakhouse in Vegas, which I dismissed at least 5 separate times as total hooey. How could that be? We didn't make it during that trip. So this time, being in the mood for something a little more mellow and perhaps a bit silly, I suggested Circus Circus for our end-of-show dinner. i didn't change out of my grungy breaking-down-the-booth-packing-the-fixtures clothing at all, and off we went.   The Steak House is a class act. My helper friend took a look at the dark wood entrance and stepped to the side to tuck in his shirt and spit-shine his hair. We didn't have reservations as recommended, but they were able to seat us right away.   As soon as you walk in you're face to face with their curing room, an awe-inspiring enclosure with entire sides of meat just dry-aging away. Gorrrgeous! The decor in general is pretty great- dark, lots of wood and taxidermy, and just what you might expect of a steakhouse in a murder mystery.   Service was attentive and not smothering, but a little on the clueless side. He didn't know where the oysters came from, and since my friend the microbiologist recommended that I never eat oysters from the Gulf (apparently they're more likely to carry a particular strain of flesh-eating bacteria than our good old West Coast oysters) we passed. Also, when I asked him to please explain the differences between the cuts (I know what a Porterhouse and filet mignon are, but the difference between a New York strip and a regular ole strip?) he instead launched into a spiel that went like this:  "Well, for the ladies [he looked pointedly at me] I recommend the filet mignon. It's a tender cut that's low in fat. We also have a petit filet if you don't want too much. And for the gentlemen [eyes over to my companion] we recommend the New York strip. It's a flavorful cut that's very popular with the gentlemen."  Thanks, sir. Thank you for being SO TOTALLY WRONG about how to explain cuts of steak. Annnnnyway, the New York strip sounded great to me so that's what I ordered. And apparently the filet mignon sounded great to my companion, so that's what he ordered. Well, at first he ordered the petit filet, but I reminded him that he has a wooden leg and would not be satisfied with the lighter lady's meal.   My steak was EXCELLENT. Rare, flavorful, perfect. The martini was pretty stellar as well. My companion's steak was initially a disappointment to him because it wasn't as flavorful as mine (and this is at the heart of why I only like filet mignon at home when you get to marinate it to your exact specifications. It's a tender bitch, but not as flavorful since it doesn't have the same fat content. FAT IS FLAVOR.) but he grew to kind of love it. And, I have to say, it was miles ahead of the Morton's filet mignon because it was delicously dry-aged. Companion thought it was a little gamey, but I thought it was kind of excellent.   All the other little details about the dinner were excellent as well, right down to their bread and butter. How great is that?   After dinner we went to the big top and watched 15 minutes of harrowing aerial acrobatics. Helps with digestion.

4La5oPzqnYHIPHKUNdXjkg.text: First of all, let's clarify the rumors.... Not all the MEAT is aged 21 days, only the Prime Rib is aged in the glass aging room.  The rest is pre-aged and pre-packaged, if you are close enough to the grill, you can watch them cut it open.  The meat is USDA Choice, not Prime cuts.  Those who know, will know the difference.  I ordered the bone in Ribeye medium rare, which was a bit more rare, bloody than normal. The texture was a bit tough and tasteless, just a chunk o meat.  They could at least sprinkle some salt or seasoning on it.  For $44, it was disappointing...I've had $6.99 steak specials that were just as good (bad)?  same?   The black bean soup?  Pass... I'v made better bean soup myself.  The server saw that I barely touched it and asked how it was and if I wanted something else instead, like a salad.  So I tried the Ceasar salad which was good.    The garlic mashed potatoes were gritty, like cream o wheat, weird taste to it.  The creamy horseradish was different, but good.  It had chives n paprika? sprinkled on top....  Also rumored was some kind of special coffee service, NOPE.... just cream n sugar....  Service was good, as to be expected, so they came through there.....  Either the local review journal got greased for the reviews, or the locals just don't know steak... ha ha get it?

GeB7PHjs9saFNih92jAQng.text: If you have been to Mortin's, CapGrille, Mastro's etc and are expecting this to compare, expect to be sorely disappointed. Filet and lobster special. Lobster was good. Steak was a good cut but flavor was lacking. Too smoky tasting with no seasoning. Good salad but blah dressing. Service was extremely rushed. Your bill will be lower than the other steakhouses mentioned, but so will your satisfaction level. Not worth the walk through nasty Circus Circus.

23VXDHBQELTsSjCwtRfe-g.text: Excellent place for a nice intimate dinner. The steaks and chops are out of this world. Lamb was fantastic.  Our server,   Chae, was outstanding. Highly recommended.

FnulRf2dM7nEG-vP0JX6IA.text: it is all about the steak. One of the best Porterhouse I have ever eaten.  You can actually see the aging room where they keep the meat.  they used to bring a lazy susan with salad and baked potato toppings but they stopped doing it.  the steak is as good as ever, dry aged and cooked over wood.

-B11wQApGCqJ6suoGvcPfg.text: Seems like a deal but read on please.  Well I have eaten here a few times now and I have to say I don't really like it.  First off its 47 bucks for a bone in rib eye now and even though it comes with sides they are lousy.  In one word to describe the whole meal, bland.  First off the steak is dry aged but only 21 days and they have really no aged flavor.  Second they do not season the meat at all, I mean not a bit, it was completely bland and flavorless, you can add salt at the table but by then it's too late.  My last steak I got was cooked ok, actually a little rare, but it had a strong burnt charcoal taste, a few others at the table said the same and some did not.       The few asparagus spears that comes with are very plain too and were very bland.  You can't pick your veggie, it's just whatever they give you.  Also the dinner salad is fine I guess but if you want caesar it's 5 bucks more.  There are only 2 potatoes to choose from baked or mashed, boring.  In the end this place isn't much cheaper and even more expensive than some, treat yourself and go somewhere else and share one or two real good sides with a group.  As long as you don't go overboard It will only cost a few bucks more a person and it is worth it.  A better steak I found that wasn't terribly pricey was the range at harrahs, way better.  As long as you don't compare this place to the expensive premium steakhouses like CUT or Carnevino this place isn't really a deal at all.  4 steaks at 44 (reasonable price for joe's, fleming's, range, envy, delfrisco...) and you all split 3 sides that you get to pick (more than enough) at 8 each would be 50 a person, only 3 dollars more a person than 47 rib eyes at circus circus.  I can't think of a legit steakhouse that I had a worse meal at so I don't see how you could go wrong elsewhere if you are considering this place.

REFLWFp7GNy7hx74gfQncA.text: This review is long overdue. Hubby & I are locals. We LOVE a great steak & we've been to many of the GREAT steakhouses on the Strip. If you want incredible ambiance & don't mind paying double what you'd pay @ Circus Circus, go to SW Steakhouse @ Wynn. BUT; if you want a reliably FANTASTIC steak with delicious  sides... Go to Circus Circus!!! It's without question, the locals best kept secret. The prices are reasonable, quality excels all the great steakhouses in Vegas AND.... every steak COMES WITH decent bread, black bean soup (to die for) or a COLD crisp salad AND seasonal veggies (usually asparagus) AND a potato.  French onion is the best I've ever had. One warning; the walk to the restaurant is always entertaining. Watch your feet, I've almost stepped on crawling babies in the hall. The casinos' patrons are Ghetto Fabulous!!!

x6a3Bw_RGjAFlygfBSyNDQ.text: Nice and prompt.  They don't dilly dally here.  The steak is not just grilled to perfection...but the choice of meats and the real mesquite fire created the perfect combination.  Would recommend to anyone that wants to mimic a T-rex.

1TB0Jgi99HKnl6hVwyfSlg.text: awesome, awesome, awesome... did I say awesome? My wife and I have been coming here for 20 years. perfect steak, perfect service and for $50 per plate with all the fixings, you can't beat it. we have ate at these so-called exclusive steak houses only to leave $400 less and still hungry for a cheeseburger.  The Steakhouse cannot be more perfect.

Y8BfE3WVGtaJSSawp0XCRg.text: I have to admit, I was very skeptical about this place being a good steakhouse. I mean, anyone who has walked through Circus Circus, knows it's exactly that, a circus. Not the type of place you would expect to have a top-notch steak dinner. Well, I was wrong. My group of 4 would agree as well. Steak was perfectly prepared. The price was incredibly reasonable as well. A petite filet is 8 ounces. Most petite filets are 4-5 ounces. The price for the petite filet, vegetables, potatoes, and soup or salad was $50. So glad we took the recommendation from our driver and gave this place a chance. Would highly recommend it.

ll2RjqIiLnZscjmVA8V1iA.text: All I have to say is this is A pretty good steakhouse and  they also have great customer service.  I would never thought about going to a steakhouse in circus circus but that proves Don't judge a book by its cover. I will go back.

t01XFwcveRRM9ZNygPBQIg.text: The Steakhouse is by far one of the best dining experiences I have ever had hand down.  We went here on recommendation by a friend.  We were skeptical at first since it's in Circus Circus and the atmosphere there we try to avoid.  But this place is a slice of heaven!  From the moment we walked in we were greeted with an amazing aroma of food.  The meat locker in the front behind the hostess desk has a beautiful array of cuts of meat, and if you look close enough the slabs have dates on them showing how fresh they are.  We were ushered by a very nice man from NY past the grilling island were you could see them preparing your food and we were promptly seated. The atmosphere is pretty upper class with rich woods, a fireplace, darkened room and pretty quiet aside from the restraunt music and the chattering of other diners. This is definitely NOT a place for small children. Our waiter (who kind of liked like Drew Carey) was attentive but not too the point of being annoying. When I described what kind of wine I wanted he suggested one that was spot on perfect.  Our water glasses were never empty and our meals were beyond good.  I had the petite filet mignon and it was the best I have ever tasted. The cheesecake which was recommended by both the NY gentleman and our waiter was also phenomenal.  The place is a bit pricy but absolutely worth it!

7_dKCoUzuUUjy5qyRfzoNA.text: Wasnt expecting much as this is in circus circus but I must say that this is one of the best steaks I have ever eaten, it was cooked to perfection I like the fact as well that the kitchen is in the middle of the floor so you can see your steak being cooked, the service was quick and the staff were very welcoming, this restaurant is the reason I go back to Circus Circus.

HMxLja4zmJC7QLXqehfLbQ.text: Absolutely the best steakhouse in Vegas! And probably the best tasting steak I've had. Quite pricey, BUT worth every penny.

PO0HyEJjEvVsUZhgLyroCg.text: Who would have thought that Circus Circus would have such a delicious steak restaurant! Went here for dinner tonight with my boyfriend because he's been wanting to come back here after eating "the best steak in Vegas" several years ago. Its still on point!  Loved the warm breads that were served immediately after seating and taking drink orders. Steaks come with chef's vegetable which was asparagus, soup or salad, and mashed garlic or baked potato. I got the special of the evening which was the 8oz filet for $30 and accompaniments of grilled garlic shrimp and sauteed mushrooms.  My boyfriend got the bone in ribeye with added lobster tail.  Everything was delicious and cooked perfectly! I also liked how the garlic butter for my grilled shrimp had bits of roasted garlic in clarified butter and was kept warm by a candle underneath. My shrimp were huge! More like prawns than shrimp...the lobster tail was also a very nice size.  After the main course we were too full to order dessert, but the dessert cart looked very tempting. The only con I would have to add is that I wish they had more appetizer selections and more vegetable sides a la carte besides the chef vegetable.  This was a well worth $200 dollar meal....and much more satisfying than Cut!!

2P02hMxHC5D3-QrZnlEYjg.text: All of the Steaks, sides, and deserts were great! Worth getting thru this dive casino to get to this great restaurant.

8drRR-c_0PFm_N6HryA_2Q.text: The best steakhouse, hands down. Great Atmosphere, great service, delicious prime rib and the best filet mignon I've ever tasted. I have been here several times now, and every time it is outstanding. Too bad it's in Circus Circus, but don't let that scare you away, this place is definitely worth it. I made reservations weeks in advance, and yes, they saved me a table, and I got my favorite waiter!

_Kvbwqg6esZT2oWjGK901A.text: I'm still on the fence with this place. For the fact that it was rated the Best Steakhouse in Las Vegas for X amount of years, yet it resides in a hellhole is beyond me. Did I have the best steak of my life? Probably not, I have yet to have a Peter Luger steak so until then, it'll be a no. The food was good but I think it was WAY too dark and the service was ok. Definitely not Michelin worthy.   The Black Bean Soup was surprisingly good but it was too big of a portion. There was a dessert cart which was cool though it reminded me of Claim Jumpers. Would I go back? Maybe, if it was comped or it was on someone's tab.

APwtUPBCu51zEC-O-A5Etg.text: Birthday Vegas Trip: 4/3 - 4/9, 2013 The one thing my fiance was dying to do on this trip was take me to The Steakhouse in Circus Circus for my birthday dinner.  He raved and raved, saying it was one of his top 3 restaurants ever - that is a loaded statement coming from a foodie like him!  We took a cab down from our hotel on the Strip down to Circus Circus.  Let's just say I was apprehensive when we entered the rambunctious casino that was flooded with people - adults and kids alike.  I felt like I was truly at a circus, and I will admit I was seriously doubting any restaurant that would chose this place for its location.  Once we finally found The Steakhouse, when we entered, it was like we were transported to another world. I kid you not.  No noise, no craziness.  Just Frank Sinatra out of the speakers and fabulous light in the classically styled dining room.  We had a reservation (which we were a tad late for after wandering around the casino - but it was not an issue) and immediately were whisked past the beautiful dry-aging steaks and seated in a huge, cozy booth.  Perfect atmosphere! And, just like that, I was at ease and ready to celebrate my 32nd birthday with a feast!  Our waiter was knowledgeable and attentive, but not overbearing.  We started with a bottle of Pinot Noir and chose the King Crab Legs on Ice to share.  Huge portions of crab and ample cocktail and tartar sauces.  The perfect starter; just enough not to fill you up.  Having already decided that we'd share a Porterhouse, we ordered it medium.  The portions are huge and there was no way we'd finish two entrees. One might consider this, especially since you are likely on vacation and a hotel room may not be the best place to enjoy steak leftovers!  I have heard, though, that if you ask them to slice it up before they box it, they absolutely will.  We each got our choice of sides - I chose a salad and a baked potato and my fiance had their garlic mashed.  Everything was great.  Again, they served very big portions and you could tell they'd used quality ingredients.  It goes without saying that the steak was cooked to perfection.  We skipped dessert - a rarity - but nothing was beckoning on this particular night.   Worth the price! Quite the experience! A hidden gem in Circus Circus!

D010LkEI-zyHhUjSrOBa2w.text: Yea ok the steaks are melt in your mouth like butta'!  The bad part is the service SUCKS!  Probably won't go back....  How is it that you know the menu better than the waiter?  Although, I can say the backup bus boy always had the glasses filled and continuously checked on us verses the "real" waiter!  Hopefully the busboy gets the FULL tip!!!

vSA0PpY5UvZ1iqZl_WGoJQ.text: Between the bread and porter house I'll forgo the obvious dilemma that comes with associating outstanding quality and circus circus. It's worth the hallucinogenic stroll through this dated memoir of a casino for this meal. I was first introduced from my uncle who never leaves LV without a stop here. My recent trip was no different then any of my past experiences here. Simply the best steak and steakhouse experience.

slfuY6ZKA_evJclp_4k0CQ.text: Simply awesome. You would not expect that circus circus could hold such a gem. Great food and great environment. Service was perfect. Our filets were cooked perfect and coupled with the Johnnie Blue, made a great meal. Highly recommend it.

2SmRIrh0D3M3K-JZeUGADg.text: We had strip steak and a petit filet: very nicely aged and cooked.  Wine was reasonably priced and the entire dining experience was great.   We stayed at The Mirage and used the Monorail to get  to the Steakhouse: big mistake.  The walk from the Sahara Station to Circus Circus goes through questionable areas and is as long as walking directly from The Mirage.  On the way back we took a cab: nice and easy.

Ll_HHshfwIfDpZy9n1Efsg.text: We really enjoyed THE steakhouse! Our servers- Mike and Javier - were the highlight for sure but the food was very good too! We started with the shrimp cocktail....the shrimp were huge and delicious! Cocktail sauce w fresh horseradish was awesome! I had the filet and my husband had the bone in rib eye. Both were cooked perfectly, very tender and moist. We had the Justin Cabernet which was good as well! I like that sides come with for the menu price bc it makes it very reasonable. My only complaint is it is very smoky bc of the mesquite grill. They need to upgrade the ventilation for sure. You do get used to it but it is distracting at first. Definitely worth the night if you like old school steak houses!

7p2i1nmfRva4QEBLODvTqg.text: Food was good. We all got the filet's; however, there was so much smoke in the air from the grill it made it hard to enjoy the meal. Went back to our room and had to take a shower just to get the smell out of my hair. In addition, service was very slow.

ULdJtX3CRMTlNJGs3Ql0oA.text: I have to believe that in order to rate a True restaurant experience, you have to take everything into consideration. Many times I have had sub-par food but everyone has an off night and service, location etc have led me to return for a better night. Having always wanted to try this steakhouse but unable to convince myself that a client dinner or romantic evening would be perfect inside Circus Circus, finally last night I had my chance. Fright Dome tickets with a steak prior.  Here's the deal:  1) Great Service 2) Incredible black bean soup 3) Nice salad 4) Great shrimp app 5) NY steak very juicy  So how do I find fault?  Cooking area that is out in the open is decades old and you see all the sides, mushroom, asparagus, sauces in pots that may be clean but just plain old looking. Electrical cords every where, the round ones like my parents used to have! Anyone who says this is best steak ever, needs to get around a little, sorry but that is the truth. Overall not a bad experience but if they are looking for my $200+ dinner for 2 they need to do a lot more. After all when it comes down to it do you really want to go through a cheap, old, smokey, Circus Circus for a romantic meal or business dinner...I don't think so!  You might see me for next years Halloween and Fright Dome but other than that your on your own.  But, that's just my opinion!

oUUb2MYkBSilmofqzD6zCQ.text: Everything is PERFECT!! everything in here is perfect~ the service and taste of foods!  I went to here for early valentine dinner with my boyfriends.   interior of this restaurant is not fancy as other hotel place but not too casual. (we did want to go fancy restaurant anyway) but the place is too dark to see menu  Our waiter's name was Mark who serves us so nicely. He was a bit late for taking order but everything else was so great and busser was keep refill our drinks.  we ordered garlic shrimp for our appetizer which was so big and chewable and tasty. it comes with garlic sauce bolling on fire.    Our entree was petite filet Mignon and Rib eye with garlic mashed potatoes, salad and asparagus. Filet was tender and rib eye was so big.   evetything was so delicious  the check is a bit pricey but it was worth to pay for.   the one thing i dont like is that why every chef is wonder around at the restaurant? I feel it is not clean...

Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. complementary bread at the first
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic shrimp appetizer

8rCzFz-7CAh_ZMRDyGmEQQ.text: Save your money, you can do better.  While the meal was fine, for the price charged I expected top service and a super flavorful steak.   I had booked on Open Table and explained it was my husband's birthday.  Usually at other restaurants the waitstaff will comment about the birthday and sometimes provide a free dessert, neither happened here.  Typically at a nice restaurant, the woman is served first,but not here.  I also didn't care for the mounted deer heads in an otherwise formal setting.

bJX9Wlxq5MRYUOpQma9rqA.text: I wanted to like this place. I wanted to be able to start a sentence with "At least The Steakhouse in Circus Circus was good..."  The sides and garlic mashed potatoes were excellent and the inside was beautifully appointed in classic dark wood and leather upholstery. The waiter was friendly and very professional. The wine was a nice vintage. But the point of a steakhouse is to know what the hell you are doing with the meat.  The prime rib I ordered was a hot mess. I ordered medium-well and got rare. It was a huge awkward 1.5lb piece of cow that was 3/4ths gristle and fat. I performed major surgery to liberate what turned out to be about 4oz of actual meat from the center of this disgusting hunk of beef fat and cartilage. By the time I'd finished sawing away the lard, I was thoroughly grossed out but the huge pile of fat dominating my plate and could barely eat my potatoes and what little meat I had.  So when the bananas foster came for dessert and it had lumps of un-blended cooking paraffin settled at the bottom like marbles, I was ready to vomit. If you are going to make a thickened caramel sauce and use paraffin, get it to the right temperature to ensure it all blends together. Otherwise customers get a mouthful of what feels like cold grease lumps.  Just disappointing. But I guess that's what happens when you eat at a place that has a huge neon clown outside, cackling its way into your nightmares.

NPcJlDWrySX51IlE1wOpAw.text: Um....no...unless what you call special is Outback.  Good ambience...if you can get through the bad ambience to get there.   After ringing and ringing and ringing for reservations only to be told they don't take reservations until after 2 pm and call back...what????  Arrive only to feel less important than the telephone want -to -be reservation...no greeting (welcome, hello)...no shampoo for the hostess either.  Good service, Very good service for average (I'm being kind) food. Totally misleading previous reviews. Really???...a great baked potato...

SP_x-s2fbV6F3gIcdF6Cxg.text: Classic, classy decor, hidden inside a dump of a casino...and I will be back! After reading so many good reviews of this place, I had to check it out. Who knew such a great restaurant would be inside of Circus Circus? Come for happy hour between 4 and 6 at their small bar. The drinks are half price and they don't cut corners. Michael is a great bartender. He's friendly, professional and has good knowledge of the town. The mesquite grill is in the middle of the restaurant, so you can see them grilling your steak. I started with the shrimp cocktail. Giant shrimp that were fresh and great tasting. For my meal, I had the porterhouse steak with salad, garlic mashed potatoes and veggies. One of the many great things about this place is that your great steak comes with soup or salad, baked or mashed potatoes and veggies. At most other high end steak houses, the steak is a la carte and doesn't come with anything. Other places make you pay like $15 for each side. Anyway, the steak was cooked a perfect medium rare and very tender. They season the meat enough so it has flavor, but you can taste the beef. No need for steak sauce, but I would imagine with just a touch, it can be great as well. The service was excellent and I have nothing bad to say about this place. It's a nice little oasis inside of a cheesy casino. I will be back and I will recommend this restaurant for sure!

pNW3S2f9Ig-RNdsBNdV3eg.text: I deducted one star because the breads in the bread basket were old and cold. I don't mean not hot, I mean COLD as in just came out of the fridge/defrosted from the freezer. Such a bummer, because that is the first impression of a steakhouse. The bread sticks were good though. Mark up on wine was quite high, but our server Chae was wonderful.  I deducted another star because I was shocked to learn that a restaurant located in Circus Circus does not have non glass cups, or at least a lid to put on the glass cup for kids. The lack of a kids' menu (while strange for a restaurant located feet away from juggling clowns) we were okay with--I get it, you don't want this turning into a Rainforest Cafe.  But come on folks, this is just a plain safety and liability issue. A kid could hurt himself if the glass shatters (which will happen if it's dropped). Not to mention, the pain of dealing with a dumped drink over the kids clothes (glad did not happen to us) especially since you'll no doubt get a bunch of diners who are tourists and are limited to what they can pack in a diaper bag for a dinner. You have to expect kids will dine there because your are located in CIRCUS CIRCUS. Know your audience and provide parents with a more pleasant experience. I would not even take my kids to the steakhouses at fancy hotels.  We split a chicken entree for our kids. Thankfully, we were not charged the $17 split fee (I would have lost my mind if they had done that for a 2 and 5 year old).   Look, this restaurant is free to have any rule it wants. What made this hard to swallow is the fact that they don't seem to enforce other rules. Their sign clearly says "no tank tops". Yet, a man at the table next to us was wearing a tank top.   So someone dining at your steakhouse in a wife beater in violation of your rules is okay, but a kids' cup is beneath you?????!!!!!   Interesting that another Yelper made a comment about people dining there in tank tops, and in violation of the restaurant's rules.  Normally I would deduct another star because the beef is not prime, but they charge prime prices. Here, they dry age non-prime beef. However, I did not deduct the other star because the food was good, and our server was great.

15i5ixYJI31evBoxvsJAqg.text: I have to say I loved this place. The atmosphere is very cozy and the music was perfect if you love Frank and Dean. The waitstaff was wonderful in every way.  Salad had so many different vegetables in it and was very good.  The shrimp is the biggest I have ever seen!  The Alaskan king crab legs were very large and the lobster was great too.  You have to come for the seafood if nothing else.  If you are going to order dessert try the cheesecake, one of the best I have ever had. Stay away from the creme brulee unless you like it lumpy and burnt tasting.  The steak wasn't horrible but it didn't do much for me, no flavor really. They need to season it differently or maybe start seasoning them if they don't at all.   They give huge portion sizes so make sure you are hungry when you arrive. I would give it a five except for the lack of flavor of the steak and yucky creme brulee.  The restaurant is expensive but well worth it. I will be back again.

4u25oUZzFLtoS3OQBygQNg.text: My husband and I have lived in Las Vegas now for 5 months and have heard good things about this restaurant. We came at a perfect time, we had no reservation and were lucky to be seated right away. I would highly recommend a reservation though, because as we were leaving there was a large crowd at the host stand.  Service was great, and everything was served immediately. Our drinks from the bar came out right away, fresh basket of bread, and our salads too. Our steaks barely took a little bit longer. I enjoyed my bleu cheese salad very much, and my steak was very good too. My only complaint is that I ordered my steak medium, and it was more medium rare. Still very good though. My husbands only complaint was his steak had no flavor and he had to add quite a bit of salt and pepper. Other than that, I think we both enjoyed everything.  All together our meal was over $100, but I don't feel the pricing was off considering the nice environment, speedy service, and quality of food.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My petite filet mignon.
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bleu cheese salad.
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Variety bread basket.

LXJCNUXrgAqL4-5255DNmg.text: Black bean soup and bone in Prime Rib = Awesome. One of the top 3 prime ribs in my lifetime - highly recommended!!

ORpfpU5JLQO13c1jCj-gBQ.text: The bartender at the Trump, where we stay, suggested this restaurant. We asked for somewhere to go for steak but dressed casually. I about croaked when he suggested a restaurant in Circus Circus. It was my hubby's bday, his choice, shut my mouth and go. I WAS SHOCKED! The atmosphere is soft lighting, dark woods, green glass covered chandeliers. Romantic and comfortable. We sat overlooking the enclosed chef grilling area which was entertaining and amazing to see the enormous cuts of steaks being grilled. We started with appetizers of shrimp cocktails which were prawn sized and very fresh. I had lamb chops and my husband had the porterhouse. Both were FANTASTIC. Both had a nice outside searing with kosher salt. The garlic mashed potatoes were the real deal and the grilled asparagus was perfectly grilled. The waiter must have overheard my hubby comment on what a great birthday dinner and the waiter returned with a slice of cake drizzled in chocolate. Even though my hubby was full, he managed to find space to eat it!! We would DEFINITELY go back. Don't let the hotel's crazy, busy atmosphere deter you from going.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb chops, garlic mashed potatoes and asparagus. Extremely tasty!

DOEzqwaJgJl7Tou4pieg8g.text: Lovely experience. The food are very nice and in large proportion. Me and my mum ordered a filet and asked to share. There is a $17 sides set with entres and they give both of us the sides set in one charge. Service is great. Bread basket is nice too!

QW775LXsJHrIs9cWpxudzw.text: The wife and I went back.  The dinner was even better this time around.   The strip was cooked to perfection.   The wife got the lamb chops again and they were excellent.   Mike took great care of us.

sBy4qXELHDFMOb-s6qPBVw.text: We've lived in Las Vegas for 30 years.  Although my wife is a vegetarian, she tags along while I work my way through every steak house in town.  For some reason we never made it to The Steak House until recently.  I was not expecting the experience we had.  I rarely give a five star, but this deserved it.  The steak was incredible.  I had the large cut prime rib and it melted in my mouth.  Perfectly cooked.  I had a pretty good appetite but still took half of it home.  The service, the way things were presented, the timing, the way the staff took extra care to provide my wife with a nice vegetarian meal, it was all flawless.  I know it's the Circus Circus, but this is one high class steak house.

Btjy8yjU-BOOusLAqn7OmA.text: So I'm reluctant to make this review because I appreciate the old style vegas feel of this place and the servers were very friendly.  However I can't in good conscience let this steakhouse be rated 4 stars.   We came here with a party of 5 and all of us ordered different cuts of steak and had different temperature requests.  4 out of the 5 steaks we got were not even edible.  I was able to take 3 bites of my prime rib before I couldn't stomach another bite.  The steak was flavorless and felt like I was chewing on rubber.  The other people in my party were also not able to finish their steaks as they were over cooked and chewy.   Much to my amazement the server did not offer to take these steaks off when he came to the table and nobody had touched their food.  I really wanted to like this place because it has a good ambience but the food should not be served to paying patrons.  And with the bill coming in at $200 for two steaks and no booze I honestly felt like I had played a rigged slot machine.  It might be time to let this old Vegas relic finally die off.

365csBGaXyT4xHEqP1NI8w.text: This was recommended to us by our God son and his fiancee.  The server was super friendly and very excited for us when he found out that we were celebrating our 23rd wedding anniversary.   I ordered a prime rib....when the server set it in front of me I was speechless... it was 3 fingers thick and weighed 32 oz.  It came with garlic mashed potatoes and carrots.  Let me tell you I had a tiny taste of the potatoes which were delicious, and ate over half my Prime rib...yes I know what you're thinking "FATTY" I agree but it just melted in my mouth and couldn't help myself.  My husband had a rib eye steak, no where near the size of mine...his was only 27 oz but just as delicious.

POzeGTMdMFV3cD1ARQe61A.text: This was truly a treat. The service started with Mr. Randazzo seating us for our special needs. Raphael and Mitch took care of our table service, and they were incredible. We overlooked the grill from our table, and the view was a carnivore's dream come True. The aroma was exquisite. The home made breads were very special and quite tasty. The salad was a very ample size and quite tasty. My porterhouse was very large, tasty and served a perfect medium rare. The asparagus and the garlic mashed potatoes were also excellent. My wife had lamb chops and she couldn't stop raving about them. Truly a 5 star meal. We had both of those incredible dinners, and a bottle of delicious Cabernet, for under $150.00. Truly a must eat for carnivore's. We totally loved it.

o5tIDvDpRppseUJJydJawA.text: My husband heard this place was a must try so he called ahead and made reservations which was a good thing being that when we got there at 630 they were turning people away but would take them at 9.   We were quickly brought a variety of breads and served complimentary bottle water. I started with the house salad with Italian dressing. Something about the dressing i really liked. My husband had the black bean soup and he REALLY liked it I thought it was just ok. We both had filet mignon medium and it was made right and delicious! My plate came with asparagus, garlic mashed potatoes and a creamy sauce that was so good.  Our kids really enjoyed it as well. Its the best we have ever had and we eat out a lot. We didn't order dessert because we were so full. The servings were huge.  We will definitely be coming back anytime we are in vegas.

6_cUzLaZp5l7fTxbWunOKQ.text: Made reservations here for our first night in vegas as I heard it was a hidden gem inside Circus Circus. Unfortunately this steak house can't properly cook a medium rare rib eye...my first steak had good flavor but was cooked medium and too chewy for my liking. So they nicely cooked me a new steak however the 2nd steak was raw in the middle and there was no way I was going to eat it. They were going to recook this steak but everyone knows you never recook a steak especially after cutting through it. So they gave me a third steak which took forever to arrive. By this time my friends have finished their meals and I was now no longer hungry and I was still charged for my steak. I was so bummed I didn't even bother anymore and just wanted to pay the bill and leave.  It's very disappointing to go to a steak house that can't cook a medium rare steak.   Not sure I would give them another try.

cZgPVjyeBuC0J_5tWeB-Fg.text: AMAZING Steaks, the Chefs know what they're doing! Well worth the money. Very classy and a great overall experience.

qsZS0bzPBEC1nKh4m6uWyA.text: I had the opportunity to dine at this amazing restaurant. The food is absolutely incredible. Even during the wait from ordering my main course, the bread sticks were delicious. The servers stay on top of everything from refilling drinks at the right time and asking if everything is Okay with our table. Definitely worth the money.

mt-tugqGETmAc797KojgrQ.text: This was the worst dinner I've had in recent memory. We had a table of 12 and not a single person enjoyed the food. The steak was of poor quality and severely under seasoned if seasoned at all. The lamb was flavorless and dry and came with a disgusting green jello. The sauce that came with the steak (shouldn't have to dip a good steak in anything) was also not enjoyable. We all took a couple of bites and left the uneaten steaks at the table. After such a let down, we still had to walk through Circus Circus which is a nightmare in and of itself.

DXUgsvazRovFHjBnlzsUyQ.text: In Vega$ for work and just had dinner with a co-worker at "The Steak House" in Circus Circus.  I told him it was one of the best steaks we'd ever had (we were here 3 years ago).  I've now apologized at least 3 times.  At $55 for the Petit Fillet (bill close to $200 for the 2 of us as we each had a glass of wine) everything was sub par.  The asparagus was mushy, the garlic mashed potatoes were bland and I've had better steaks at Sizzler.  I don't know what happened but I definitely will NOT be recommending this place any longer. :(

HLICBXlYG9zc_rxaS3TNww.text: Voted "Best of Las Vegas" for over 20 years. And I see why. The steaks are legit, the ambiance is classy yet comfortable. The service is top notch all the way.   Never thought I'd say this, but I'll take dinner date night here over some of the overrated pretentious hip celebrity chef joints we've been to. Mr. B suggested Carnevino but I wanted to go somewhere different this time around and my BFF and I have never been here yet, so we planned double date night here with our husbands.   Reservations: Highly suggest you make reservations ahead of time.http://www.opentable.com/the-steakhouse-at-circus-circus-reservations-las-vegas?restref=68473&rid=68473 This place is only open during dinner hours and limited seating.  Dress Attire: Business Casual is just fine.  Location: Inside Circus Circus Casino. Getting here is something else. After you get past having to go through the parking garage from hell and avoid getting rundown by rugrats heading to Adventuredome, you'll step through the doors of "The Steak House" and breathe a sigh of relief.  Your hostess will take you past the area where they dry age the steaks. Here's it's 21 days we were told.  You'll go past the exhibition area also where they grill the steaks. Smells so good!   Menu is simple.http://circuscircus.com/images/PDF/SteakhouseMenu.pdf  We all ordered different cuts of steak and our dinners included fresh baked bread, Chef choice of vegetable (asparagus) black bean soup or salad, garlic mash,baked potato or rice. Pretty great deal if you ask me. We planned it that way. My BFF and I told our husbands, they could buy us new shoes.  Anyway my rib eye was a large, thick cut, seasoned well and juicy.   Dining area has half circular booths lined along the wall, tables in the middle.dimly lit, The place oozes of classy 1980's Vegas.  According the the hostess this place has been here since 1982. She said a lot of the staff has been there that long too.  Very enjoyable dinner. We ordered desserts though and had coffee and drinks afterwards. We probably stuck around longer than we should. Bff & I are notorious for it. We were never rushed  and our servers kept checking up on us even after we were finished with dinner.   Service was exemplary.  We all agreed we would come back again!

BJH44-IUzTOqtj9bRgYzEA.text: When my cousin was in town she mentioned a good steak house at Circus Circus she wanted us all to meet at. I was curious to see that a nice steak house existed at Circus Circus so of course I wanted to check it out! It's located in a row of vendors selling jewelry, purses and Hello Kitty items. Once you go inside you are transported to a place with nice dark wood and stuffed birds...old school decor.   The first thing you see when you walk in is a big slab of beef legs hanging near the hostess podium. There was even a huge lobster in there. I didn't know if that was real or not but I wouldn't mind seeing it slathered in butter, garlic and lemon juice!   I started off with the French Onion soup which had a nice gooey cheese. The broth was also tasty. I had the petite fillet for $41.00 which comes with your choice of potato and vegetable. I chose the baked potato and carrots. I tasted my husband's garlic mashed potatoes and wished I ordered that instead because they were amazing! The meat here is the star because it just melts in your mouth. The sides lack excitement but they taste good.   Here's a tip: If you gamble at any of the MGM hotels you can use your comps to pay for the meal. I guess Circus Circus is like a stepchild to the MGM affiliated casinos. My aunt was able to comp her meal and my cousin's meal .

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My meal
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French onion soup
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster

9Ca6pscklyQNCKmV40TiDQ.text: You wouldn't expect to find a place like this inside circus circus.  You literally have to navigate your way thru an endless see of people and their millions kids to get from casino floor to restaurant.  Once you get in, bread and drinks are prompt.  Server is very cordial and attentive.  I ordered the filet.. cooked perfectly, but felt it was under seasoned.  All in all, its a good restaurant.. too bad it's inside circus circus.  We wont be back bc of that..

DOaI363QO6cJvScoe76rIg.text: This is robaby my favorite steak house in Las Vegas. I ordered crab cakes and a Caesar Salad both were absolutely delicious. Everything looks high quality and the costumer service is amazing, they do have bilingual waiters and they are nice and you can tell they go all of their way to make you feel comfortable. For the dessert i had a cheesecake and it was the best cheese cake Ive ever had. The only thing that i felt it was missing its the fact that there is no WiFi but overall I would highly recommend this steak house and Id love to go back soon !!

H_nnTLch_pnlN1uHN4pG0w.text: Amazing Steakhouse!!! Every time I come here, I'm not disappointed. Great customer service, prices are lower  compared to the places in the strip. The quality of the steak or seafood are high. Not that many people know of this place, hidden jewel of Las Vegas. I would highly recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Pd6nwXijuW-EgER6WWfOmQ.text: The incredible aroma of mesquite grilled steaks as we walked through the doorway was overwhelming.  It smelled amazing! Loved the authentic steakhouse look-dark wood/dim lights.  My petite filet was cooked to perfection and the garlic mashed potatoes...delicious.  Absolutely worth every penny!

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite filet with garlic mashed potatoes, asparagus and a side of béarnaise sauce

eQEokjgPz3vFjd7NtVI4dw.text: My husband and I went here the day we got married. I ordered a surf and turf with filet mignon and lobster tail. The portion of filet mignon was so large that I could barely finish it. That's why we have husbands, to finish the rest for us. The steak was so tender and juicy. The lobster was so good, as it was served with fresh melted butter. This steakhouse is a little bit on the pricey side considering it is in Circus Circus away from the main strip. However, I did appreciate the aged steak. I remember as a kid when I first went here, I fell in love. It was only befitting that I come here the night of my wedding to fall in love again.  The interior is very dark, with an old Vegas mob feel. They even have a window where you can see the beef being aged right before your eyes. It's on of those places you have to try. It smells so delicious the moment you walk inside. Reservations are a must, because I don't believe they take walk-ins.

TGNHdz9xCSh8Bp7LSY5Fbw.text: Food was great but the service was just so slow and to think there were not a lot of customers there.

6HkNTXogBxgRdtJ-4nDeMw.text: The best steak I ever had ! I have had numerous steaks around all places - but this was top notch Only regret that I didn't order the petite filet wish I would have gotten the bigger one :)   Seriously !!!! You have to go !!!  I had the fillet and my friends had the porter house ! The sides were awesome I want to go back now !

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorry it&#39;s dark but it was soo yummy !

wOvYHm6K6LBp9aVGnb1-vg.text: We ended up at THE Steak House via a recommendation from a friend who had lived and worked in Las Vegas. She commented that, among locals, this is where to find the best steak in town - and it has been voted best steakhouse for seven years straight. I wholeheartedly agree.  First of all, forget that you are at Circus Circus. Ignore the smoky, rundown feel of the casino and head straight for the restaurant. The ambiance is exactly what you'd expect from a Vegas steakhouse: dark, intimate, and quiet. The servers are fast and seem to fade away into the background, creating an environment where you can just focus on your company and the food.  The wine list is on the small side but curated with a finesse for steakhouse fare. The soups, salads, and sides are also very complementary classics that you would want to find on a steakhouse menu.  I had the petite filet. I received a perfect medium rare, with the right amount of salt and pepper to bring out the best of the meat. The peppercorn sauce should be bottled and sold; the garlic mashed potatoes were better than anything I could make at home; and, the asparagus with brown butter was the definition of crisp-tender.  And the desserts...oh, the desserts. YUM! We had a party of five so we just ordered one of each dessert. Nothing says dessert at a steakhouse like decadent chocolate cake, cheesecake, tiramisu, and chocolate-covered strawberries. What a delight!  Don't go to THE Steak House expecting some giant, overblown menu like most of the places in Vegas; go with the expectation that you will get the best cut of meat and the best sides that Vegas has to offer. Everything is cooked with expertise and the service is outstanding. This is THE place for steak.

YAl8Po_4B7SxKA6qAegbww.text: After reading the great reviews and hearing about it from others, I booked reservations here instead of the newer, trendier steak houses in Vegas for 7pm on a slow Monday night.  I was looking forward to one of the best steaks I've ever had, maybe I got my expectations up too high?    First off, upon walking in I read on the podium the dress code was "smart casual", Yelp says casual...I was definitely casual and worried we were under-dressed.  After glancing at the others around the restaurant, I definitely was dressed smarter-casual than many others.  Maybe it was smart casual in the 1980's?  Next, the wine list.  I like drinking Pinot Noir with my steak.  A quick glance showed around eight choices of red by the glass, I believe it was all California wines and not a single Pinot Noir.  I settled for a Cab Sav and she had a Merlot, they were both fine and both were the cheapest wine by the glass at $8.  I ordered the Rib-Eye medium rare and she had the NY Strip medium.  I had the mashed potatoes and salad and she had the wild rice and salad.  Both came with asparagus (though the menu didn't mention any vegetable).  The salads came and both were excellent.  Steaks came out 6-8 minutes after we finished salads which was great as I knew they would be hot off the grill.  Mine was cooked medium rare but seemed overly charred on the outside, but it may have been just the large fat trimmings.  Hers was more medium rare than mine but she didn't send it back.  The problem with both steaks was the dryness and total lack of flavor.  A good steak cooked to perfection you should be able to cut with a butter knife, these two $60 steaks, not a chance.  I was very disappointed.  I didn't want to insult the chef and ask for steak sauce, so we added a little salt and pepper, it didn't help.  Maybe it was an off night for us?    The side items were fine and service was excellent to be expected, water was recharged often.  Though sometimes the server filling the water glasses would get too carried away pulling the water bottle up and down as if doing a magic trick and water would bounce onto the salad or dinner plate...stop the gimmicks and just pour my water please?    Dessert was tiramisu which was outstanding.  The check was $155 with tip, $185.  I've had much better two steak dinners well under $100.  Sorry Circus Circus, I won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib-eye at The Steak House

YpwkahP71Kgqylg24kB_NQ.text: We ate here the other night and I had the 12oz filet. It was perfectly cooked and about amazing! The other awesome part was that it was about half the price of any other steakhouse on the strip. We had a wonderful time.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12oz filet

8Rq2kTn8KPDWhvJmA43ILA.text: Very traditional steak house. Most of the staff have been there for 25 years or more & are experts at their craft. Steaks are perfectly cooked on real mesquite coals and the service was excellent.

o3LwawRl4c6lh814zRc_BA.text: Every time we come to Las Vegas and We want a steak? This IS THE SPOT! You can't beat the size of the steaks alone! Oh the tenderness and cooked to perfection ....no wonder why it's the #1 steakhouse in Vegas. Ruth Chris ain't got nothing on this place!

YFHGYPa9HzuKKmw9IzzL8w.text: We had other steakhouses we wanted to try and this one came so highly recommended by locals, we tried it. Went with the filets and they simply lacked flavor. For the reviews and fan fare, I was expecting so much more. I was going to rate this a 3, but we were in and out under an hour. If I'm paying $60 a steak, I'd like to relax a little in between dishes.   The service was so so. It was good, not sure if I loved it or hated it. That's all I can say about that. The old school flare was cool, but I have tons of restaurants like that back in Detroit.   Maybe other steaks are better than the filet, but I'd try somewhere else for the money. Salad was good, but was a $6 upgrade for a Caesar. The French onion soup was, just blah.   I was hoping for so much more.

ohMRDNduTpmn_kAYlOKbcA.text: We went to the steak house couple of days ago for one of my friends BDay  I ordered steak and it was the worst steak ever it was burned and hard I also ordered bake potato and even that was over cooked.. never again I only go to restaurant when the food is good and properly cooked . Again this is probably the  Worst restaurant in Las Vegas

I7D0T2m-p_QcyfPfb76ikQ.text: what I like about this place is the old school approach to dinning.  It's plush, quiet and a bit elegant inside.  The waitstaff is attentive and courteous and it smells great.  the Kitchen is in the center of the restaurant and it makes for a unique dinning experience.  The only complaint I have is the food was mediocre.  Much better at Ruth Chris. I had the rib eye and it had no flavor.  why don't they sprinkle a little salt before grilling to let it seep into the meat, it's not the same to add salt after cooking.  It wasn't just the lack of salt, it did not have the smokey, grilled flavor that makes a good piece of meat great.  So, I'll pass next time and go to where I know the food is good.

8Y3R08V4fR6zOPfrMlyPnQ.text: This was our second time here and with this night's experience, I figured it warranted a review.  We arrived a bit early for our reservation, so we had a drink at the bar first. Nice area with a dark, romantic ambiance.  The bartender was friendly and drinks were stiff, which I don't mind one bit.    We checked back in with the hostess about 5 minutes early and were seated right away.  As with the bar, the atmosphere of the restaurant is very cozy and dark.  Perfect for a nice intimate dinner.  We were quickly greeted by our server and busser with the usual amenities of bread, water, and menus.  Our drinks and appetizer orders were taken quickly.   Prior to dinner we had Jumbo shrimp on ice, French onion soup, and Waldorf wedge salad.  All 3 were delicious.  Fresh, tasty... but the soup was superb.  For dinner my girlfriend had ribeye on bone and I was trying the Wagyu fillet.  One thing we noticed is that neither steak was very heavily seasoned.  By that I mean, not overly salty or peppery.  I imagine to keep the meat more naturally flavored relying on each patron to salt to taste.  I was fine with this as I could season it to my taste.  The flavor of the ribeye was amazing.  Perfectly charred and cooked to temperature.  The wagyu filet was ridiculously good.  The flavor was so unique, and the texture was so tender.  Like not even eating meat.  As steaks go, I usually favor a ribeye.  They tend to be a little fattier but so much juicier.  This wagyu fillet was very very delicious.  Although with most, filets they tend to be less fatty and a little less juicy.  I would say the same goes for this cut, however with the price point being slightly higher than the ribeye, the flavor and experience was very worth it.  For desert we had the cheesecake (from Junior's) and the chocolate covered strawberries.  Both very delicious as well.    Lastly, I need to mention the service.  Coming from a food service background, my girlfriend noticed that our sever was seated with 3-4 new tables all within 15 minutes of us being sat.  One was large party.  This in no way deterred from the service we received.  Our server Chae was phenomenal.  At no point did we feel like we were waiting particularly long for any portion of our meal.  At the same time he could be seen moving quickly yet patiently to each table giving everyone equal attention.  His attitude was very impressive.  One hiccup we had was with the temperature of my steak.  I had ordered my filet medium rare.  Cutting into it, it was obviously cooked more to medium well. When Chae came by to check on our food he noticed the temperature almost the same time I was about to bring it up.  Without hesitation he apologized and brought me a new plate (all fresh items) cooked to perfection in less than 5 minutes.  Along with Chae, the busser/runner Javier was a delight to have.  He frequently checked on us to make sure we had everything we need.  Javier also had a very enthusiastic and enjoyable attitude which made us laugh throughout the evening.  The pair very much made our night.    All in all this was a great evening for us. Mistakes happen and can often change one's perspective of a restaurant, but with service that these two provided, and the great food we received, in the end it makes for a 5 star experience.  One we'll definitely be back for, and one I would recommend to all.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye and Wagyu filet...amazing!

DNxU2TW7fdgNEpw0QR1Mxw.text: Old school steakhouse vibe with 2 chefs preparing all of the meals in the middle of it. Great staff, food and atmosphere. Typical Vegas pricing but all entrees include sides, salads, soups, ect.   This meal was from March 12th 2019   Was pretty busy for a Tuesday night so reservations are recommended
