zqjbi7nkf7Gx0xvrOawJ2w.text: Excellent dry aged bone-in ribeye and house red to go with it. Outstanding service, and if you're a steak connoisseur you want be disappointed.

Sul9T3egP7OepH6rkmEFnA.text: I feel like I hyped this place up in my mind because I was told so many great things about this place. Having been to just about every steakhouse in Las Vegas I had always wanted to try this place. I never could bring myself to walk through the garbage can that is the Circus Circus. I wanted to like it and have level expectations but, my taste buds don't lie.   For starters... The service was exceptional and our waiter was as good as it gets. The atmosphere was as expected. The booth we had was comfortable and well lit. The sides, bread and salads were good. The garlic shrimp were great and the crab cake was a crab cake. No complaints there.   With that being said... My wife and I both had different cuts and both of us felt the flavor was lacking. Which was surprising because they were both cooked correctly. My wife ordered a rare plus filet and it was just plain bland. I had the Rib-eye with what felt like absolutely no seasoning at all. I understand I might sound a little critical, but that was not worth what I just paid.  The only thing that matters at a steakhouse is the steak. Period End Dot

_GnnEDlD__DzRpCTAlMT5w.text: I've been here multiple times now so it's finally time for a review. Walking into the restaurant you see the dozens of awards they have won. The dining area is too dark for me but I understand the atmosphere they are trying to accomplish.  Now on to the food, I love nearly every item I have tried here from the steaks, appetizers, and their soups. French Onion Soup: I get this every time and it's delicious almost every time. There was one time it was a tad salty but I still drank the whole bowl Steaks: I've had the T-Bone, Rib-Eye, NY Strip and the Prime Rib. All the portions are MASSIVE. I typically have left overs and they're like 2 meals! I liked all the steaks but the one time I had the prime rib it was on the drier side.  Overall good place for a date, delicious steaks with plentiful food but it is pretty dark inside so I typically ask for a table closer to the lights

p7MTo6HQnPxEE2eqxfB7Tg.text: Ppl say this place is good. It's not. It's freaking disgusting, horrible, terrible, and one of the worst experiences of my life. I cannot believe how little their management cares about their guests. They would rather kick people out than provide them with a water. They are jerks to their customers

y57PB3XDmMm5AV3mTFdiBA.text: Great delicious food. Great service and attention to detail. Highly recommended for dates or special occasions. Definitely will come back when I'm in town.

3V2zM-Fp2sOjt0JEVi-JdA.text: Ate here tonight. You have to go through the Circus Circus Casino which is something to see. But once you get to the steakhouse its like walking into a time capsule. The steaks were overdone but not too bad. The service was good but the atmosphere is what will get me back.

98OInkxjv3adkWrdeTF3rw.text: "Are we still inside the clown hotel?" That's what a friend asked as we stepped through the dark wood door into a paneled hallway marked with vintage Las Vegas photos.  The dining room of THE Steak House at Circus Circus couldn't clash more with the hotel around in, and that's a very good thing. Gone are the pastel pinks and clown imagery, replaced instead with a large display of aged steaks and a prominent broiler and kitchen. The dining room is furnished with similar care, recalling old Vegas with comfortable leather booths and dim lighting.  It's easy to disregard this restaurant when you park in an aging garage and walk in through a tacky casino that's on the lowest end of the price scale in Las Vegas.  But THE Steak House sets itself apart, and not just with the quiet ambience and tasteful vintage decor.  The food here is top notch, far exceeding my expectations on two visits nearly five years apart.  On my most recent trip, my party enjoyed the New York Strip, Filet Mignon, Prime Rib, and Porterhouse. All four cuts were prepared deliciously, with quality matched by the sides and appetizers.  The only low point of the meal was the bar service. The cocktails started out strong and tasty, but our second and third rounds lacked the same punch. This won't keep me from returning, though, as it's the sole negative mark in an otherwise wonderful evening.  That evening came to a close with dessert. THE Steak House imports Junior's Cheesecake from New York City. If you've never had the pleasure, this is a must.  It was served with some strawberry topping and a dollop of whipped cream, though neither of these added much. The cheesecake on its own is really the star here.  All tolled, the meal was not cheap, but we enjoyed giant steaks and plentiful drinks. One important benefit of this steakhouse versus others is that the cost of a cut and two sides here matches that of just the steak at most other Las Vegas steakhouses.  With that in mind, it's definitely worth the dingy parking garage and the garish decor to get to this little Las Vegas gem.

Viiv34SGUFKszo-A1Z-rCA.text: This hidden gem at the Circus Circus of all place is a must try. Food is delicious, we visit every time we are in town

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Visit every time we are in town. Food is delicious!
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their attentiveness is second to none
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aged meat locker

6slOdIY_iecMQC3J3oOtWg.text: Not what I expected and I mean that in a good way!  Had plans to have dinner with my family (me, my wife, 2 kids) at another hotel before attending a show I wanted to take my kids to but we were running EXTREMELY late.   We walked down the escalator from our room tower and towards the casino and as we were walking over to catch a cab I told my wife I didn't think we were gonna make it to our dinner reservation in time.   As we walked we came across a door - literally a wooden doorway - with the words 'THE Steakhouse' written above it right in the middle of the craziness that is Circus Circus. I looked at my wife and said 'this will have to do.'  We walked in and never expected a restaurant this nice to be located inside Circus Circus.  The waiter mentioned they aren't used to having kids eat here. That might explain why we were seated by ourselves in the corner of the restaurant. We didn't mind.  My only complaint is that, surprisingly, they don't have a kids menu. At a restaurant in Circus Circus? Really??? But the waiter was kind enough to talk to the chef and they were nice enough to whip up some chicken tenders and fries that weren't even on the menu for the kids. My wife and I were very appreciative of that since it was too late to go somewhere else and we were all starving and had a show to get to.  My rib-eye was excellent. The steaks here are comparable to any of the higher end steak houses on the strip and I've eaten at most of them. My wife had the petite filet and added the 3 giant prawns as an add-on. They were huge! Like the size of my toddlers fist. She only had 2 and offered me one but I couldn't even finish my steak.  Cuts of steak here start at around $50 and go up to $70 or $80 and come with soup or salad, vegetables, and mashed or baked potatoes.  I wish they had more side options though. They ONLY let you choose from either a house salad or black bean soup, and either baked or mashed potatoes. Nothing else. Would have been nice to have more variety.

pTuCRKx-Db5yp-3XqJsWRw.text: What? A highly rated steakhouse in the Circus Circus? You feel like you're in another city while in Circus Circus. The carpet looks like it's still the original and the midway is still the same too. Walking into the steakhouse, it's got that old school restaurant feel. Very classic steakhouse vibe.   We started with some crab cakes. They were pretty good. They split the order for us and gave us each a plate. That made it easy and the cakes were delicious. Great crab to stuffing ratio. Big chunks of crab.  I was deciding between the filet and the ribeye and opted for ribeye for more marbling and flavor. For the price of the steak, you also get a few sides. You get to choose between a basic soup or salad and choice of starch like mashed potatoes, baked potato, or rice pilaf. I got the salad and baked potato to go with my medium rare ribeye.  The salad is pretty basic. Some iceburg lettuce with tomato, onion, crutons and beets. Very meh.  The steak came out and it was huge! For sure over 20oz bone in ribeye. Baked potato was also huge and it comes with some asparagus spears too. The steak was cooked to temp which is great. But I think the steak was a bit lacking in flavor. It needed some more salt. I added some peppercorn sauce and creamy horseradish, but the steak should be the star and I think it missed the mark.  The portions are big and comes with sides so in terms of Las Vegas steakhouses, it's a better deal than most. I think if you're looking for no frills type of steakhouse this will be good. If you want a more upscale dining experience you are probably better off at another place on the strip.

TXkrhuIAEcmh4zKgi_SwbA.text: The BEST steakhouse in Las Vegas. My husband and I always go there when we come to Las Vegas. The restaurant is Old Vegas style  and the service is always outstanding . They have the biggest Shrimp Cocktail I've ever seen !  While the food is pretty pricey, it is well worth it . The only downside is this fantastic, classy  restaurant is hidden inside Circus Circus which is kind of a dump.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giant Shrimp Cocktail
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZG6tVKal0w0WPtPkJZ1BSg.text: My girlfriend and I like to dress up when we eat at a place such as this, like old Vegas once was (sport coat and dress). We realize we are a dying breed. The service for our meal was excellent. The food was good, not quite up to the pricing so we expected the deficit would be made up by the ambiance.   This is where the experience fell flat as we watched diners coming in wearing shorts, ball caps, and flip flops. The minimal dress code subtracted from the entire meal, making the meal overpriced. A shame.

aWeUZdTd0p22IeVRQocMUA.text: I was excited to try this place after reading all the positive reviews. An old school Vegas steakhouse at affordable prices? Sign me up.  The Steak House had the appearance of being legit. Dimly lit. Wood paneling. A dry aging room front and center. A smoky aroma filling the whole place. The cocktails menu had all the classics and the drinks were good and strong.  I ordered the bone-in rib eye. The menu didn't say, but I believe it was 16oz. $67. So unlike most steak restaurants, this included sides. Typically this steak will run you $59-$75 at a good steakhouse. I "upgraded" one of my sides to French onion soup for $6. I also ordered some mushrooms. $10.  French onion soup was fair. Steak arrived. I ordered medium rare. It was at least medium. Potato was a potato. You had to dress it yourself which I don't mind, but no cheese?! Vegetable was asparagus. It had little to no taste. Mushrooms had a weird citrus acidity to them. Seriously, saute in butter, salt and pepper. Add red wine. Reduce. It's not hard.  The steak had okay char, but was definitely not dry aged for any reasonable length of time and was not a very good cut of meat. Tough with little marbling.   After sitting waiting for our waiter for what seemed like forever I spotted some of the problems. Chef had a mesquite broiler, but was not doing any indirect cooking. Just slapping steaks on the grill. This leads to overcooking, toughness, and mesquite smoke filling the restaurant.   Overall, I was disappointed. This place had all the makings of a good steakhouse, but it was only on the surface. I think the included sides are just a gimmick as well. I spent just as much money as I normally would, but had to choose from limited and lower quality sides. Won't be back.

m-1QUkpx3wc5BTE5GrwaEg.text: Ordered the Filet Mignon. Medium Rare. It was dry and had no flavor whatsoever. Very unispired. That was nowhere near being worth $67. I wouldn't pay more than $30 for that disappointment.   The problem with tenderloin is they are very lean. Fat gives meat good flavor which typically filets lack. Steaks such as these need some form of marinade or sauce to enhance the flavor.   I can't speak for the other steaks but I can't imagine they would be much better if they aren't able to get a simple filet right.

DkyVJT39xxhPZ5phCIf2uQ.text: One of the best meals I've had all year...  When someone recommended I head on over to Circus Circus for a steak, I didn't believe them.  The rumors are True, this place rocks!  It has a really old-school feel, from the decor to the ambiance, to the wait staff.  Everything is designed to feel like an old Chicago style steakhouse.        I love that all of the entrees still have sides included with them, it makes ordering easy.  The salads and appetizers were amazing, especially the shrimp cocktail.   I recommend ordering some kind of a salad or appetizer to help space out the pace of the meal.  Everyone in our group loved their steaks, and the fresh horseradish was really fresh.  I highly recommend the ribeye or the filet.  Overall, this was a great meal and a really memorable night.  I hope to eat here again.

so1BX3qBEWhE55mP_hcvQw.text: The decor is old school...the overall experience was worth the value (for a Vegas dinner anyway). The oysters were well received as an appetizer, but the mushrooms stole the show. Everyone ordered a different salad and those seemed to disappear quickly. The filet was tender and cooked well and the True foodie in our group devoured his huge ribeye (blue to his liking). Service was very professional and friendly...though a tad on the slow side. The kitchen was pretty fast though and everyone left with full bellies. I would return here...but there are too many other options in the city of food.

gqyFwTGrGX046F-6qAE6-g.text: I never stepped foot in Circus, Circus before, but I will tell you, I will again and hopefully soon. What an amazing and extremely pleasant surprise. This is one of the best steaks that I have had in a very long time and Scott totally loved his lamp chops. My barber has been telling me for years, "do not miss this place" and I almost dismissed it, stupid me. Superb service by Chae, who has been here for 28 years and an unbelievable welcome and wine guidance by general manager, Ron, one of the nicest guys around! Food was excellent, wine list was very reasonable and now I know why Zagat gives the Steakhouse a 28, well deserved.

GOR3OCCrEcmtyBcn8oCiaA.text: Nice atmosphere, it's a hideout place.. good for taking hookers. (I wish I would have known this, I would have taken one). The bar is wonderful, healthy pours with an older gentlemen there that is personable and inviting. Problem however: you can't order from the menu at the bar. You can only order apps, which are all seafood. The FINEST steakhouses in Texas has - albiet limited- the ability to serve something once furry and don't make you look like a loser sitting in the main dining area by yourself, amongst dozens of couples and big-tops full of people laughing and pointing at you.  Now to the steaks: They have all the right stuff, the right cuts, the right cooking techniques, the right char-grill with real mesquite wood. But they miss something that I think sets Texas steakhouses apart from this place. Well, two something's actually. 1. Spice. 2. Thickness. If it's spicy, it has this thing.. oh, what's it called.. oh FLAVOR.. That's the word I'm looking for! And, if it's cut thicker, you can sear the outside for a nicer cool rare center. I wanted a rare steak, and was talked into the porterhouse due to how it would "render" in the bone and they said they would char it to perfection.   Bullshit.. the perfect steak isn't burnt. It's seared. The perfect steak has flavor. Not just a dry aged (although I agree a nice cut) tossed on a grill then splashed with water to put the flames out.   All was not lost however, it was a fair dining experience as the wait staff were so fast and courteous, and the drinks were poured right. The potatoes, asparagus, and side salad were magnificent and they don't make you wait for anything.  Will I go back, probably.. but this time I'm throwing a c-note to the waiter to go hand-select my steak, cut it to my specifications, and throw some cracked black pepper at least and maybe some salt on it and bring it out seared - not flame fried.   Oh, and the desert tray looked divine - but I chose a nice digestif for desert instead.

00-JBRoLSOi_8hDqaGQXnw.text: Good steak house,  Can't say its one of the best I've been to, but its good. Good service, good selection of vine  One bad thing  Location, Location Location, :(

77OrsMudsvh5xyoqLoxdag.text: This is definitely your old school steakhouse with dark interior, leather seats, and cow paintings.  When you walk in, you walk past the steak preparation station out in the open.  Service was excellent, steaks were cooked well.  Entree comes with soup/salad and potatoes and veg.    Ordered: Wedge Salad - great:  nice crisp bacon, great cheese Black Bean Soup - ok: onion adds a good kick Side Salad - ok:  great fixings but red wine vinaigrette was too much Petit Filet - good:  cooked perfectly Bone-in Rib eye - ok:  very plainly seasoned Two glasses of wine  Decent place to go to.  $90/person with a drink

n_jUlSV_uqDE-w4fksH4XA.text: 5 Stars all the way, this is a place I don't particular want more people to know about it, the service, food, pretty much everything is 5 Stars, but comes with a 2 stars price tab, the server Michael is one of the best server we ever had, ultimate service provided and we weren't in Dubai, prime rib rated 95+, pricing range for the drinks extremely fair, made me wonder are they in business for fun, instead of profit or what, General Manager Ron a great guy, one of the best restaurant hospitality ever enjoyed, will go back again and again !

4aZmUZbfNswBxrN-t25cuQ.text: I wish this restaurant was located at another hotel because I'm always really, really embarrassed to ask people to go the Circus Circus for dinner.  It was the first time for my husband and he only agreed to dine here because he loves me.  He wasn't excited walking through this ultra cheesy hotel.  But, he absolutely LOVED this place.    To start off, they give you an assortment of delicous bread.  Yum.  We ordered the shrimp cocktail and it was seriously the largest shrimp we've ever had.  Very tasty.  I had my salad with blue cheese dressing.  Nice chunks of fresh blue cheese and good veggie toppings on the salad.  We both had the filet mignon.  Melted in your mouth.  In addition, it had such a nice flavor (think they put mesquite in the grill).  Service was great too.  Our glasses were always filled with water, we had minimal time where we were sitting without food and they cleared our plates immediately after we were done eating (my husband hates sitting at a table when finished plates are left on the table).  You have to try this place.  My husband was skeptical but wants to dine here again during our next trip to Vegas.  Don't let the Circus Circus theme deter you.

lP4oWXi5aj9CAqsGcdfhgg.text: So, this past Wednesday I had dinner with my wonderful man at this place! First thoughts were when we entered; it had an old school vintage Vegas vibe to it! And it felt like somewhere mobsters would dine! Lol anyways, we were seated & immediately served water from the bottle. Our server came and introduced himself & we just decided to have water since this is a fine dining steakhouse. (There was pretty much only wine to choose from) they also have us some bombass bread I have ever munched on! We then went & ordered our salad & what kind of dressing with it; I chose red wine vinaigrette  it was so delicious & fit right with the salad. The lettuce in the salad was the freshest I've ever ate. I decided for my main course to get the New York ribeye with garlic mashed potatoes & my bf decided to go for the T-bone steak with baked potatoe and I got mine "medium-well" and he got his the same :) OMG!! When it came it looked so beautiful!!  and everything about it was just on point! Even when I cut it with my steak knife! It was like cutting butter! Loved every bite of it! Even the mashed potatoes! And the busser was on time with filling my glass full with water :) for dessert we decided to go with dipped strawberries in chocolate & it was cute how they presented the dessert on the cart that goes around in the restaurant but those are just for display ! I would definitely go back!

Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zV1f5MYox5jxwWlBZvOfvQ.text: So sad that this steakhouse has gone down a grade on their meat . It's gone from being the best rib eye I have ever had to just a good steak :( why why have you changed your meat ? I went twice in the past couple of years and everyone I was with said "amazing" this time I heard it was "ok"  not much flavor not the melt in your mouth steak of a year ago . I'm giving 3 stars as the place inside is nice waiters are great but the steak is not the same as a year ago so hopefully someone responds to this by telling us they have decided to go back to their old cut of meat ! Please Do so I can brag about your steakhouse again ! Still a decent price for Vegas ! Cheesecake is True NY cheesecake very good !

uZSOfuabIM-guFW3-61AZg.text: If you can turn off your senses going through Circus Circus aisles to get TO The Steakhouse, it'd be better. Bartender was grumpy gentlemen, bar kept very sloppy, not stocked. Wine menu very poor. So why the great review? Once you get inside, again tune out the other clientele (let's just say Walmart is on par).. The service staff was wonderful, ambiance pleasant old fashioned feel, the chefs amazing for what they do, you can't stop watching their work, featured in glassed area in middle of restaurant.. the steak (that's what you're there for) impeccably prepared. They do one thing extraordinary and focus on that. It was worth the godawful stroll through Circus Circus.

m_q2RZwHdD_bi2ZeCc3kNw.text: Legit steakhouse. Dark wood paneling, dim lights, Frank Sinatra singing in the background, smells like grilling meat, can see flames from my dark cherry leather booth. Keep expecting a fedora wearing mobster to be seated in the booth next to us. Awesome food. Price included huge salad and sides. Worth the money. Well done circus circus.

9ZY8VO_T6HUGqejq1fdiIQ.text: This is definitely a hidden gem. It seems odd that anyone choosing to stay at Circus Circus would pay for a $59 steak though. The food was delicious and the steak includes bread, soup, vegetable and potato. The service is excellent. We were there on Sunday at 9 and still needed reservations, so plan ahead. The only negative is the location.

INCiDQksekZ5fiMUqY8zrg.text: Steak was mediocre, tough, worse than any other casino steakhouse I've been to.  Service was slower than dirt, except the guy doing the water - my cup was being constantly topped off.  Dessert was great, however - the chocolate mousse cake was pretty tasty.

sukHZUO4C1rhfv2itVGHqg.text: The best steak house I have ever been to.  Intimate setting, friendly staff, amazing food.  Had the porterhouse steak and my girlfriend had the New York strip.  Both tasty.  Salad, Bread, Baked potato and Steak all included in the price.  Excellent value.  Will go back for sure! My mouth is watering right now :-)  Update 03/31/07.  Went back again on Saturday night.  Went early to check on our reservations and lo and behold, they didnt have us marked down.  A little frustrating but the manager(sorry I cant remember his name) said to come in at 7 and they would see what they could do.  Got there at 7 and were seated immediately.  Excellent service by our waiter Felix.  Amazing food and amazing service once again.  I just want to thank the manager of the place for doing a great job and for excellent service by Felix.  This is the type of service that will keep me coming back every single time I am in Vegas!  Thank you to the entire crew at The Steakhouse!

0KXcdoGMX9eIsco7e4jMxA.text: We had a great time here, one of the best filet mignon I have ever had.  The wait staff here is very friendly and fast to any needs you have.  They charge you to split plates but definitely worth it.  We left stuffed after splitting the steak, garlic mashed potatoes, bread and Cesar salad.  We were shocked by how good this place was.

g18cdKuGbFJMn_wcmX80wg.text: Been here many times over a lot of years.  Always good service.  This restaurant is really out of place being so upscale in a very low end hotel.  The steaks are good, but the Prime Rib is always  G-R-E-A-T .  The place isn't "cheap", but when you consider the entrees include both salad and potato, it's a better deal than comparable other steakhouses.  A bit tricky to get in on weekends because they're usually fully booked unless you want to eat at either 5pm or after 10

M6phjGE4cTR7XAohllML6g.text: We had the misfortune of staying at Circus Circus for one night a week ago. Luckily we discovered THE Steakhouse (thanks to the reviews on Yelp!). The quality of the steak was amazing, extremely tender and with an excellent flavor. The place is a great value too because unlike other steakhouses the entree comes with your choice of salad or soup, a veggie and your choice of startch (hubby had the rice blend and loved it and I had the baked potato also excellent). The service was top notch and the atmosphere retro, reminded me of some of the old school steakhouses in San Francisco.  I would definitely recommend this place for those brave enough to walk through Circus Circus to get there! (It is worth though it I promise you).

atY8Sn56QtFHruLe33GHgA.text: I love The Steakhouse. I've been coming here for many years and it never disappoints. Seriously what classy steakhouse includes a side and salad with the main course? Most high end steakhouses are a la carte. I always get the bone-in ribeye...delicious and perfectly cooked. The service is always amazing and attentive. The only downside is making the trek to the place and the lax dress code. I see patrons in baseball hats, shorts, wife beaters, etc... I guess the majority (and wallet) rules. It's not a big deal though. I like trying other steakhouses in Vegas but this place will always have my heart, err..stomach.

g4zjVCeJyLQ5y3Hdb1iAXA.text: OMG the food was so good. What an awesome place. Steak was cooked perfectly. THe prices arent priced to high, very reasonable. I will definetly be coming here everytime I visit Vegas. My server was Mitch, he was awesome. Ask for him if you decide to try this place out.

pmuKGi8cHyS4V55nvmti-A.text: The best Steak on the Strip everything considered. Sides included and great service.

-B5sv0xbrweKvfOzEicM1w.text: I was told from multiple sources to check this place out. I'm glad we did. It's the best smelling Steakhouse I've ever been to. The black bean soup is a must. Filet was perfectly cooked. I don't necessarily look like a have money or will tip well but that didn't stop Felix from killing it. Literally, one of the best servers I've ever had.

6LUyhxYXEdjuopKgr-uAaA.text: Not really the hidden gem they made it out to be but at the same time I enjoyed this place. The service was remarkable and the lamb chops were delicious. Banana Foster was great as well. Steak was lacking in flavor a bit much but all in all this place is a classic and I would visit again. Thank You for making my Vegas experience complete with such a Classic restaurant.

Oue7SOrMnlgX5bbIfuY9yA.text: I loved the place. Old school. Like olllllld school. Dark red leather and green walls and dark mahogany everything. Really quite hilarious in this day and age - but in a good way.   Food was excellent. Steaks are minimalist and cooked on a grill. HUGE portions and most can share one. Black bean soup is amazing. Garden salad with blue cheese was excellent too.   Would recommend the peppercorn demi with your steak as they don't come with much seasoning per order but with the peppercorn is was excellent.   See past the hotel being substandard relative to the new spots on the strip and check it out.   Price point is high. Steaks are $50-62 per person but again you can split one quite easily and be filled.

OBQMBppyV4sImle_8d8MBg.text: What can you say about a True classic this place is like stepping back in your grandmothers kitchen service the food is unforgettable there is no Vegas experience without dinner here ..... Argentine  cowboys Boston ma

GhqKIA6h7Z4b5YCISM8zOA.text: The Steakhouse was recommended to us by the Concierge in our hotel.  She was so right.  The incredibly wonderful food and atmosphere in this restaurant are only surpassed by the kindness and professionalism of the staff, most of whom have worked there over 25 years.   It's a bit pricey, but includes choices of salad or soup and choice of potatoes.   I ordered the Petit Filet.  It was the best I think I've ever had.   My mom had the salmon and was equally impressed.   We will go there every time we to Vegas.  Love it there!!!

W6I8QCHbSamHrv8jGIZu9Q.text: So the main reason I chose to dine at The Steakhouse in the somewhat dingy and now old Circus Circus hotel was due to a very strong recommendation from one of my clients who insisted that this is the place to have some delicious meat--prime rib or steak.  At first, I thought to myself--this place is at the Circus Circus--am I going to fear for the worst?  I gave thought so many times should I or should I not go for a visit...and well, I read so many reviews on Yelp, and decided what the heck--it won't hurt to take my friends out for dinner there.   So this was our third day in Vegas, and we had just completed an adventurous part of the day earlier that afternoon--found a fedora hat for our friend's wedding ceremony, went to the Gun Store to go shoot some machine guns, and now, it was time to get back to the hotel to savor some great food, as I was highly expecting of.  Got dressed up to the dinner, even though yes, it is at the Circus Circus.  It's one of those occasions you just don't want to dress down, and even though Vegas is quite acceptable with any type of attire, clubbing and formal dinners should be dressed to the nines, in my opinion.  We got dressed quickly, and drove out to Circus Circus.  Quite honestly, it used to be a dump, and it hasn't changed much~!  Well, parking wasn't so bad; easier than what I was expecting of.  As we walked into the casino area, the hotel really shows its age, however at the same time, it bought back a lot of memories from when I was a child, when my parents brought me there to play in the arcade, and watch the circus show.  The Steakhouse is hidden in this little area in the middle of the shopping galley, and as soon as you walk into the restaurant, the vibe is very classy Vegas-style.  We were welcomed by the restaurant's manager, Ron, who was very cordial, and friendly.  Because the manager and my client from work are great friends, we received even greater, and exceptional service.  Sat down at the booth, and the bread came.  Wow~!! It's ridiculously delicious.  We were offered bottle of wine, though we opted because we didn't want to get hammered.  Instead, we proceeded to order from the menu.    My two friends ordered the Porterhouse steak, while I ordered the prime rib.  Talk about portions--wow--it's huge!  My meal came with rice pilaf, and vegetables.  Trust me--I was barely able to finish my dinner.  The prime rib meat was so tender--and the light sauce was just right--not too rich, nor too salty.  It was beyond delicious, and for this dinner, I wasn't looking to dine out all big and fancy on the strip.  I really wanted something genuinely delicious, and this place hit the spot.  Besides the food, the service is just phenomenal.  I'd have to say the service is quite etiquette to the nines.    I left this restaurant thinking that it was by far the best meal I've ever had in Vegas.  You definitely get for what you paid, and because it was my friend's bachelor party, I picked up the tab, but no dollar amount should be compared to the food that's served here--it was just so well worth it.  Trust me--I've been to Vegas more than you can count, and yes, by far, this place is now on the top of my list!  Overall grade: A+

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the perfect prime rib at The Steakhouse, Las Vegas, NV

KhoDmssila4Bu2m85QiYIw.text: Came here for our reception dinner after getting married in Vegas 10 years ago.  Decided to come back and it's still delicious with wonderful service.  David was wonderful.  Hope to come back in 10 years.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib was excellent.
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vjuo4uWW4QJRgvgh9W40QA.text: Went for the 1st time to this Steak house for my birthday...I was truly impressed! By far one of the Best steaks I've had, cooked just right n very tasty...yummmm can't wait to go back but will consider sharing(they almost serve u the whole cow) lol till next time !

EAwhWbwZk3WgFAuj7_nyPg.text: I never would have expected a steak house this great to be in Circus Circus.  I mean Circus Circus, really?!  YES!  It is a great surprise.  The decor brings you back to the old school steak houses.  Both the service and the food are exquisite.  Do yourself a favor, get the dry aged ribeye, it was the best!

ovOvZyFfr7iEGhI2FkmqYw.text: This is an annual pilgrimage and didn't disappoint.  Well aged steaks, cooked to order, we will be back again

4OPEiRJXfTj8a-XIG_1Dcg.text: This is my second year coming to the Steakhouse. The atmosphere here is something that you don't get in some of the newer restaurants. It has the old Vegas feel and and porterhouse is excellent. Don't let the location turn you off. Once you are inside you will understand why this place is rated so highly. The prices are reasonable and you will come back again.

pG6e_s1SbLEiYIySR0ZTfQ.text: This place is STILL the best staek dinner I have ever had!  The service is impeccable, and he ambiance intimate and comfortable.  The Steak House (at Circus Circus) has been a favorite of ours for years and never lets me down.  Don't get taken by the corporate chop houses.  Come check this place out.  It is so under stated, you would pass it by if you weren't looking for it.  They have a crazy talented bar tender too.  You MUST try this place when in Vegas!

iAP3iIHDVFQ_QPkgX5Rz7A.text: We were pleasantly surprised to find this wonderful spot as it is located in the underwhelming Circuc Circus. The atmosphere and the food are second only to the service.

CQ1nfLA7AuiEfiJLclZToQ.text: This was our first visit to The Steak House - it will not be our last - the steaks were awesome and cooked perfectly, the room and chairs extremely comfortable, the wine list was a bit lacking but found a ok wine - dessert nothing to write home about - but the smell and the steaks well worth it.  If you love steak and mesquite wood grilled steaks I highly recommend  The Steak House at Circus Circus

L05rPIgZFT4Slw_aTnnIoQ.text: This place is always very highly rated so we decided to give it a try.  I would say the meal was good but the process to get there was a nightmare.  The restaurant is the only good thing going for Circus Circus.   First of all, the parking situation was awful.  The place was packed with tons of families and kids.  We were stuck in a very long line for a quite awhile even to get into the parking garage. They had one entrance blocked off for no apparent reason.  Handicap parking and valet were both full.  And we asked one of the attendants were the handicap parking was and he was very rude to us.  So we finally parked and then had to make our way into Circus Circus.  There are kids and parents everywhere.  The ceiling is low, the place smells awful, the gambling sucks.  I definitely never need to go back to Circus Circus ever.  So we finally get into the Steakhouse.  We did get a nice table right by the grill area so we could watch what was going on.  The inside of the place is very traditional steakhouse with wood walls, dark furniture and quiet.    I had the filet mingon with double asparagus instead of potato.  It was nicely cooked.  Good flavor, tender.  Asparagus was good too when I don't even really like it.  My mom had the lamb chops. It was a huge portion.  She took half of it home.  She liked her baked potato.  They give you lots of toppings for it.    So I would say this was a good steak place but not great.  I have had much better in Vegas at other restaurants.  And the process to get there sucked.  Never again.

aThwVQnShegAjEt6YPrkpw.text: I was skeptical about anything located in tacky Circus Circus. Friends highly recommended this place, so we went, and ---Glad we did!  Hubs and I celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary here.  Decor is "old school", sort of Brat Pack, 60's ambience--  Dark, intimate and comforting.  They have aged meat here, you can see through a glass window all the steaks they are aging.  Service excellent.  Our waiter Richard, and  assistant Ernesto, were top of the line fabulous.... efficient, friendly, just terrific.  Made the dinner so special.  Menu here is "old school" as well, nothing fancy or fusion. Appetizers:  My half order of shrimp cocktail-- SUPERB!  two of the largest shrimp I have ever seen, cooked perfectly, and served with a Horseradish Mayo.. YUM!  Hubs ordered Black bean soup with Sherry (very good) and Oysters.  He said he prefers the oysters we get near Seattle-- but still very good.  Our rib eye steaks were cooked to perfection-- char on outside, pink inside.  Garlic mashed potatoes, and asparagus were also sooooo good.  Paired our steaks with glasses of Louis Martini Cabernet Sauvignon, which went so well.  After gorging ourselves silly, we had a complementary Tiramisu (for our anniversary) which was a perfect ending to the dinner.  A wonderful experience, great food and service.  The best ending:  We then played some craps at the Casino, and unlike a couple other places on the Strip-- we won!!!

pvYFBG84IIyxI8Xx3udFTA.text: The classic steakhouse of yesteryear.    You remember, the kind of place where starters were chilled seafood cocktails.  The place where you could have any kind of soup you wanted as long as it was French onion.  Where every entree came with a salad, a starch and cooked veg.  Where seasoning wass just salt and pepper atop slabs of fire grilled beef, lamb, chicken or fish.  Where ballin out of control meant a big a$$ lobster.  Welcome to THE Steak House.  Yes, it's in the little black sheep of the MGM empire, home to the $25/night room.  Sure the decor is slightly dated and the servers show their patina.  It's still Vegas baby and it delivers.  Starters are simple.  Well cooked, chilled, sweet, jumbo shrimp served with a simple albeit horseradish heavy cocktail sauce; a steakhouse classic.  The French onion soup, showing a great beef broth undertones blending with sweet caramelized onions and sporting the perfect, broiled gruyere cheese topping.  To the real stars, the steaks.  All 21 day, dry aged on site.   Well trimmed.  Four cuts, all grilled over an open mesquite fire.  Excellent sear and always to temp.  The bitterness of the smoke does obscure the subtle umame undertones of the aged beef.  All good.  In the end, it's like a USDA prime backyard BBQ.   Top props to the porterhouse with the bone in ribeye a close second.  Something different?  The bone in prime rib is as good as any.  Juicy, tender, not as well trimmed as the ribeye but classic in every respect (fat is flavor).  Sides are, well sides.  Baked potato with the works, perhaps cooked carrots or asparagus.  No complaints.  Respectable wine list with low Vegas resort markup.    Excellent, steakhouse friendly service.  Snub it if you will.  It will be your loss.

tx3TpKz4BBbhdB5wC1gXQg.text: We decided to try The Steak House after seeing that it was ranked high in various reviews. First, let me say, "Don't let the walk down the corridor to the restaurant influence you!" Yes, it IS Circus Circus and definitely not where you would expect to find a great steak house. However, after finding it and opening the doors, the first thing that hits you is the amazing smell of grilled steak! We were seated right away and loved the "old school Vegas" atmosphere the restaurant had. Our waiter, Roberto was fantastic and personable. He was very helpful with suggestions as to what to order and the food did not disappoint! Surprisingly, the meals are NOT a la carte, they come with bread, salad or soup, entree, and choice of mashed or baked potato, or pilaf and chef's choice of the day vegetable. We chose to share the bone in ribeye and opted for the split plate charge of $20 so that we both got our own salad and sides. The food was prepared perfectly and it was DELICIOUS! We brought our own wine and the corkage fee was only $20, which is almost unheard of at a steakhouse of this caliber in Las Vegas. We had a great meal at a great price. It was definitely comparable or better than the "famous chef" steak houses on the strip and a much better value. We will be back on our next visit to Vegas...definitely!

RYNBIOswWPwZP4n9dWgTig.text: High reviews but plain food. Less than good service. French onion was plain. Bone-in ribeye was plain. 16 oz prime rib was very tasty. Mashed potatoes were plain. My beer sat empty for 15 minutes.  Again, if you're looking for a good steak, go elsewhere!!!  -Midwestern steak lover

hRNEmfaogjEvUUMJsFwHIQ.text: This wasn't my first visit at this restaurant! I had a 6:30 Reservation at The Steak House. So as a returning guest I'm very disturbed by the service I received.  For a $285 meal, this shouldn't have happened. I've ordered the 27 ounce Prime Rib Dinner on multiple occasions to share. (the restaurant gives you the option for $20 extra). The Prime Rib has never came to my table from the kitchen UNCUT. I was caught by surprise when the server informed me that I had to cut this 27 Ounce cut of meat myself. It's always came cut from the KITCHEN for me and one of my guest. After the waiter noticed surprised look on my face and requesting that the kitchen cuts the huge Prime Rib for me, my waiter grabbed MY CUTTING KNIFE AND TRIED TO CUT MY PRIME RIB IN HALF. He grabbed my serving knife off the table and proceeded to try to cut my Prime Rib in front of me. He was literally in my personal space trying to cut my meat how he thought it should be cut. I had to literally tell him once more that I would prefer if the kitchen chefs cut it. He looked irritated. I mean WTF, why would you try to cut my damn prime rib for me? He brought the meat back and it was cut in a way that it should've never been cut. Directly down the middle.  When I've ordered this before on different occasions it has never came to my table looking so rock bottom. It always comes actually cut in a way that looks like an excellent cut of meat. I'm so angry that this waiter literally took my cutting knife and proceeded my cut my 27 OUNCE PRIME RIB STEAK AT MY TABLE. And then we only had 1 AU JUS Sauce to share. We asked for a second one and although the server brung it to us, he did it in a way where it seemed like we were bothering him. I'm very disappointed. And as investor in MGM Resorts properties, in very disappointed in this property. I'll never return.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This $65 Prime Rib should never come to the table like this. A restaurant should stay CONSISTENT. Why lowball your customers.

cfq3i9qVX34hs58s79FWUQ.text: Me and my queen make it a point of eating here every time we're in vegas. Been here many times and have never had a bad experience. The ambiance (Sinatra and Dean through the restaurant) to the low lighting and leather back chairs, this place is tops.  Im constantly amazed at the attire of some of the guests though. Swim suits and baseball caps? Really? But I guess its vegas and who really cares eh?  Plan on spending a few dollars for a great meal along with supreme service. Make a reservation and treat yourself to one of the best meals in vegas.

VhZyhrAVTZ7baV9ftJi5fA.text: Steak is a commodity. It's a dish that almost anyone can prepare, so steakhouses normally focus heavily on service and their sides to differentiate themselves. THE Steak House could not even get the steak part right. I would not even feed this garbage to my dog.  I have heard the servers at THE Steak House have been here for decades, and it shows. Everything about our server was slow. Want some bread? That'll be ten minutes. What to order? That'll be 30 minutes. Want the check? Keep dreaming. I should not have to ask a server to move to every next step in the dining process. Absolutely pathetic.  After dealing with our incompetent server for almost an hour, we finally received our food...if that's what you want to call it. Everyone at my table had overcooked steak. If that was not bad enough, the steak was not even uniformly overcooked. Some part of the steak were undercooked while others were overcooked, and all of it was a complete disaster. The sides were nothing special either lacking flavor and seasoning, but certainly not lacking in disappointment. It was not even worth sending anything back- that is how badly we just wanted the meal to be over with.  After finishing our meal we waited...and waited...and waited...and finally when I realized our server crossed into another plane of incompetence, I finally had to ask for our check.  It appears Circus Circus left the door to THE Steak House open one too many times and the circus itself is now running the place. With so many top notch steakhouses in Las Vegas, there just is no reason to patronize THE Steak House.

oEIHApJ0srwehVofZErCWA.text: For years I wanted to try The Steak House at Circus Circus as my Uncle use to frequent the place and boast about how much he loved the place.  No offense to Uncle Bob (R.I.P.), but the $68 porterhouse I paid for recently was EXTREMELY bland (drywall would have tasted better) and not much more tender than an average Walmart steak.    Also the service was too fast.  It felt more like a fast food joint where they herd you quickly through so they can usher in the next group.   We literally received our salads a few minutes after placing our order, then the main course a few minutes thereafter, and the check before finishing our meal.  To make matters worse the restaurant was only at 25% capacity there was no line of people waiting to get in.   Perhaps there was some hidden "don't rush me" option on the menu that I missed.  If you're looking to get rushed through your vastly mediocre dinner, don't plan on having a lot of conversation with your party and really enjoy being swindled, then I highly recommend The Steak House.

jU2eriHhivJ1s3VKuxx-DQ.text: HOME RUN EVERY TIME I HAVE BEEN HERE!!! This is the 3rd time that I have eaten here while I have been to Vegas and this has got to be the best steak I have ever had! What is also a big bonus is the mashed potatoes, asparagus and soup is all included in your meal which is the only one in Vegas that does this! I always get the Porterhouse with the garlic mashed potatoes and black bean soup! This steak house has the old 1960's and 1970's feel and is the best steak house I have ever been to. This place is phenomenal and their food is delicious! Everything from the bread, butter and garlic bread is outstanding! Will go here every time I am in Vegas and I highly recommend! A+

bk2RIHxh3MH9UgjjdF2ICQ.text: THE Steak House has been on our bucket list for the past decade, so expectations were high.  Sadly, the juice fell short of the squeeze.  The decor definitely brings you back to the days of old Vegas... in a good way.  But we had mixed feelings about the food.  The dry age room was a sight to see if you're a meat eater, and the vibe of the room reminded you of the golden days when the mob ran Vegas instead of today's Corp conglomerates.     Overall, the beef lacked some seasoning, the pour wasn't as generous, and the dessert was only good.  I would expect for the price, everything would be top notch.  However, service was friendly and attentive, and the booths reminded you of the movie, "Casino" with Bobby D.    Total rating is 3.75, but always good to round up.  Bucket list item 96, checked"!

RTJ3WNo_Pvih4egPblt9Rg.text: This place makes you want to put in a velvet dress and play some jazz.  It's old school.  No gastronomy wizards here.  But that is part of the charm.    This is just straight forward, well cooked American fare.  It's stepping into a time gone by, but with out feeling the least bit old and stuffy.    Extensive menu and wine list with an attentive staff who treats you like your the only guests they have in the restaurant.  Felix, our server, thought of everything you needed before you even knew.  A True professional.   If you want an old school steak dinner,  this place is your jam.

Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bacon vinegarette salad.  Get this one!
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French onion soup was yummmmo

S1V4RYF9FsqoQ83zTmI3oA.text: We went for dinner as a family for my 11 year old daughters Birthday.  We told her she could pick anywhere she wanted to go.... she picked this spot.  Now she had never been here before but she had heard of it from some of our friends and of course she loves steak.  There is a lot about this place that is appealing.    1. They have a center island that you can watch them make your steak and food.  It makes it fun.    2. The menu isn't over complicated.  The steaks are served by themselves and you add your side dishes.    3. The menu items were big enough for us to share.  The steak was huge and perfect for me and my daughter to share. We had the bone in rib eye and added some potatoes and a veggie.    4. Not overly priced.  Remember it is a steak place though.   We would definitely go back.  Loved it.

lZeNPNmePKdaHYQ5zvHYBg.text: As always, the Steakhouse does not disappoint!  I was there with my son to celebrate before he started his first job.  Greeted warmly by the host and while we were early to have a drink in the bar, our table was ready anytime we were.  A couple of drinks in the bar and then to our table where we were again greeted by our waiter.  We ordered our dinner, Strip medium rare for my son and the prime rib medium rare for me.  Both were perfectly seasoned and done exactly how we ordered them.  The Steakhouse will continue to be our go to restaurant in Vegas!!!

LhWGm69ynKIecgnDt7Ss4A.text: First off, this is an old Vegas steakhouse. If you want to be wowed by a celebrity chef (and pay mostly for a name), then don't bother coming here. If you want a really good steak and a step back in time, then come here now.   This place has been a Vegas institution since the 1980s, and most of the staff has been here that long (seriously, ask them). They will gladly talk about the history of the place and point out where notable people have sat in the place when they served them - both times I've been here, I've had lengthy conversations with the staff about the old days of Vegas and other places that carry on the same legacy (like Golden Steer, Michael's and Hugo's Cellar). And don't let the Circus Circus part scare you .. you won't have to pay for parking here and once you get inside the restaurant, you'll completely forget you're inside the hotel.   Food is reasonably priced and the portions are above average sized. The place is not huge, and it is quiet - good for a romantic dinner. You can see the open kitchen from almost anywhere inside as your dinner is prepared. All parts of the menu are very traditional - do not expect over the top presentations or pizzazz; there is not a drink menu, but a bartender that can make any traditional cocktail quite well. The wine list is pretty good sized and priced the way it should be, corkage is an extremely reasonable $20. Entrees come with a salad, starch (the garlic mashed is to die for) and vegetable side, which is a long lost thing in this town. Couples might want to opt for a larger cut of meat and go for the split plate. If you're a prime rib fan, go for it - this is one of the best in town.   No dessert menu, but you'll find the standard items here. Bananas Foster is highly recommended. I'm a little disappointed that they recently got rid of almost all their Port options, but the one they kept is quite tasty if you're into that.   Overall, it's a must do if you can appreciate what this town once was.

jhF-iReQSleGP9FeKDPz2w.text: Our group was surprised to hear that one of the best rated steakhouses in Vegas is located in the past-its-prime Circus Circus casino. The restaurant easily accommodated our group of 7 (we made a reservation well in advance). The atmosphere was cozy and resembled an old school steakhouse.   What I liked most about the restaurant is that soup/salad, a potato and a vegetable were all included with your meal. Definitely atypical for most modern steakhouses. Everyone in our group "upgraded" (additional $6) their soup/salad selection from the included choices of black bean soup or house salad. The Caesar salad was a True standout. The French onion soup was okay (I wished I got the Caesar salad instead). It seems like it was a Swiss and Parmesan cheese topper on the soup and the Parmesan just didn't work.  Our table was split between filets and prime rib. Even the petite cut of prime rib was enough for two people (and I have a big appetite!). We also thought the wine list was reasonably priced.   For dessert our table had the bananas foster and the tiramisu. Both were tasty and the portion size was decent.   Definitely a place we are likely to visit again!

Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French onion soup

Juj-yptNDyo4eVfFMtWvqQ.text: I had heard about this place for forever but finally started coming about two years ago. And I LOVE IT!!!   If you are looking for a True old school steakhouse experience then baby this is it!!! You can actually smell the steak from about 25 yards from the entrance. For real! The servers wear proper tuxedos and from what I understand most have been there for over 20 years. Please do not confuse the family friendly oriented Circus Circus Casino with this very much adult and formal establishment that rests inside. And frankly, you won't find a steak that is much better either!  Since my introduction a couple of years ago, this has been part of my rotation when I'm feeling extra carnivorous! Just whatever you do... include the Seafood Tower!

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Uus57d0bEIdQjAOIob7sJQ.text: If you were traveling to Mars with Elon Musk, this should be your last meal on Earth!   What a treat being here.  Food is excellent.  I had the potterhouse steak (pictured) with baked potatoe and aspargras.  Salad (pictured) to start with weird wonderful pretzel rolls  (pictured).  Mesquite grilled steak was melt in your mouth. Dumb lucked with table near the grill so could see all the preparations. As you walk in, you can see the meats being cured. Steak part of the menu is pictured.   The atmosphere is old school.  With over stuffed chairs that are incredibly comfortable.  Service was prompt and efficient.    The steakhouse gets very busy, so reservations are recommended.  The only downside was reservation gal's English was not too good,  but was minor problem.  The steakhouse is in the sketchy circus circus casino,  which you may want to avoid.  The steakhouse can be pricey,  but if it was in upscale casino it would be even pricier.   Am not sure of the size of the potterhouse,  but had nice piece to take home.  That with a couple pretzel rolls made a great breakfast.   Worth finding if you are in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretzel rolls. Yummy!
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Porterhouse steak
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House salad

_CUA8ULlP7af5KfM7row9Q.text: The service here was excellent.  The food here was appropriately priced for a higher end steak-house.  The medium rare steak came out more medium well, and they were able to take it back and return with a new steak, done the right way.  All of the sides were delicious.  I'd say this is a recommended place to dine at, it's worth the price.  If you're a gambler, know that you probably spend $100 or more on the tables or slots risking that to win something, most of the time walking away a loser.  You're better off guaranteeing yourself a satisfying meal, treating yourself to something better than a buffet and coming here for a quality meal.  Circus Circus is one of the few hotel casinos in Las Vegas that does not charge for parking, which is an annoying growing trend that I'm sure drives away locals.  It's refreshing to see Circus Circus offer FREE parking.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Porterhouse Steak (24oz of Filet Mignon and Rib Eye Cut with the Bone In) - Medium Rare
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Porterhouse Steak (24oz of Filet Mignon and Rib Eye Cut with the Bone In) - Medium Rare
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Porterhouse Steak (24oz of Filet Mignon and Rib Eye Cut with the Bone In) - Medium Rare

J5vdRSd4CSGhBLl2aEbI1w.text: This was probably my 4th or 5th visit to the aptly named Steak House at Circus Circus... I have tried a couple other establishments in Las Vegas and, so far, none compare.  The first thing that I kind of enjoy is the rough around the edges Circus Circus casino. After trekking through the dated casino at the end if the strip with the somewhat disturbing clown / circus theme (and a very high percentage of small children for a town that is billed as Sin City) you step into another world.  Appropriately subdued environment, intimate bar, comfortable seating... The ideal steak house atmosphere.  Our server, Felix, was a True gentleman. Helpful with wine suggestions and knowledgeable about the menu. There was a slight delay with the entree and, instead if letting us wonder, he let us know what was going on and picked up a round of drinks. A very professional server but also a gentleman that I would like to have a drink with at the bar I think.  On to the food... The shrimp in the cocktail were huge but the shrimp were surprisingly tender. The presentation was excellent... Served in a funky bowl on a bed of ice. The lemon was wrapped in a yellow cheese cloth (I assume to keep seeds from falling into the food.) The cocktail sauce was perfect. A little more with the horseradish than most places but not enough to hurt those with delicate sensibilities... Most cocktail sauces taste like ketchup to me... Not here. Just right.  The lettuce and vegetables in the salad were very fresh and crisp and the Thousand Island dressing (must've been house made) was the best I've had. It's usually hard to get excited about a side salad but I really enjoyed this one.  My 8 oz filet was, in a word, perfect. Lightly charred just right on the outside and a warm, pink medium rare inside. Possibly the best filet that I've ever had... The bearnaise was an ideal compliment.  I'm not generally an asparagus fan but the stalks were thin and crunchy. Great flavor combined with the steak. I was almost disappointed when it was gone.  A baked potato is a baked potato but it was accompanied with plentiful butter, sour cream, fresh chives and crispy bacon. So big that I could only eat half.  I wish I could tell you about desert but I just didn't have it in me. What passed by with the servers looked fantastic and I think I heard a little sigh if delight from the table across from us... Some sort of multi-layer chocolate cake I think. Looked great   The Steak House is not flashy or trendy. It's expensive but dinners include salad, vegetable and starch so it's actually reasonably priced for a higher end establishment. I will definitely be back every time I come to Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 of a shrimp cocktail. No, they&#39;re not mutated giant shrimp from a Godzilla movie... But they are delicious!
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 8 oz filet, perfect medium rare. Possibly the best filet I&#39;ve ever had.
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty salad with house made Thousand Island. Fresh and delicious!

AWMKDnuO1HZhzvsJpi85_w.text: Such a wonderful place to celebrate a special occasion. I made reservations ahead of time and each member of the staff came to greet us and wished us a happy anniversary! It was so special to us! The food was delicious and the service was outstanding. We shared the crab cakes, had the filet Mignon, ribeye and lobster tail. The lobster was my least favorite but everything else was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black bean soup
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet, garlic mashed and asparagus
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Add on lobster tail

YNGpnznwCMSQ3AuQFzVLtQ.text: Amazing that such a great steakhouse can be found in the dingy grungy Circus Circus. I walk through not touching anything for fear of getting lice or cooties from this worn out joint, then walk into THE Steak House, an incredible ode to the long past days of the grandeur of old Las Vegas. Definitely recommend this to anyone wanting a proper steak in a memorable setting, just bring your blinders to block out the crappy view getting to it.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7y75ltokaEkCQhnSZtqyKQ.text: We went to this steakhouse last night. We were excited to try it because of all of the wonderful reviews on yelp.  We were sadly disappointed. Let me start with the good things.  The Caesar salad is really delicious and large enough to split. The person assisting the waiter was so hard working and kind. The waiter didn't seem to care about anything.  Now to the food. Steak ( filet) was fire grilled and delicious. The salmon was ok. The sides are limited. No specialty drinks or martinis. The restaurant was old and tired. Over all not worth going to because there are so many delicious options for food in Vegas. I highly recommend going somewhere else for the same money. Also circus circus is awful and dirty. :(. So sad to have waisted our money here.  Sadly it was probably a great restaurant in its day but that day has passed!!

SIw-7F4RWr_FD3WyPIlwWw.text: Have gone for my birthday the past 3 years and have always enjoyed the service and the special slice of birthday cake given to me at the end of the meal. This year the 3 stars was for the rushed and inattentive service by our waiter MIKE.  The host greeted me with a "happy birthday" and sat me and party (2 of us) at the table, 12 minutes went by before Mike came to take the drink order and meal order at the same time.  We were still eating our salads when the steaks were brought, but had little to no interaction with the waiter during the meal. Drinks sat empty twice for awhile before refills were brought. The assistant kept busy refilling water glasses, but the drinks purchased were not filled promptly.  I ordered my steak medium, but the middle was cooked medium rare. I was almost finished with my steak when the waiter Mike stopped by to ask how everything was (for the first time after bringing the food).  Not very attentive and felt rushed. Not wished a happy birthday by our waiter as in years past, and not given a slice of birthday cake as in years past.  Steak was tender, but no flavor to it unfortunately.  We were brought the bill without asking for it, or asked if we liked anything else (drink refill maybe?)  Heard other another table celebrating a birthday, but was overlooked this visit.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining area
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon

M4AsupWktyKPxu8KAZTjyA.text: First off it's worth the "adventure" through Circus Circus Circus to find this gem. Seriously s throwback to a classic steakhouse with leather seat booths and green parlor lights.  A great meal with great service and really reasonable prices for comparable Vegas restaurants.  Wine list isn't overwhelming.  Cocktails were good classic drinks.  The NY strip is one of the largest cuts I've ever enjoyed. Tender and extremely well prepared. The filet was phenomenal.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY Strip
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

GJwlX5s52zW5I9u4lx592Q.text: Wow! Their name, while seemingly self-serving, appears to also be pretty accurate. This is THE steak house that I want to go back to the next time I'm in Vegas. I only ended up here because it was the first result when we looked up "Steak House" so the name has its perks!  Located in the back of Circus Circus, the surroundings are pretty incongruous with the relatively upscale nature of this place and the wall of plaques and accolades you see as you come in.  But on to the main event! The important thing here is the steak, and boy is it worth the asking price.  Prime rib, bone in, medium rare - absolutely perfect, tender, and melts in your mouth. Au jus, creamy horseradish, and regular horseradish to compliment nicely. Comes with sides, which are good but totally unnecessary for me given the portion size I was dealing with. Come hungry, or be prepared to share! I didn't get an ounce count but it was big enough that as a big eater I was still worried about being able to finish it. Don't fill up on the bread, salad, or soup if this is a concern - you'll want all that space to savor the main course!   I also tried a bit of the ribeye, which was good but in my opinion gets beaten out by the prime rib handily. They were the same price at $68 a pop so that's my recommendation if you are choosing between the two.  You pay a bit of a premium, not the worst, and I came away feeling like it was totally worth it. 5 stars

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. THE Steak House. Lives up to the moniker
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good, but don&#39;t eat it at the expense of your steak
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thickness check. Satisfying depth.

vIkhLEnc5xkpYiCQy8cWTQ.text: I checked out this place while searching for a steak on the strip that wouldn't empty my wallet.  This is the place for that! You would never think a classy feeling steakhouse would be in Circus Circus, but it is.  The steak itself was cooked perfect, the bread offerings were delicious and the desert (bananas foster) was amazing.  While the sides and some of the presentation points were less than fabulous, for the money it was a solid meal.  I recommend if you don't want to spend serious money at a high end Vegas steakhouse.

52VJ22h5b6w6GIn3hAlmWA.text: My boyfriend and I had been told for Weeks prior to our arrival in Vegas that we HAD to go to this steakhouse. We made our reservation online. (super easy!) We arrived to Circus Circus about half an hour early and decided to play a little and look around. That casino was a madhouse full of rude people and their annoying 10+ children. I kept having to tell myself that a tasty steak was awaiting me! When if was finally time, the hostess seated us quickly and politely. Our waiter made my boyfriend and I feel like millionares! What service! Super nice guy and the restaurant had a very fancy-cozy atmosphere. Where we were seated we were able to watch their chef grill our steaks. Even the salad was fancy! Best. Steak. Ever. We had the prime rib and the ribeye. The prime rib was very tender and juicy with a very yummy au jous (cant spell that!) The ribeye had a perfect char and an incredible flavor. The asparagus was crisp and delicious and dont even get me started on the potatoes! Yum! If anyone is hankering for an incredible steak and is willing to put up with the zoo to get there, I would recommend this, bar none!

N4qMjdTzZvOXZOtNsjSC4A.text: I go to this steakhouse in circus circus once a year with my family every year for the last four years. We come from CA so this is a must do when we are in Vegas. Every time we go we love it and that's why we always come back. The steak is always delicious, but the service this time lacked some attention. First the waiter who poured our water, poured so far from the glass water splashed all over the wine and dinner menus. It could of been prevented by just lowering the arrowhead water bottle closer to the glass. My New York steak was ordered medium. It came out very rear and very pink. Then Usually after dinner we order coffee. Our plates get cleared and the waiter was supposed to clean off the table crumbs so we could have our coffee. We sat there with a dirty table cloth sipping our coffee. Sorry steakhouse, dissatisfied. It wasn't even a busy night for them. It was on a Sunday night at 7:30.

v1CTfw7Q4Tj9Rg8sPFAdfA.text: Value+service+delicious food=5 stars  When my husband wanted to try the "Circus Circus Steakhouse", I told him he must be crazy. I'm way too prissy to eat at Circus-Circus. But, I took one for the team, and I sure was glad! Now, we eat here almost every time we go to Vegas! Yes, you will pay $50 for your meal. But, unlike other expensive steakhouses, your dish will come with a salad, a vegetable and a starch--I suggest the baked potato with all the fixin's. Most other steakhouses are a la carte, and once you add in the salad and sides, your $50 dish has become a $75 dish. So the value is there.  I will say that if you like a broiled steak, you may not enjoy the "charred" flavor on their steaks. It's not a burnt flavor, it's just different than a broiled steak. I actually prefer their crab legs over the steaks. You get a HUGE plate of King crab legs, and they come completely split in half length-wise, so the meat is ready for you. A variety of breads are brought to your table and they are all amazing! The waiters are all super-friendly and my water glass never got more than half-empty. Highly recommended!

-VIxZKjyV6PoR-32Pi84Mg.text: In the few times I have been to Circus Circus with friends and have walked past this place I have always laughed and thought to myself what kind of idiot would eat at an "upscale" restaurant at this hotel? Well, I am the idiot for thinking that. The Steakhouse is bar far the best steakhouse I have ever been to, better than Smith and Wollensky up the strip and right up there with Mortons in Beverly Hills.   The decor is awesome, it feels like you are stepping into a speakeasy in the roaring 20's. It is all dark wood, a brass fixtures. The have a glass aging room where you can see the meat being aged to what really is perfection. They also have their kitchen in the middle of the dining room so you can see the chefs work, and they do work hard,   The food is amazing, from the basket of warm bread to the Caesar salad to the entree itself. I got a filet and couldn't finish it, it was that big. Unlike many of their competitors, they include the soup or salad and sides with the steak so you get a huge portion at a good price. Dessert was also huge and spectacular. Try the chocolate or cheesecake, you won't be sorry.   Service was also stellar. There is always someone refilling your glass with bottled water (no charge) and we had a very nice and knowledgeable waiter. The best part of all was that while they were attentive, they did not hover.   The person at the valet mentioned that the owner of Boyd casinos eats here. I can see why.  Next time I am in Vegas, I will be back.   P.S. Reservations are a must. The manager at the Players Club got us in, but without her, we would have missed this amazing dinner.

uJkUB5IeZHvvEtU6nRq55Q.text: First thing is first..Don't let this steakhouse leave the picture because it's located in the Circus Circus. Yes, you have to work your way through the "Circus" crowd but in the end it is well worth it. My dad's boss is a Vegas resident and swears by the place which is where we got the idea to go. We were down from Reno for the UNLV-Nevada game and wanted to have a good dinner without the Vegas price tag. We are college students so all the high priced "stewey" steakhouses were out of the question.   Walking in you get the feel of an old school steakhouse which is what we wanted. The smell of beef slaps you in the face the moment you get to the receptionist.   We also wanted a place where dress was considered. We wanted to celebrate and look nice doing it! Some reviews on here have stated that people walk in with shorts and button up shirts...This wasn't the case when we went. Every person in the restaurant was dressed "up".  I'm not going in depth about the food because I'm not a food critic and won't pretend to be one, but to sum it up we all had Filet's and they were cooked to perfection. The best part about this place is that your steak actually comes with a side and salad!  All in all we had a great experience. If your looking for a steakhouse that isn't going to hammer your wallet this is your spot.

ncGSAxZwXScoYjqzOqb4hw.text: The food and service were great. Would have never guessed that such a great steakhouse was hidden inside Circus Circus.  I would definitely come again.

UkNo7f19Zrj7E8P5STJ1IA.text: This place hasn't changed, and I'm glad for that.  You know you are in an old school steakhouse when you eat here, and there aren't too many places like it left in Vegas, at least on the strip there aren't.  The food and the service are great, and its a very good value.  You could do a lot worse.

QbJmQP9K68ZX11qUMj-RDg.text: This was a solid, old fashioned steakhouse in a really great MANLY ambiance.  Everything was tasty and it was relatively affordable for what you got. I couldn't finish my meal - which is rare (no pun intended).  Did it blow me away? No. But that's OK!

OpuuURZiNw-7QL9Pz29oOw.text: One of the best, if not THE best Steak House I've been to in Vegas. I've been her twice in the last 6 months. The first time was probably the best steak I've ever had. I love the ambiance here. Rolls were delicious. Service was great. I will definitely be coming back.

3PmIeDkbWq1f8VgVBPwu8w.text: Super classy place in the midst of the circus. The fact that it is in Circus Circus and there are many kids running around outside should not take away from the ambiance and atmosphere of this place. It's amazing how once you walk inside you don't feel like you are in the casino anymore. The service was unbelievably good with many waiters constantly attenting to the table refilling drinks and whatever else is needed. Sure the steaks are pricey but if you want a good steak you need to pay. Everyone enjoyed there food and we all left very full and satisfied. Great way to have a nice dinner in Vegas.

98Nnv3WvwK-Nho_OI3JmPA.text: The filet was awesome! It was perfectly cooked medium rare which is hard for a filet cut. The staff was very attentive and our food came out fast which was great.

N6hh1bZldzXqVRrm3ZQoVQ.text: We had friends visiting from Seattle who love Vegas and had heard this place was great and wanted to go try it. I hadn't heard much about it as a Vegas local but was hoping for the best.   4 stars for the ambiance its that old red leather dark Mobby Italian renaissance decor that makes you yearn for the Vegas of the past. 4 stars also for the wait staff who is professional and hard working and striving to make sure you never have an empty glass and just the perfect amount of banter.  Ok now for the bad news, the food was only 2 stars.  While there we had:  The Spinach Salad with hot bacon dressing - this was nothing special definitely more deserving to be highlighted at a mid market family restaurant.  The Chopped Salad- decent but again nothing special.  Petite Filet w garlic mashed and green beans- Sorry can't use the words great to describe it . The green beans were the standout.  Porterhouse- Not cooked correctly filet Ok but other side tough and overcooked which in my mind is completely ridiculous for a steak house where you are paying 50 plus for a steak.  Desserts- looked good but frankly after being underwhelmed by  dinner didn't take the plunge.  Final issue, was when we were done we were at the CIrcus Circus not anywhere to grab a quiet after drink. except the bar in restaurant

m37fYJq9JLiZZxuLic1rdg.text: There is no better. Pay no attention to the sixty foot clown with the red rubber nose. If you miss this, you miss Nirvana. You didn't see Las Vegas. Your life is an empty shell and you will see nothing but pitty reflected in the eyes of real Las Vegans. One of the best bartenders in town: the dude with the white hair. Tip heavy or go home. As for the waiter-never mind. He's mine mine mine. OK his first name begins with an R. Simply the best steak between here and...I forget.

YCyphoU2eFa1-wCP4WJyWw.text: Located in inside what appears to be the craziest indoor state fair like atmosphere of Circus Circus. That being said, once inside this meat oasis did the job. 3 of us stuffed ourselves silly with meat, sides and a few drinks for $200. Not so bad!  I competed in half ironman triathlon earlier that day and ate the whole ribeye and sides!

YwO1P7cVcxgJdBkkpq87KA.text: This place used to be a hidden gem worth blazing the gauntlet that is the tacky and sad Circus Circus. Alas....no more. I will never brave the trek to the NO longer best of Vegas. Filets were so poor in quality that they tasted slightly mealy as if they had been doused with tenderizer too early. Nothing was worthy of mention. So sad to say good bye, but I must.

-45r88daVPaPx4T8YJaDQA.text: Located in Circus Circus...Yes that Circus Circus, this is a throwback of a steak house to the 50s or 60s.  The meat is on displace aging in temperature controlled glass lockers for your viewing pleasure.  The red booths are what give it the throwback look with the kitchen grill on full display in the middle.  The meat is aged 21 days without spices...  That being said, this place is very good if you like your meat rare to medium rare as the flavors really come out.  Anything above medium and you will have a burnt tasteless piece of meat on your plate.  This place is old school and everything is ala cart and should be shared, the bone in Rib Eye is very good.  I am a purist when it comes to meat so butter, excess salt, or marinade on my steak...I will pass.  In other words Ruth Chris' type places are awful to me.  I'd say this place is on par with Morton's of Chicago, Flemming's, etc.  price-wise too.  Guess there is a reason The Steak House was voted top Steak House in Vegas 20 years in a row...20 years.

rxwPGYeQ3PSkoBOy7L32Yw.text: Driving down the freeway I saw a billboard that said something like:  19 times in a row voted best steak..
