I've been to Morton's, Fleming's,  Mastros and Patrellis,  and some Chicago Steakhouses.  It was a good piece of meat but that was it; didnt seperate itself from the pack. If you want to enjoy a large selection of sides don't come here all they have is potatoes and rice.

a3yZai9xi1cmb4Wz1CJsnA.text: OMG!!!I believe We as a people advance 10steps forward and 30 steps back. I was born in Las Vegas, NV. I can remember when you could walk from one end of the strip to the Tropicana in no time. I can remember my parents going to Cesar's palace to be entertained by Diana Ross. At the age of 3 my mom married my stepdad and He relocated us to Los Angeles,CA. They have transitioned. In October of 1968 my mom brought me to Circus Circus for their grand opening. I'm a professional. With my profession being law enforcement. I'm considered upper middle class. I'm a frequent flier and avid traveler. I visit Vegas yearly alone or with family and friends. But in October I come to Vegas alone to celebrate my birthday. It's sentimental for me. I come alone and think about all the beautiful memories I have of Las Vegas as a child.  CIrcus Circus isn't really my cup of tea. However I stay here because of the memories. So my vacation started with 2-nights stay in Sedona ,AZ and then Las Vegas. Another tradition in our family is to go out to dinner for lobster. My parents didn't care what it cost we ate lobster for dinner.  I've seen THE STEAK HOUSE several times but elected to eat at Palms or other restautants but on the 27th I decided to try it out??! Big mistake. I'm sure the staff are Donald Trump supporters. I have never in my life experienced the racism that I experienced in my life.  The waiter was so confused because I ordered the most expensive lobster platter on the menu. He couldn't answer simple questions I asked him. Mind you he was Asian and had the nerve to be racist...??African American people stay away from this place. The greeter wasn't any better. This place isn't all that trust me! Your just a cut above the Red Lobster. By the way I refuse to eat their also. I divorce them when they changed from the seafood broiler. I will never come here again. As a matter of fact I will never come back to Circus Circus again. The Steak House I just want to thank you for ruling my family tradition. Do not eat here if your AFRICAN AMERICAN

Q6AJRJjdTVezxDDQXu6b2A.text: When you think steak house you think fancy well maintained but then when you here this address you think what circus circus top 3 in the worst of vegas category! Getouttahere!  But after many years and many many recommendations I finally made the schlep over and now I am kicking myself for eating anywhere else in vegas for a steak.   First off you can see how they cook the steaks when you walk in and they are char cooked so if you don't realize that your an idiot and are wrong sorry.  Next the hospitality was bar none might have been the greatest experience in a restaurant in my life. Our waiter was amazing! I was going to order a caprese salad and he told me dont worry about it cause you get a salad with your steak I was still going to do it cause I wanted mozzerella and he brought some out for free without asking so I could have my meal the way i wanted it.  For app we had the shrimp cocktail. Beautifully plated baby arm sized shrimp and he knew we were sharing so he brought them out on seperate plates already for us with our own lemons and cocktail sauce.   Afterwards he came back and chatted with us about NY and the history of the restaurant among other things. Extremely knowledgeable and all around great guy.  Our steaks were cooked perfectly and he even went and found me some fresh ground horseradish for my steak to top it with. I can't wait to get to vegas to come back here worth a trip by itself and this time I am definitely getting the prime rib!  side note first time I ever tipped 30-40% in my life

bT1WrVhIov-oTwOOFVdW_A.text: Our salad came instantly after we ordered! Steaks were cooked to perfection! The cooks cook right in front of you on a mesquite grill. Bathroom was beautiful n well keeped! Romantic ambiance! They present the dessert live. Had the filet n porterhouse, amazing! Bananas foster for dessert! Nancy was our waitress n was very kind n attentive. I would recommend to any meat lover anywhere!

_W62gOjL-J1ktatXitGsmQ.text: I came without a reservation.  I'd recommend making reservations beforehand as the restaurant was pretty much booked.  I was able to sneak in around 7 pm with a 15 minute wait.  Service was very attentive.  They serve bottled Arrowhead water as your drinking water.  I ordered the Oysters on the Half-shell, Rib-eye steak, and had my soup that came with the steak upgraded to the French Onion Soup.  Oysters on the Half-Shell - Terrible.  The presentation was fine, and oysters were separated from the shell and cleaned well.  I tasted no grit, but they were very bitter.  I'm not an oyster connoisseur, but I've never had bitter oysters before and I certainly didn't enjoy them.  French Onion Soup - Tasty.  The cheese stayed melted throughout the entire time I was eating the soup which surprised me because a lot of the times, the cheese just congeals.  I enjoyed the soup thoroughly.  It wasn't too salty and was full-flavored.  I would probably get this again if I had to come back.  Rib-eye Steak - This was way under-seasoned and there was a lot of char on the steak to the point where all I tasted was burnt crust in some of the bites.  The parts that weren't burnt, I had to add a lot of salt for some flavor.  I find it really sad that a steakhouse charging these prices cannot cook a proper steak.  I was incredibly disappointed because I wasn't able to go here the last time I was in Vegas and made it a point to make an outside trip to come here this time around.  I was sorry I did.  The sides weren't too bad.  I had the garlic mashed potatoes, which were actually pretty good and the best thing on the entree plate.  The veggies were nothing to write home about.  Service is very helpful and attentive, but food-wise, this failed miserably.  Overall, I would not come back, and if anyone in my group suggested it, I'd probably nix the idea right away.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye on the Bone with Veggies (Asparagus) and Garlic Mashed Potatoes
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters on the Half-Shell
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Onion Soup

RM4elRnu2zB-lYbn-hFIjg.text: After living in Las Vegas for so long we decided to try this steakhouse.  We sat next to the grill and watch as our steaks were being prepared, bone in Rib Eyes what a treat.  The quality and taste were amazing.  The inside is very retro Vegas, but what a great time and meal.  Great steaks and service, we will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in Rib Eye, what an amazing meal.

VJFtlLnnk8YQcTpEtT3oIQ.text: Note: Restaurant Week August 2013  Brad "Mr. International" T. & I decided to come here because this was something he has always wanted to try. Also, we needed some red meat after not eating any red meat for 3 months! I was hungry for some good steak!   Courses.   First course: Caesar Salad - (2.5) It tasted like any other caesar salad and it wasn't something that I was impressed by, I could have made a better caesar salad.   Second Course: Filet Oscar -  Mesquite Grilled Petite Filet Mignon Topped With Alaskan King Crab Meat, Asparagus And Hollandaise Sauce.  With a side of loaded baked potato  (3.8) I was super excited to try it and have some good steak! I ordered my filet medium rare & maybe I should have asked for it to be rare instead. It was a bit overcooked, but it still tasted great!  However, I wasn't a big fan of the hollandaise sauce. :( It was way to creamy for me or maybe I just dont like hollandaise sauce at all.  The carb meat tasted delicious. I loved it so much! The loaded baked potato was simple and ordinary.  They  put all the sour cream, butter, bacon, and chives on another plate.  Which was pretty cool because you determine how much you want on your baked potato.    Dessert: There was a variety of desserts that you can choose from. Yay! From the choices I remembered there were creme brulee, another type of creme brulee, banana foster in a martini glass, chocolate cake with raspberry, and a few others. Brad T. got the banana foster and I got the chocolate cake with fresh raspberry!  Banana Foster in a martini glass (5)  It tasted amazing, THE BEST banana foster crepe-like I had ever had.  It was perfection!  My chocolate cake with fresh raspberries (4): It was very moist and I loved the raspberries.  Service (5): They were amazing and always filling your drinks, checking up on you,and professional!    Atmosphere (4): very old-school vegas, with the red leather seats/booths, but I really liked it. They had deer heads mounted on the walls, but good thing there wasn't too many of them, then that would be over-kill.  I remember counting only 2, but then I realized there was another section of the restaurant.    Great place, great service, and great food!

Vv1hXsy_Fx8Tp_TwauT63A.text: Atmosphere is great old school. But the service is even better.  Bone in ribeye steak is so good. Mesquite charcoal  grilled favor was unbelievable. Price is a little high,  but meals come with great bread and soup or salad.  They don't kill with extras. Will be back for more great food.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QuLJ0_nGJftV9fjHaydzVQ.text: The food was okay. I'll put it like this my appetizer was better than my steak. The bread basket was kind of boring. The inside of my steak was cooked perfectly but the outside was dry so I knew it had been sitting for a minute. The actual waiter I had was NEVER around but the water guys and the guys that delivered the food were superior. Overall it wasn't worth the money and I definitely won't come back. Gordan Ramsey steak puts this place to shame on it's worst day!

JYS8dHaKCxsf4yDZNi7jvA.text: Excellent steak and still a favorite of my parents. Now the bad thing about this restaurant is the smokey air. I can enjoy my food but that smell of smoke kills my nose and when my family pays that much for steak just let us be able to breath. Service was extraordinary and the Resturant was a great experience all and all. Thank you

-amCFoDxhzGv3u4rtMoKeA.text: I forgot to check in at this fine establishment!  We dined here for a pre New Years Dinner.... This place was recommended by locals as being one of the finest steakhouses in Vegas... I must say my family and I are were so impressed with the food and outstanding service! We ordered a special that they were offering at the time; choice of salad (Waldorf Wedge I chose), Entree 8 ounce filet mignon which was absolute perfection, 8 ounce lobster tail that was totally delectable, baked potato, asparagus spears finished off with a tiramisu that was to die for! This restaurant was zagat rated for several years and I highly recommend this place if your desire is for an outstanding steak.  The only drawback is if you want call it, it's in Circus Circus... Not to sound like a snob, but there are far nicer hotel casinos in the area that have restaurants that you would think serve the same caliber of steak.. Not always True, sometimes image isn't everything..... Happy New Years!

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner special menu offered at New Years!

nn792O2BNWAiqVJjzXpwlw.text: The service was great. Nancy was our waitress and provided excellent service. We never had a chance to ask for anything extra because she was there before we could think of it. The cooks were a different story. There were three people in my party and we all ordered medium steaks. They all came out rare. I even sent mine back and it still came back rare. I raved about this place to my friends and nobody finished their steaks. Normally this place is amazing, but today it seems the cooks didn't give a shit.

e4-D61UiIkBlohLq1NIj4Q.text: We chose THE Steak House because of the good reviews and we were very disappointed. The only good thing it had going was my steak was cooked perfectly - it had no flavor except for the burnt pieces stuck to it from the grill.  Their grill hoods obviously don't work well since it was so smokey in the restaurant. Our service was basically non existent. Unfortunately our nice dinner out was a complete flop and I couldn't even get the managers attention when he walked past our area several times. Bummer evening out.

HdkOnnahT5eTBfenIl61-A.text: Drove into valet and they said it would be $8.00 to park. What corporate idiot thought of that. We spent $400 for dinner and $10 to park. Please don't give them business!!!!!!

sIq3K-SZypYAXj1fbiyCBQ.text: I was in Vegas about a year ago and did some research into which steakhouse to patronize. I chose one that was well reviewed and that had made more than a few top ten lists. It had a famous guy's name attached and held a prominent position in the ranks of the city's swanky meat joints. I could not have been more disappointed and upon leaving the place, felt a little swindled.       This time I decided to go old school-y, narrowing it down to The Steakhouse, Hugo's or Golden Steer. I was more than happy with my choice of The Steakhouse at Circus Circus.       The worst part of the visit was the actual walk through CC. it's not nearly the worst place I've ever walked through, but it's a bit of a dump. The ceiling felt a little lower and the cig smoke smelled a little thicker than the Vegas average. I breathed through my mouth and moved quickly.        Once in the restaurant, you walk past an glass enclosed aging "closet" and a glass enclosed kitchen where you can see them grilling the most gorgeous slabs of beef and pristine shellfish, all on the way to really beautiful red leather booths and white tablecloths. The lighting is low, the room warm and dark and in the background you hear the hum of Sinatra or Tony Bennett. It's all like some welcoming Martin Scorsese cliche  is playing out just for you and it's awesome. Fantastic vibe in this room!          You get bottled water and a less than stellar bread basket after ordering. The pre-meal  salad was decent with generous amounts of crumbled bleu cheese. My companion thought the black bean soup was on the bland side, but liked the addition of sherry and onions on the side.         I had a bone-in ribeye that was around the size of a hubcap and my companion had a porterhouse that was a bit bigger than that. These things were huge. I didn't finish mine, which is rare. And speaking of that, both steaks were cooked a goddamned perfect medium rare with a nice criss-cross mesquite char covering tender and flavorful goodness inside. I had not had a steak this good in a very long time, in this city or any other. I added sauteed mushrooms and peppercorn sauce on the side, but they were unnecessary. The other sides were fine. Garlic potatoes, wild rice, asparagus, yadda yadda....The meat is the show here, and worth the trip.       Skip your Kobe wagyu fancy-Dan, trendy-Wendy steakhouse and come here. It will make your soul happy and you wallet happier.

4Km9HfVUSE7Vd6CAQ_vYyw.text: (Dined 2-14-2013, thought I already posted)  My husband and I just finished our "Valentines Day" dinner tonight,  Saturday evening. He was very excited about the surprise dinner he planned stating they had great reviews and is always listed as a top Steakhouse. Neither of us had dined here before.   We arrived to The Steakhouse after walking through The Circus Circus to find a surprising setting and ambiance. We were greeted by the manager and immediately walked to our booth after giving our reservation info. The manager actually turned the table sideways so I could slide in and moved it back after we sat! Being 6 months pregnant I found it unexpected and greatly appreciated.   The menu was old school, straight forward and genuine. We both ordered the bone-in prime rib. It was a Flintstones sized cut! Delicious. For dessert we got 2 orders of the chocolate covered strawberries because the first was so sweet.  But, the kicker, the icing on the cake, what really made the entire evening special, unique and tailored to us was Javier's top notch attention and service!! He was friendly, pleasant and engaging. He spoke to us about our soon to be baby girl being that it was our first child and told us about his family and related. He was absolutely amazing and definitely made the evening memorable. My husband and I enjoyed our first Valentines as a married couple because of the experience at The Steakhouse!

X2LIyf5Lz2H4P9f5DwSYbw.text: We here for birthday and anniversary dinner. I was amazed that a restaurant of this caliber and quality was in Circus Circus.  An old school steak house serving goes meat on white table cloths.  Service was 5 star food 5 star. Try it when your in Las Vegas you will be amazed.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4DvdO7X0EfrCcGGFsJFSoA.text: Old fashioned steak house .. Very very expensive but hey the experience was worth it for a vacation . Don't be fooled by the worm down circus circus hotel and casino which is not a cool place to stay unless you want to see a bunch of kids running around and screaming but the steak house is a remnant from the past when the casino was much nicer. The wait staff was on point and the shrimp was great ..steaks were also very good .. We had a half shrimp app (2 shrimps ) , 2 steaks (rib eye on the bone ) oh and a salad app to share with the shrimp..had one drink the bill was $200 with the tip..so yes it's  dry expensive compared to many places but it's worth seeing a piece of old Las Vegas ..

HYoj1baLNfOTWWKbh1WusA.text: Ate here while staying at the Circus Circus hotel.  Mitch, our waiter, was both very knowledgable and helpful.  The food was on par with a restaurant of this stature, but I will admit I've had nearly as good of a prime rib at other less expensive restaurants like Texas Roadhouse.  The real value in this place is the fact that it isn't ala carte like so many restaurants in this category.  My bake potato came with a heaping side of bacon, butter, sour cream, and chives which was plenty more than I needed.  My only real gripe is that their appetizers were seafood only which I did not care for.  If you are staying at the circus circus there is a coupon for a free bottle of wine at this restaurant, but keep in mind the bottle they give you with this coupon retails for $5.39 at a wine store, but hey it's free.  Overall a nice steak restaurant worth going to on the strip if you have never been.

XBmPQLMAT12EdNwWFAfs5A.text: We go there every year once or twice and every time it's amazing.  They serve steak, simply and fresh and over wood fire and it requires nothing else. This place hasn't changed in 30 years nor should it, the food is great, the staff is excellent and the ambiance is superb!  If you visiting or a local come here before you try those overpriced others.

BBRcOtUSZkEFF2VygAuoFQ.text: Great steaks, awesome appetizers, delectable desserts, HUGE portions. They even have a room for the sole purpose aging their beef, how cool is that?   I ordered the ribeye steak (bone in) and it was so thick and big I barely made through half of it. The service here was beyond expectations.   Not too pricey for a steakhouse on the strip and sooooo worth it.

uQM9TSPvwfd0Yq0Do1BdcA.text: Great Food + Great Service   This is the 3rd time I have dined at "The Steakhouse" and it never disappoints !!!

xf6sXDkof_iJuEXA64JZ-g.text: We have visited The Steak House several times, but this time was off to a rocky start, we had made reservations for a special occasion but were initially seated in a cramped seat next to the very smoky open kitchen (there must have been a problem with ventilation as the whole restaurant was smoky at first) Eventually we were seated at a cozy booth in the back, our server Felix was outstanding and the food was delicious - and we were treated to a complimentary chocolate cake for my birthday. This is our 3rd or 4th visit to The Steakhouse, although we enjoyed it, probably won't be back for a while, they were a little off their game.

Yd1OUMeRBVAKbMHnev_Sxw.text: This highly acclaimed restaurant has been a frequent Best of Las Vegas recipient over its 31 years of existence. It is noted for serving dry aged beef from an in-house cooler located near the entrance to the dining room.  After reviewing the wine list and estimating our final bill, I selected a bottle of Rosemont Estate Shiraz. This $32 bottle of wine, featuring a twist off top, retails for approximately $8, but proved to be an upgrade from what we have been .  We started off with a grilled shrimp appetizer that included a delicious garlic butter sauce. Dinners include a basket of bread and house salads.  The bread was warm and the salads fresh and flavorful.  We each chose the petite filet mignon that was perfectly cooked to medium rare as requested and accompanied by an impressive amount of garlic mashed potatoes plus several baby carrots. We doggie bagged a single slice of chocolate mousse cake.   Our food was excellent and the service throughout the evening was seamless. The final bill came in just $3 short of our $150 comp.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best of Las Vegas
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hallway

JjdIM5tIWZTyIlO03jhmMQ.text: Wow... where to begin.  The seafood sampler appetizer was truly horrible.   I have no idea what breed of oysters they use but what little flavor they had was odd... not off, just odd.  Don't let them tell you there are 4 crab legs... there are 2 single sections cut in half (for 4 pieces) and they are old and meal-y.  The shrimp were large but also pretty flavorles and obviously not Black Tigers.  I will say on the plus side, their house made blue cheese dressing was passable and the lettuce wedge was crisp and freshly cut.  The negative comments regarding unseasoned meat are correct, but I prefer that personally.  Proper aging gives all the flavor you would need but sadly (regardless of the aging room prominently displayed as you walk in), this meat is barely aged.  I would suggest they clean their grills, though, as the char marks had a bad flavor to them that detracted from the overall flavor instead of enhancing it.  Service was good (the only reason they got 2 stars instead if 1) although no one inquired as to why we allowed the seafood to be cleared having barely been touched.  At $61 and the highest priced single item on the menu I would have thought there would have been at least a little curiosity... unless they know in advance that it is sub-par and just count on the lack of sophistication of most guests to get them by, of course.  I don't care what kind of awards they've won, this is a place to avoid.   If you want a GOOD traditional steakhouse experience in Las Vegas go to the Golden Steer.

I-cSSHZ94hhXLALS130iJw.text: The Steak House has been my favorite  restaurant for about a decade. No other reason to go to Circus Circus, Lord knows. Great service. Delicious  food.  I love the Alaskan king crab legs, baked potato, house salad and a glass of Merlot. Bottled water is the standard. Lots of food! I walk out full and having dined sufficiently!  I love that place. I've been to several reataurants--even outside of the US, and the Steak House is still my favorite!

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My crab legs before they are devoured!

47hgzEezOoA5cA8oy8QCEQ.text: Went with a group. The steak was purportedly great, the mashed potatoes too. Everything else was poorly prepared, rather like diner food. If you are not all ordering steak, skip it!  OK I'll me more constructive: Don't put spices on crab meat, it ruins it. Don't put bacon in everything, many people cannot eat. The wild rice was overcooked and extremely salty. Everything was salty. The fish was not cooked correctly. The sauted mushrooms tasted weird. Canned perhaps? The asparagus was OK, but simply cooked. Microwaved?  So again, red meat eater's only.

xNosrLQzCGVoGmX5Fcq5tQ.text: My boyfriend and I came here recently after touring he kitschy disappointment that is the Circus Circus hotel.   This place is a True hidden gem, and a great part of old Vegas. Gorgeous dark wood, red leather, green and gold accents throughout, with an old school playlist and waiters in black bow ties. We enjoyed several cocktails at the bar and enjoyed the company of our fabulous bartender, Brian.  This place is a must if you want a great classic steakhouse experience. I can't wait to make it a tradition to come here for every Vegas trip.

GOIQr46c4N8iAVjIXDcC1g.text: Enjoyed our food thoroughly ! Steaks, crab legs, service and atmosphere ! We visited several times and always came back for more. A good find.

YprEHeztedRRFIDUj4N7xA.text: One of the best steak dinners ever. Huge portions, great value. Salad, baked potato or mashed potatoes and veggies. Ribeye on the bone was awesome!

A7s0MUdDPMAKtrhpbURVag.text: My boyfriend took me here for my bday on April 10th and I was like "really circus circus" he said it was one of the best in Vegas and he was right! You can see the meat being aged right there. Service was great and the lobster and steak were perfect. This and SW are my favorite steak houses! 10/10.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top notch Australian lobster tail and I shared my boyfriends petit filet 10/10!
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing chocolate covered strawberries they comped me for my birthday !

adCyUn-3W2TQuVjzVAdLog.text: This is a great place to eat.  A hidden gem!!  The food is not only incredible but the service is out of this world.  Great place for a romantic dinner or a nice night out with the kids.  It is not on the cheap side but if you have kids that love steak and can handle a nice atmosphere then check this place out.  They take reservations and are on open table so my suggestion if you want to go plan ahead!!

S2WIJt_pyzg8WBfTOM-MyQ.text: The service and room were both wonderful. The lamb chops Were the best i've ever had. If it had not been for the obnoxious man at the next table wearing the 70's leisure suit our dinner would have been fantastic!

-qWkNfCvbIE9Khpc7UuKJw.text: I had seen this restaurant on the show Food Paradise and kept it in the back of my mind.  We were recently in Vegas for a convention and it was easy to talk my group into dining there.  Even though we went there pretty early we couldn't get a table because we didn't make reservations.  We asked to sit at the bar and that was fabulous.  Our waitress and bartender were so friendly and funny and the environment was very relaxing. Sitting at the bar allowed us to make friends with other people and just had a blast.   I haven't even gotten to the food. It was AMAZING!!! I had a Bloody Mary, extra spicy. So delicious!  They brought us out a basket of different breads and the cutest slabs of butter with little bull shapes on top.  We all ordered the same thing.  Ribeye on the bone.  Seriously one of the best steaks I've experienced. It was huge and flavorful.  I love that A1 sauce was not even offered because it's all about the meat.  It was accompanied by Asparagus and a huge baked potato.  I was only able to eat half of my steak, my salad and the veggie.  I took the other half home with my entire baked potato and had that for breakfast the next morning.  Definitely a place I'll go to again and in my opinion was worth every penny spent.

4U-c26AJANfx8YwX48nsBA.text: The AC was broken in a section the night in mid August 2015 we were here. Why did they seat is in that section? It was really difficult to enjoy anything in that stifling environment but I can say with clarity- their steaks are amazing. Great cuts and grilled to perfection. I will give them another shot when I'm next in LV.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. RL ain&#39;t got nothing on this place!

tyMADdbZRp-jyyrwozx_5A.text: A bunch of locals told us this was the best steak in town, and don't be fooled that it is in Circus Circus. Lived up to its billing. We each had the bone-in ribeyes, and they were cooked perfectly and were delicious. Great atmosphere, preserves the look of old-time steakhouses. Wait staff friendly and knew their products well. You'll pay close to $70 for a steak but you get a salad and sides with it. Great experience.

ciW7aT_mV0lOqEKAcsgZcg.text: You'd never expect to find this kind of restaurant in Circus Circus. We were invited by clients for dinner so had no say and went with a lot of hesitation.  Truth is, we were very surprised! It's an old school type steakhouse with the open kitchen and mahogany leather booths. Service was very good and welcoming.  Food was great,  too - both in price and quality.  All dishes come with an appetizer of soup or salad,  and a side of potatoes or rice.  Our table had the rib eye, salmon, and halibut.  The halibut was dry but everything else was good. Full bar also helped the experience!

vvKEOFKDUtZkOL9ehisHxg.text: An overall great experience, fist time there, we sat in a booth, which was great, we were celebrating  my wife's birthday. They got my order wrong, gave me a baked potato instead of mashed, they brought out the mashed potatoes without hesitation and promptly, they brought out a slice of cake (chocolate) and wished her a happy birthday.  I loved the experience and the feel of the restaurant. Romantic and old Las Vegas feel to it.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wFKjb_yeGGnf-0d7IyKEBg.text: Being an unabashed carnivore who has a passion for the fascinating ,and sometimes sordid, history of Las Vegas, The Steakhouse at Circus Circus was a truly memorable experience that seems to have been tailor made for me!  (OK, I just flashed back to the Yelp! South Park episode where Kyle's dad goes into these long winded and terrifically verbose reviews. My bad.)  Anyways, back to this incredible experience!   Having to navigate through Circus Circus and the hordes of kids was pretty annoying, but once you step through that archway it almost feels like you are being transported to a different time. They definitely kick up the a/c in there and you could feel it instantly!  The room is a throwback to classic, old school Vegas. I LOVE IT! Lots of dark oaks, dim lighting, and romantic music are some of the first things that hit my senses. The other thing....  ...the incredible aroma of steak being perfectly cooked and marinated! Wow! It smelled so good in there!   Nancy was our server this evening and she was outstanding! Very friendly and attentive service, without being at all intrusive. When we return(which is about a 100% guarantee at this point), we will certainly request her!   We were seated promptly and within 2 minutes were brought a bread bowl with butter and served our drinks. Service was done in a very timely fashion very little lull between items. The bread was warm and soft, so the butter just melted perfectly inside. I didn't want to fill up on bread so I just had a couple of pieces.  As for the main course, we both opted for the New York Strip Steak ($56), which came with a choice of house salad or  black bean soup (I had the house salad) and garlic mashed potatoes or a baked potato.   The garlic mashed potatoes were so good! Compared to the puny and bland portion we recieved at another strip restaurant the previous week, this really hit the spot!  But the steak! Oh, that NY Strip steak was so delectable! It was so tender and juicy, the knife just fell to the plate with ease with each cut. We were both wildly impressed with how flavorful it was! Without a doubt, one of the best steaks i've ever had in my life!  Service was beyond outstanding! Our glasses were never empty the entire meal! It really made the difference between having a good meal and an experience!  Nancy asked if we would like to have desert, but we were totally stuffed and had to throw in the towel at that point! But, rest assured, we will be back! Oh, we will be back!  5 stars!  Woohoo! As good as it gets!

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY strip steak
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frank playing a 10 cents slot at the Sands wayyyyy back in the day!

z-iPmhRP560fa0pcmAYsWw.text: I didn't expect that several people would tell me the best steakhouse on the strip was in Circus Circus. I must say this was a great recommendation. The ribeye and salmon were cooked perfectly. In fact, everyone enjoyed their food. We didn't have any complaints. Service was excellent also. I will definitely return and recommend it to others.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet chili glazed salmon with wild rice blend and asparagus
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye with garlic mashed potatoes and asparagus

PxAe9P3Qu65ml2vvCecSWw.text: Ok ... let me start by saying that don't be turned because this restaurant is in the circus circus hotel and casino.  Yes ... the walk to the steakhouse was lousy. loud kids running everywhere and it was pretty crowded when we went. But once we got to the restaurant all was peaceful inside.   We had a reservation for our date night so we were seated right away.   Everything we ordered from the salads to the main course was amazing. The food is so good. The waiter was very nice and the table side service for our salads was a nice touch.   We will definitely visit again .

9zAle2kUqW9rW4dyX2rhGA.text: This is a Nice cozy steak house for a True experience but that's what it is.. the experience... I've eaten at plenary of steakhouses and this one is average at best... let's progress thru the meal...  The drink... double Woodford Reserve on the rocks... a very generous pour and nothing but kiddos there..  The bread... they bring you out a variety basket of some truly different breads... problem is the bread was cold and so was the butter... sux eating medallion butters cold and not spreadable... one of these needs warmed up....  The salad... if I get a salad at a high end steak house I don't spect the salad to set the first impression bar high... this one failed on so many levels... first off they used standard packaged lettuce from a cheap dealer and half my salad was the hard white "heart" pieces of lettuce... the lattice cut carrots and cucumbers were a nice touch but the epic fail was the dressing.. the bleu cheese dressing was a bland almost ranch ... like they used hidden valley and sprinkled sub par finely chopped bleu cheese onto it....   The entree... bone in ribeye with steamed asparagus and a rice pilaf...kinda... the rice was well cooked and had decent flavor... the asparagus was nicely cooked with a little snap to it... the steak was perfectly cooked medium rare but lacked a great flavor... was just ok... it needed seasoned and for a 65 dollar steak it was a two cut steak(meaning two swipes of the knife to cut a bite off)... the steak in all aspects truly failed to believe... I have had better steaks at a longhorn steakhouse...   Not saying it was a bad place but with so many great steakhouses in one place I'd deff go somewhere else and spend a $150 on a great meal...

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2QNrO238yu-iXIxU3LYrxA.text: Outstanding!!!! Amazing!! Our Waiter (Mike) was very knowledgeable of all the cuts. These guys are not playing around.  It ain't cheap! Just go and fine dine.  Mike M. Encino, Ca.

R74ZjtmbF8y0DMbj47QHbw.text: This is one of the coolest steakhouses in Las Vegas! It's a chance to relive old Vegas and have a great steak too. This place is in the Circus Circus and has been around since the mid 1980s. Such a cool atmosphere, you feel like you're in one of those old Vegas films. And on your way in, you pass the freezer with the steaks aging inside, and then you pass the actual grill in the middle of the restaurant with steaks sizzling right in front of you. Anyway, the steaks are big and good.

tN_1B03OTW6W4mElnRZQ3A.text: Since we got married in vegas we had our first night in vegas dinner here in the private room with some family and guests. The service was phenomenal, the food was amazing as always. The only thing I missed was they didn't do the "salad build" at the table given that we were a large group.   My husband ordered a large steak, I ordered the garlic prawns and we made our own surf and turf by sharing.   Cheesecake was rich and delicious.   Nice that we could charge our meal to our room at the MGM Grand.   This is always one of my must dine at restaurants when in Vegas and I hope to get to visit again soon.

8iccFRj1jK_V-6C5tQz-SA.text: Our family of 5 ( 3 children ages 13,11,10) had dinner and were treated no differently than if my husband and I were out alone. Tito was a great waiter! We love coming here because the staff rarely turns over.  We always order the petite fillet and are never disappointed. They were cooked perfectly. The garlic mashed potatoes are so yummy! My 13 yr old daughter had the black bean soup instead of salad and she loved it.

6uwoBleOT0Vo-XX5ROB29Q.text: Excellent food!!! We have been there 3 times- always happy when we leave. Food is SOOOO GOOD! Friendly & fast service!  Can't wait to go back!

Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quiet n relaxed environment! Friendly service!
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Even their breads are delicious!

Ws4iiAW5JSW4EdbrahZqUA.text: Who the heck would've guessed that the BEST Steak House in Las Vegas is at Circus Circus.  Holy Cow, I sure wasn't planned for it.  I came because my friend recommended it, so I decided to give it a try and man, a risk that was well taken.  So we had the the Rib Eye Surf N' Turf with the King Crab Legs. I must say that I'm not a big fan of Steaks because they are usually too dry for me.  I am definitely not a seafood eater, but both of these entrees sure got me to reevaluate my order in the future at a fancy restaurant.  The price, however, it shows three stars on Yelp, so it's no surprises that it will be a little heavy. However, I guarantee you that it will worth every buck. In addition, each order is enough for two.   Tips: The Onion Soup and the Galic Mash potatoes are also outstanding. Highly recommend that you make reservations,. especially during Holidays.  Customer Service: 5/5 Cleanliness: 5/5 Atmosphere: 5/5 Price: 4/5 Quality: 5/5 Quantity: 5/5

Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib Eye Steak with Butter Asparagus
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Ymmy King Crab Legs

6cebQi4VmOh0HAAWHvFGjw.text: We love this cozy, old school steakhouse. Steaks are delicious and drinks are generous. All steaks come with soup or salad, bread, your choice of potato and the vegetable of the day.  Staff is friendly and the atmosphere is laid back. I'm not a fan of Circus Circus in general but we never miss eating here while in Vegas!

4BDvDD9rp3bQ86v8OrwQyg.text: I am a big fan of steak.   This restaurant is rated very high on yelp and some other blogs.   We find that the meat quality is so high...the locker kept the dry aged beef is right at the entrance with a glass door.  We walked by and the beef was saying "Hello".  Our rib eye with bone cooked on charcoal tasted extremely good.    It's an open kitchen and we can see how they cook. The time control, seasoning, rest time they are all the same as you can find on YouTube. But how they aging the beef makes the different. Another key is the control of the charcoal fire.   We had the medium rare which was crispy outside (but not burnt) and juicy inside. The meat was so soft and tender which has nothing stay between teeth's. It's a almost perfect steak I would say.   Very good experience. Top choice if anyone staying at LV for one night. Everyone love steak should try.

RK9wdjnfSLnBWRiHGVr5PA.text: We stayed at Circus Circus. It was late Saturday night and I wanted to stay so I thought we would give this place a try. The service was okay. I was not impressed with the bread. The butter was hard as a rock. My wife had the salmon and it was very plain. I had the ribeye. It was very average nothing special. But it was very expensive. I expected more for the price. And the server was okay. Again nothing very special.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s_sVf-nRJ5vTh-QUHRakOw.text: My wife and I visit one steak house a year in our annual trip to las vegas. This year based off of some locals recommendations we tried The steak house at circus circus.   Was it the best steak I've ever had? No. Was the steak and service good? Yes. We were actually told the prices were cheaper than most strip steakhouses and sides were included. Part of this is True. Both meals came with a choice of salad and a side which was nice but we felt like the prices have increased significantly since previous posts. My wife had the chicken ($40) and I had the New York Strip ($64). Both prices are in line with modern steakhouses. If you want old school vegas feel and great service its worth a try. If you want a little better steak and modern try any of the newer casinos.

hnqG6O-oCXnbSNsGDO8tLA.text: This restaurant is located in the dumpy Circus Circus hotel. I felt extreme trepidation walking through the hallways to get there because it's like a swap meet. You'll see random tables outside the stores with junky knick knacks and dust catchers everywhere. Once you enter the restaurant, it's like being teleported to another land. The interior is "old school" with dark wood. Be sure to bring your automated external defibrillator if you're  expecting Sizzler prices cuz this food is  pricey. I had the petite filet mignon (medium rare) and my spouse chose the bone-in rib eye. They were delicious! My husband usually complains about how his steak is prepared but I didn't hear  one negative word. We both ordered the garlic mashed potatoes and vegetables - also very good. Bravo to our wisecracking servers!

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SUi0ygqaypm9Obn9BABVbA.text: Possibly the best meal I've had, and I'm used to fine dining.  The surf & turf was perfection.  I loved everything about this place.  It's "old -Vegas" style, it's dark, romantic,old-school & classy.  What a gem hidden in Circus Circus.  We happened upon it when a stranger at the airport happened to mention it- and I'm so glad we tried it.  We will be back every year in January when we're in town for The World of Concrete.

8ZRcFsOTHz4fbg_E_Ygb1g.text: Throw back, old-school steak house where nothing much has changed in 40 years, including the bar tender or his vest. Once you get over the fact that you came to Circus Circus for dinner and step inside THE Steak House, you step into yesteryear and the Mecca of wood-fired steaks--seriously!   Our party of 10 was crammed tight into the tiny bar (seating capacity: 8) while our table was being prepared. The crusty old bar tender poured stingy, meticulously measured cocktails, squeezing every dime out of each liquor bottle while we were tantalized by the aroma of grilled steak creeping around the corner.   Not the best start to the evening, but fortunately, not an indicator of what would follow. After a short wait, we were led to the dining room via a narrow, dimly lit passage way that meandered by the dry aging room and then the meat tender who was man handling the nicest cuts of beef I've ever seen, slinging them around the wood-fired grill like nobody's business.   The service was super attentive and the kitchen is efficient. The steaks were as good or better than--and as generously portioned as any on the strip--or anywhere for that matter, including NYC.  The meat was as flavorful and flame crusted as your imagination allows. The clubby man-friendly atmosphere is somewhat reminiscent of the original Mortons in Chicago or Sparks in NYC--Dark wood, dim lighting, burgundy colored upholstery. I used to think Hugo's Cellar in the 4 Queens downtown was the best old-school steak house example remaining in Vegas, but The Steak House at Circus Circus has Hugo's Cellar beat by miles.   If you're too young to remember what great steakhouses used to be like (and should still be like) before they all became mechanized look-alike and feel-alike big chains (think Ruths Chris, Flemmings, Morton's, and Del Frisco's and more recent entrants like Eddie V's, Perry's, etc.) you must try The Steak House and compare. It's not as old as Taditch Grill (SF) or St. Elmo's (Indy) or even Keen's (NYC), but it is better, less costly and every bit as old-school.  THE Steakhouse is a destination unto itself even if you're not into the whole "Circus Circus thing". I took a cab from the Wynn and am glad I did. SW has nothing on THE Steakhouse!

1RJ3FPvxtGlPeBsPcVxUKw.text: Damn, 26 years goes by fast.  We've been dinning here at least ten times over all those years.  Had our Anniversary dinner here at the end of our most recent trip to Vegas.  It was great as usual.  My GF, her daughter, and myself.  We ordered-  Huge shrimp cocktail. Oysters on the half shell. One Ribeye steak.  I'm going to say it was at least 24oz. Double Lobster Tails, easily 10oz to 12oz each. Split up the salads, choice of dressings. Two baked potatoes, and they threw in a third at no charge because that's the kind of place this is!    We could barely finish the steak and lobster we were so full.  Everything was outstanding.  They brought out a nice piece of chocolate cake for our Anniversary.   I had a lemon drop martini and the Queen of Reseda had a glass of Pinot Noir.    The bill came to $212.00 before tip.  What a deal for dinner for three!  Best value in Las Vegas.  The steak house at Circus Circus is the best.  Can't say enough good things about the place.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Colossal Shrimp Cocktail!
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great Oysters!

GbgK08mooeXM8VvLs6ReCA.text: Had the 8oz fillet! Once again amazing!! Wait staff is extraordinary! This place is iconic and the food is always the best in Vegas!!!

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium Rare Fillet does not get any more perfect than this!

EHqleyqtl1FH8CW6OpZ0DQ.text: Working on the strip for many year. I always herd great things about this steakhouse. That's all people ever talked about. At work I won some comps for this place and brought my friends. I was very impressed with the presentation. The manager came over to our table twice to make sure everything was satisfactory....and believe me it was. The waiter was very polite and was on the ball with our food. I can see why this place won so many awards. Our friends who we took with us can't stop thanking us for taking them there.

7xMxznhGGhhEjRzWPuOC3g.text: We came here to check it out.  I'm a Chauffuer on the strip and have done a couple of rides for people in a limo coming for dinner...  Curiosity got the better of me and I had to come try it out. I don't personally recommend a place unless it's either highly recommended, word of mouth or I have firstly tried it out myself....  Service was slow, there were no cocktail or desert menus.  We started with some fresh breadsticks and a variety of dinner rolls, some with raisins. The sweet raisin bread rolls seemed oddly out of place... perhaps a sundries tomato filling or garlic and herbs if anything would have been more palatable than raisin buns...     I don't want to order a cocktail and get slammed with a $40 charge for a drink that may or may not have ice flown in from some glacier somewhere.  Or a mystical $35 charge for a Creme Brulee that was harvested and helicoptered in from Mt Brulee....  I enjoyed my House Salad, nicely presented with Red Wine Vinaigrette. I would dare to say as a tip perhaps get the Vinaigrette on the side. It was a bit zesty for my liking.  My partner loves French Onion soup and tried the Surcharged French Onion soup instead of the house salad. He's comments on the soup that he did not finish was a pokey tongue raspberry sound....  Fresh cracked pepper was offered on the salads only...  My Steak was cooked well, as ordered, a good Medium cook. Seemed to lack some good flavor. Was just blah.  Broccolini was nicely steamed crisp to the bite, lightly seasoned.    Garlic Mash was essentially boring. Nothing special. Forgetful.  Drink refills were slow and the booth was pretty crammed for a party of 4.  My main issue with The Steak House at Circus Circus was the quality of meal for the money.  At around $100 a person there are at least 2 quick references I would recommend hands down over sending someone here.  I can not personally recommend this place.  Glad I tried it out for myself and that I would not wrongfully suggest this steakhouse to others....

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye Med cook with Garlic Mash and Broccolini
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salads and Apple Martini&#39;s for our guests
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Onion Soup

xeMFFDe0zAR9YJZDOlnGVQ.text: Ate there because of the reviews.  Needless to say, pretty disappointed with the steak. We both ordered the porterhouse and both steaks were pretty burned.  It was hard to get the burned taste out of your mouth. The worst part was the lack of seasoning. There was NO seasoning at all.  Baked potato could use some improvement. The bacon tasted stale like it was taken off the buffet the day before.  They offered a few toppings but cheese was definitely missing.  The only thing that saved the evening was the excellent service.  It was like we had two waiters and we were treated very well.  Oh, and also the bread saved the day.  That was some good bread.  The steakhouse would do better selling bread rather than steaks.  I don't see where all the other 4+ reviews come from.  There are better steaks out there.

Aewyn-36gHnJZ-20ZhwEWQ.text: Top notch.  Pricey and not in the best location but worth every penny.  The ribeye melted in my mouth.  Will definitely go there again when in town.

tyFU1i80gpidThXENaRQeA.text: FANTASTIC!! I stayed at the Circus Circus from 9/13 thru 9/16 of 2018. i did not know about The Steak House prior to my stay. FYI, this is a fine-dining restaurant. I ate dinner at The Steak House Friday and Saturday evenings 9/14 and 9/15 2018.  Entrance: There is short, well decorated and CLEAN hallway leading to the host/hostess station. I did not have a reservation and fortunately did not need one as I was dining solo and prefer to sit at the bar. The hostess was COURTEOUS, PROFESSIONAL and KNOWLEDGEABLE. The hostess sat me at the bar upon my request and provided a dinner menu and wine/cocktail list.   Bar: The bartender briefed me on the dinner and drink specials. I had a Maker's Mark with sprite and Stella draft. I'm mostly a beer guy, however i did notice Johnny Walker BLUE on the top shelf. FYI...it's $34 per shot which is a typical restaurant price. The manager passed by to greet me and make small talk.   Food: Appetizer: shrimp cocktail; I had the full order of 4 jumbo shrimp. Each shrimp was as big as my hand and i'm 6'0" 230 lbs.  I ordered the porter house the first night and the 12 oz filet mignon the next night, both med-well, with loaded baked potato and caesar salad both nights. The beef here is PRIME RIB 21 DAY AGED. The bread service featured three styles of bread, two slim bread sticks, two different sized rolls. The B&B was warmed such that the butter was softened. Which is a nice touch overlooked by other establishments.  The steaks were cooked to PERFECTION, the salads and apps were great!  Service: The service is excellent! The staff are experienced, confident, and engaging.    Ambience: AROMA!  The aroma of the 21 day aged Prime Rib is absolutely mouth watering and INTOXICATING.  The steak House features an open grilling area in the dining room. the restaurant motif is that of early Vegas. And represents nevada's western and beef industry heritage.   Cost/Comparison: The prices are consistent with fine dining steakhouses and perhaps little more. I recently dined at Smith and Wollensky Boston, which is great! I would actually rank The Steak House a notch above.   Take-Home Message: Dine here!  You will love it!

77USEQMjnQ4DLiHmCvaHsQ.text: Whoa! One of Las Vega's Best Kept Fine Dining Secrets!! This place has a class and charm that will behoove the younger generation. Here is a Steakhouse that hasn't forgotten what a steakhouse is supposed to be. The room is rich with dark woods, hardwood walls, diamond tufted red leather booths, creating a cozy den-like ambience, romantic candlelit dinners, real gentlemen seating you, bartenders that perfect their craft, cuts over 3 week-real aged beef with their very own meat locker display! The kind of stuff legends are made of... nothing short of a kind of joint the rat pack would have been proud to grace.  Having said the former, "The SteakHouse" at Circus Circus has been voted Best of Las Vegas for over 20 years and was named Zagat's 2011 Top Steak House in Las Vegas and received Zagat's award ratings for the 2014 year, as well as being named top 10 by The LasVegasSun.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lLSWdXrtOFr2mhmYasNc_w.text: We splurged and it was the right decision. My filet mignon and his prime rib were cooked just the way we like them. Roberto was very attentive but not overly, and the New York cheesecake topped with strawberries was the best. We'd definitely go back!

RdUPznquFioktOIGGwefvA.text: My friend and I racked up enough points from playing all day and found out we could use them at the steak house located in circus circus. We were so excited because we heard good things and the smell that constantly lingered in your nose after walking by was amazing!  We entered the place to hopefully be seated right away. The mananger was standing at the hostess post and asked how he could help us. We went on to say we wanted a table for two. He then followed it up with "well you need to make a reservation ". The place was not busy AT ALL but we agreed to it and made one. He told us the wait would be 45mins. Mind you, we walked in straight from gambling all day so we were not dressed up- far from it actually and we really didn't want to leave to change, so we sat down and waited. The manager kept looking at us as if he wanted us to change and about 15mins later he came up (after realizing we weren't going anywhere) to say he could seat us... this is when the horrible experience begins. We go around the corner to be seated and noticed only 2-3 tables were active. We sit down and giggled cuz we felt so out of place. The table arrangement was nice, as you can see in one of the photos. There were 2 waiters so we expected everything to run smoothly- we were wrong. Our waiter saw us and continued to service his other table. We sat for a good 30mins just waiting for drinks. I'm thinking this was done puposely to see if we would leave because of our appearance but we stayed cuz we wanted steak. We put our drink order in finally along with our order so we didn't have to wait longer. We got soup, another one of the pics, it looked better than it tasted. Totally not worth it to be honest. When our steaks came, the other pic, we got so excited cuz they looked phenomenal- far from it. We took a bite and looked at each other surprised cuz there was no...flavor...at all! And the potatoes were cold! We took a couple more bites and said screw it. Our waiter didn't check on us until another good 30mins and when he did we voiced our disappointment. He gave us attitude and got the manager. When he cane over we explained to him as well our disappointment and he was shocked that both of us had the same problem and proceeded to ask us to try another bite and we said we did (it was obvious) and then explained that we didn't want anything else. He then was trying to be nice after being kind of a jerk and offered another meal- we got crab legs and rice, they were OK, better than the steak for sure. Either way, this place IS NOT worth the money out of pocket and we will NEVER go back, even with points. The whole experience seemed stereotypical towards us because we were young, in our 30s, have tattoos, and were completely dressed down. They had no idea that we had money, which we did. It was like something out of the movie Selena... don't judge a book by its cover!! To this day I believe our experience and customer service (or extreme lack of) was the reason behind this. Sorry steak house,  but you were rude and horrible!

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1qI-VnUUvpD78egHGrlcRA.text: Had to at least try the famous circus circus steakhouse that is a staple here in las vegas. It was great talking to the staff and hearing that they have been part of the circus circus hotel for 20-30yrs. The atmosphere is a very fun old school steakhouse feel.   The oysters weren't shuxked and had a lot of broken shell. I guess I shouldn't have expected too much by ordering seafood at a steakhouse. I thought well, this is a nicer establishment and they should have good quality stuff. Oops.   Anyways, my husband and I ordered both our meats rare as we are carnivores. Mine comes out perfect, his is cooked more medium. The waittress was amazing, she came back once we cut into our meat to check on us. She could easily tell that the meats were cooked differently and immediately offered to fix it. The replacement steak was cooked beautifully. Hats off to the waittress and chef to quickly make a happy customer.   Dessert and appetizers were wonderful, and added to the complete meal experience for our wedding anniversary.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate mousse cake, we had the same restaurant week menu in 2016 from 2015, but it works, no complaints.
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet oscar
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black bean soup

BfQ74DRqp7Hh_Uk7IIDvfA.text: Made a reservation for 2 to celebrate our anniversary. We heard about this restaurant on some food show on tv & decided this is where we were going.   We arrived 30 minutes earlier than our reservation time hoping we could get seated & we did!   Our server was Richard; who had many great recommendations and provided us with great service.   I ordered the bone in ribeye ($66) & he ordered the porterhouse ($66) and we both got salads (huge portion) and garlic mashed potatoes (YUM!). Both the steaks were so soft and tender! They even gave us a delicious slice of chocolate cake with chocolate mousse on the house for our celebration.   The lighting was romantically dimmed and everything about that dinner experience was wonderful.. except maybe not the lady sitting at the middle table who kept staring at us.. but I can't really blame her.. they WERE seated right smack in the middle.

photos.caption: Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate mousse cake on the house!
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheers!
Photo of THE Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Porterhouse with garlic mashed potatoes

ejxNks9Hq48De8r6AnwQBA.text: We won a $150 dinner credit for the Steakhouse while attending a Travel Show back in March. We have to be honest, had we not won the credit, we would not have dined here.   Our reservations were made for us on the date and time that we specified through the Sales Department. Goofy as I can be sometimes, I remembered the date but not the time so I had to call the restaurant from our hotel room (yes, we stayed at Circus, Circus; check my separate review on that). The hostess answered, found my name right away and confirmed that we were due in at 6:30pm and was that time okay or did we need to make an adjustment? I told her that we would be there at 6:30.  We arrived on time and were immediately greeted and taken to a booth where menus and a wine list were presented. Our waiter's assistant came by with a bread basket and poured still water for us. He assured us that Felix, our waiter would be by shortly.  Felix arrived with a friendly smile and what I would call an abundance of old school charm. He took our drink orders. When he returned with the drinks, he asked if we had any questions or were ready to order.   I had two questions. The first was regarding the appetizer Seafood Sensation and what all was included on it. He said that it came with four oysters on the half shell, four prawns and four Alaskan King Crab legs. Okay, we can do that please.  My other question was whether their prime rib was salt encrusted or rosemary encrusted. For that question, he went and asked the chef to be sure. When he returned, he told me that it was salt encrusted rather than the rosemary which I preferred.  I went with the prime rib anyway. Rare. Bone-in. 32-ounces. House Salad with Blue Cheese. Baked Potato, loaded. It also came with Chef's Vegetables which was buttered asparagus. When my entree was served, the hunk of prime rib was so rare and so tall that heads turned either to admire it or in fear as it went by. It was absolutely fantastic! The Au Jus served with the beef wasn't the typical thin, over salted brown water served at so many restaurants but a thicker concoction with a depth of flavor that was simply wonderful.  She had the Rib Eye. Medium Rare, Bone-in. Not nearly as large as mine. The rest of her meal was the same as mine.   I asked Felix to slow down the timing of our meal. With such a large appetizer, we didn't want to get swamped with the salads and the entrees. He was kind enough to ask us when he took away the carnage that we created with the Seafood Sensation, how long we wanted to wait for the salads to be served. We were primed and ready to go and I asked him to bring them on!  The Seafood Sensation was very good. Everything was served sitting on a bed of ice and well chilled. The oysters were big and meaty as were the prawns. The King Crab legs were a bit misleading in that instead of four legs, we received four 1/2 legs. Each leg had been split down the middle on a band saw. A minor quibble, we had plenty to eat and it was all delicious! We each also  received a small plate with a 1/2-lemon wrapped accordingly to keep the lemon pits from falling onto our food. There was also a container of Cocktail Sauce as well as a container of Mayo/Creamed Horse Radish?. On the seafood display, there was another small container of Horse Radish.  For dessert, we split a Bananas Foster and each had a cup of coffee.    Between Felix and his assistant, we were very satisfied with the service. During dinner, she had Iced Tea while I had a Diet Soda. Anytime our drinks were down to about 1/3 full, they were replaced with a fresh drink.   Yes, we exceeded our $150 certificate budget by nearly $100 including tip and tax but I will always remember that beautifully hunk of loveliness that was presented to me.
